title: Great employee T.Q.
text: Hotel created an amazing experience. Thanks to T.Q. at the front desk. He accommodated all our needs and very professional at what he does. We had a room with a beautiful view and parking was made easy. Would definitely stay a second time and recommend to others.

title: Location Location Location, superb!
text:
I’ll summarise at the start, had a fantastic 7 day stay here with my wife and 15 year old son and I would recommend this hotel for its location and stunning views. 

We managed to find a good flight and hotel deal here for April 2024 but after we booked it we started to panic a bit with some of the negative reviews we read on TA. Whilst there are some very valid points people have made, we found that the overall experience was excellent and really enjoyed our stay here. I hope this helps others who may be felling like we did after reading the reviews. 

We had a junior suite on the 27th floor and the view was spectacular as it was a corner room with amazing views of the oculus, WTC building, some of the uptown skyscrapers, Hudson River and the Brooklyn bridge. The location of this hotel is so convenient for many attractions in Downtown and you are spoiled for choice with places to eat and drink here. The oculus is a beautiful space and a great place for lunch and shopping as well as a convenient subway entrance for trains uptown. 

A few things to note, on top of the fee you have paid for the room there is a $40 a night resort fee. When you check in they will put a hold on your credit card of $600 and if you check out without spending anything like food or drinks then they will release the $600 minus your total resort fee. We were $280 for 7 nights and had no issues with the hotel releasing the fees or over charging us. I suggest you email the hotel before you go and ask them to confirm the charges prior to your visit so if there is any disparity then you have it in writing what you should have been charged. 

The swimming pool is not operational. The resort fee should be reduced to reflect this but it is not. This was disappointing as my son was really excited to use it but we were told it has been out of action since the pandemic and there are no plans to open it for the foreseeable. 

The rooms are dated and a bit shabby but the sheets and bathroom were clean and comfortable. 

There was a safe, a hairdryer, an iron and board, 2x large flat screen tvs and a phone with free international calls in the room but no fridge. We stayed in April so the temperature of the room was ok but I’d imagine in the summer and winter that the room would be uncomfortable as the AC didn’t really do anything but act as a fan. If you put it to its coldest setting or it’s warmest setting it didn’t do anything but blow out mildly cold air. 

The lifts were fully operational 6 out of the 7 days we were there but one day we had to use the service elevator and it was busy but no problem. 

Someone complained about the smell of Cannabis outside the hotel but I can tell you this is not a problem with the hotel, this smell is unfortunately ubiquitous to NYC as cannabis is legal here and there are shops everywhere selling it. I personally don’t have a problem with it but the smell is overwhelming and it is everywhere so definitely not an issue with the hotel. 

Taxi from JFK to hotel is about $75 fixed price so we’ll worth it as it is a long drive and the hotel will store your luggage when you check out at 11am until you need to leave for the airport. They even booked a taxi for us but the baggage guys will expect a small tip. 

Compared with many other cities it is not great value as the rooms are expensive even before the resort fee but in the context of NYC pricing it is actually reasonable. You won’t get Premier Inn prices anywhere in Manhattan but it truly is a special place so it is worth the extra expense IMO to stay here. Just don’t expect luxury for the price you pay and you’ll be right. NYC is such a busy place that you will not spend much time in your room anyway so location is they main factor and this hotel is blessed with an amazing location.

title: NY from it's best side
text: Nice hotel SUPER service from Petra in the front desk. Bar and breakfast personel nice and good service. Good choice of breakfast even if restaurant was under repair. Great location easy access to train. Nice view (54. Floor 😊) will visit again.

title: The atmosphere is incredible
text: The hotel is an excellent option in Manhattan, it is perfectly located, it is quiet, comfortable, safe, the staff is incredible, the views, it is a spacious room and allows you to rest, just improve the electrical part because it has some details.

title: Easter in New York
text:
The hotel is nice but could do with a lot of updating. It is located right in front of the Oculus, in a nice area well served by the metro. The only flaw is that, being in the financial district, in the evening we struggled to find open places to dine in.
The view from the higher floors is beautiful.
One unpleasant thing that really annoyed me were the resort fees that were applied to us without any warning and of which no one had warned us. Given the amount paid, I thought it was all included, yet that's not the case. This behavior is not very honest in my opinion. Only when we returned to Italy did we find the charge on the credit card left as a deposit.

title: Petra- great staff member
text: Petra from the Millennium Downtown was amazing! She really hooked us up. I made an error on my reservation, she was so professional and went above and beyond for us. I would highly recommend staying here on the upper floors. Beautiful views and very convenient to get around the city. We will be back.

title: Old but good
text:
Old furniture, rooms are Not very good cleaned. Location is perfect and the metro very close.
Depending on the price, we would come back. Emploees are very Kind and consceasous. We have Not testen the breakfast of Fitness room

title: Terrible service, money stolen.
text:
I was overcharged massively without authorisation and then offered a free cancellation by the Manager stating my funds would be returned to me.
This happened on 26th March and I am still yet to get anything back, they have also not informed me of when my money will be returned. (Over $2000)
When I was speaking with the manager about the issues there was also another guest complaining of similar but with a $5000+ over charge for her.
I would avoid at all costs.

title: Overcharged me and still don't have my money back.
text:
Was overcharged by almost double the reservation fee so refused to stay and I still don't have my money (over $2000) returned to me. There was also another woman who had been overcharged by $5000, I would avoid at all costs, staff were unhelpful, unfriendly with poor attitudes.

When will I get my money back?!

title: Great location!
text: We chose the Millennium for its proximity to the Perelman.  Great neighborhood, close to great shopping, subway stops, restaurants, the World Trade Ctr and the 9/11 museum/park/pool.  The staff was friendly and helpful!The hotel is old, toilets and sinks were shorter than average. The drapes and rods could stand replacing and the base of one of the full beds kept coming loose.

title: Nice Views Needs Maintenance
text:
Great location and stunning views of the city.  

In need of updates and maintenance; elevator, tv provider, shower, front doors, rotating door, no mini fridge, thin walls, gaps in door frame.  

Two drinks were over $55. Most staff was super friendly but one bellman made sure to point out that tips were appreciated before he retrieved our bag. 

For the cost we will likely look elsewhere next time.

title: A terrible need for improvement
text: No concierge desk, no restaurant (despite the photos on booking), breakfast in polystyrene boxes (nothing to do with the photos on booking), poor quality bedding, room only made every 3 days (apparently it's is indicated in rooms, but not seen the document in real) so the towels are not changed, the beds are not made, the trash cans are not emptied... There was a big problem with the elevators that we had to use the service elevators. The bed lamps did not work, no fridge in the room. As the rooms are not made, not enough towels, hand towels ... Poor service for a hotel at this price

title: Location, Location, Location
text:
This hotel turned out to be the perfect one for a stay in downtown NYC. I wanted to see the 911 Memorial and it was right outside my window. The staff were all pleasant and professional. The only downside is, that there was no water pressure and the bed was very low and very soft. 

I highly recommend this hotel.

title: This hotel ruined our stay in new York
text: Upon arrival our junior suite was given to other guests and we received a small double room which is much cheaper than what we paid for. Breakfast room service is a disaster, always late and with missing food. Staff completely ignored our requests. Overall opinion - this hotel is a worst experience ever

title: Perfectly adequate as far as NYC goes
text:
Beautiful, clean room (jr suite); comfortable bed; friendly staff; but an overall still a mediocre experience. It was conveniently located for our purposes but there’s and maybe we got them on a bad week but the disappointment is in the details. The lobby is gloomy and uninspired. Only 1-2 of the elevators were working (the standard claim of maintenance but considering the rest I’m not convinced it wasn’t for cost savings); couldn’t get the room temp above 69, though set controls to 71, and most times it kept going back to 67 leaving a bit of chill; only power outlets were on the desk; a refrigerator used to live there but that was gone. No restaurant; breakfast only. I have mobility issues so that left me to order delivery (which I had to retrieve from the lobby myself then wait in line as an aircrew cued for the 1 working elevator at that time). Nothing else but a street vendor within my own limited walking distance.

So a a place for the average visitor to lay their head at night, it’s great. But just feels like they’re cutting a lot of corners to survive, which eventually carry into the areas that are currently fine.

title: Nice Location
text: The view is unbelievable in front of One world. The stuff are so kind. I do not understand: the refrigerator doesn't work, because the price of room not include. Very good location in business district.

title: Great location but with minor issue
text: Super location and price was good. Additional fee post paying in full via booking website was not good. Lifts need attention as there were often only one lift operating or there was other issues and the service lift needed to be used. Staff all friendly and v helpful. Rooms comfortable and clean.

title: 1 elevator out of 3
text:
One elevator of three functional for floors 31 - 55.

Paper signs taped to the wall in the elevator lobbies instructing guests to use the service elevator.

I call the front desk...  "Where's the service elevator?"  They transfer me to "Security"...  No one picks up...  🙄  Wut? 

Clearly, this hotel is poorly maintained and run down.  Stay elsewhere.

title: amazing stay thanks to frances and her crew!
text: Perfect location, nice view, clean rooms, comfortable bed, friendly staff. the location is so convenient for anyone wanting to explore the city as the world trade center is right across the street as well as the train. we had the pleasure of meeting frances who was super professional and friendly. she ensured we were enjoying our stay the whole time

title: Great except departing experience
text:
After checking out, getting into my Uber, door man started giving grief to my Uber driver, doorman over reacting and trying to ‘tell me’ to not book Ubers, I live in Toronto and was with my relative from Ireland and did not at all appreciate being spoken to like I am getting ‘ripped off’ or being told how I should get to the airport, I come to NYC 4-5 times a year, I am very exposed to the reality that door men make extra cash from NYC cab service, that does not mean I need to be spoken down to for ordering a service that I prefer and choose where I spend my money.
I’ve stayed at the Millennium multiple times and this departing experience is making me rethink where I will book my stay for May

title: Nice Rooms, Nice View
text: The rooms are spacious, the view overlooking the Hudson is beautiful.  The staff is friendly, and the in-room amenities are nice (bottled water and coffee maker).  We had a safe that didn't lock which did not get fixed during our stay despite our request, but it was ok, nothing went wrong.

title: Great Location - but room update very much needed!
text: The view of the rooms are stunning. We got goosebumps every time we looked out the window. However, the rooms need a big big remodel inside. Carpet smelled a little funky and it was very dusty. Furniture old and scratchy.

title: Great!
text: The hotel was perfect for us.  We didn’t know what to expect and we were very happy.  We walked around the WTC site and we ate at Morton’s Steak House. We walked around Trinity Church and St Paul’s.  It exceeded our expectations

title: What a view!
text:
My family of 4 had a wonderful stay at the Millennium despite a small hiccup at the beginning. Although we couldn't check in until very late on the day we arrived - due to our room still not being ready - the staff was helpful and made up for it in several ways! Special thanks to Lisa P.!

The location was ideal, the view was breathtaking and the services were efficient. The breakfast served in the room was fresh and tasty. The rooms were simple but very spacious - our family of 4 was very comfortable in the junior suite. We look forward to returning very soon.

title: Lack of elevators
text: Great location and nice views from 42nd floor. However only one elevator in service out of three for the whole week of my stay meaning extremely long waits to get in and out of the building.  I had to literally wait more than 5 minutes for a lift to come. Sometimes. It was already too full to enter.

title: Not bad but could do with some modernization
text: Currently the restaurant is closed for refurbishment so breakfast is served in your room. The breakfast itself arrived on time, was exactly as ordered and was cooked well. I was unable to cool my room below 76 degrees which made it a little difficult to sleep, but the bed was comfortable and my room was large with great views over the city.  Overall, the hotel is a little tired but the location worked for me.

title: Good location for business trips if you don't mind rude staff, stained carpets and wet shower/bathtub when you check in!
text: Booked for 8 nights and checked out the next day. The location is good if you're on business. However you'll have to put up with - unfriendly staff with attitude, very dirty carpets, wet shower when you check-in. Also, the heater was way too loud even on low speed. To be fair, the size of the rooms are very decent for NYC.

title: Blood
text: There was a blood stain on the bed from the previous guest. When I told the reception they just apologized. I didn't like how they treated it as if it was a tea stain rather than a blood stain. The room was changed.  I hope this will never happen again .

title: Great e experience with Herman
text: I wanted to express my sincere appreciation for the exceptional guest service during my stay at your hotel. Herman (concierge) went above and beyond to ensure an enjoyable experience. Herman’s professionalism, attentiveness, and genuine care made me smile. Thank You for setting such a high standard of hospitality.

title: Not What it used to be
text: I've stayed at this hotel for many many years thinking it was upscale.  Since Hilton no longer owns it this hotel has gone downhill.   My room was outdated, no refrigerator, no smart TV, missing furniture, etc.  I had a glass of wine at the bar for $25!!!  I should have known better and ventured out for a cheaper option- but I was waiting for a co-worker so......I won't be staying here again until they make some renovations.  They are needed!!  OH and why at the peak of check in are there only 2 staff checking people in???  Loine out the door.  Best thing about this place is the bell hops.

title: 2-3 star hotel at best
text:
The hotel has fallen into disrepair since Hilton stopped managing the property. We cannot believe this hotel holds a 4 star rating ; it is 2 or 3 star at best. I stayed at 2 other 4 star hotels within a 5-10 minute walk during this trip, so the poor standard of this hotel in comparison was very clear. 

The bed: we were given an old and thin blanket which was barely covered by a thin bed sheet with holes in it. No duvet/comforter and it was the middle of winter. Sure, we could turn on the heating, but I had lovely duvets in the other two hotels. 

The bathroom: we were given just one crusty bath towel each. No bathmat towel, no hand towels, no face towel. I had the full set of towels and they were fluffy at the other two hotels. 

The elevator: in a bank of 4 elevators, only one elevator was working for our 3 night stay. The lines and the wait for the elevator were excruciating. On the morning of our checkout, the entire bank of elevators was not working at all - the down or up buttons did not work - and we were forced to walk down 37 flights of stairs to reception with our luggage. I see the hotel response to another guest who noted the same issue and it claims no accountability saying, “for future our team members are always available to assist” - that’s disingenuous because no staff answered our calls for help across a 30 min window before we decided the only answer left was to walk the 37 floors down the fire escape stairs.

The customer service: the person who checked us in was rude when we asked a few questions about the charges and the person who checked us out was just as rude- when we told him we had to walk down 37 floors, he showed no concern and wouldn’t look us in the eye.  

The hotel entry: for the entire duration of our stay, there would be people hanging out at the front door smoking marijuana. We had to endure the stench on entry and exit and the smell would blow into the lobby when the doors opened.

title: Worst hotel in NYC
text: Dirty, old, dilapidated hotel. Only 2 elevator was working during our stay, then the elevator broke during our trip (trapping people inside) causing 45 minute waits to use the staff elevators. The staff was rude and not accommodating. Horrible stay. We should have stayed near Times Square!

title: Elevator maintenance
text: Having a room on the 33rd floor with a lovely view was great until I experienced the elevators not working.  I waited and waited on Saturday for the elevator - too +7 minutes to come.  On Sunday mornign at 10am there were NO elevators working!   With 2 large suitcases it was a nightmare. The overall maintenance of the property has fallen.  The bedside lamp was hanging from the wall by a wire!

title: Accounting department trumps customer service at this property
text:
The hotel is in need of room renovations and updates (malfunctioning climate control systems, and shower head, elevators not working, etc.)
Also had a problem with the online reservation system which they said was beyond their ability to fix, that only the accounting department can rectify it.

title: Overpriced but great staff
text:
The hotel is overpriced for what they change. Very empty rooms and we had works done in the AM that woke us ip at 8am two night we were there. Honestly wouldn’t book again. 

One great thing was Kofi, which made our stay so enjoyable as soon as we exited the room! Very good care ✨

title: Views are amazing!
text: The views on high floors are AMAZING! Staff was always helpful & friendly. Great location! Rooms are seriously outdated, needs updated carpet & tv’s. General maintenance needed. Elevators were slow daily.

title: Great location
text: When booking, all amenities shown were not in the room. Thermostat never seemed to work right. Other than that it was a great stay. The Oculous and Workd Trade Center was right across the street. Food places everywhere within walking distance.

title: Avoid this hotel
text: Avoid this hotel, the only positive is view from your room, otherwise is is absolutely poor hotel service. Breakfast you do not receive any even if included in room rate, our third bed was not prepared, even after 4th complaint at reception….. They only benefit from the location, but better to stay elswhere than this hotel.

title: Mid week night away
text: great friendly staff. amenities good. Room appearance and cleanliness below standard. bathroom fixtures were old and worn out. Missing grout. Stains on carpets and drapes. stained furniture and worn out furniture. over all the trip was pleasant but room could use a renovation.

title: Business Trip
text: Rooms are shabby and dated with stains on the carpet. The sink faucets leak on the counter when turned on. The shower head is dated and crusty. The room smelled like smoke. The staff and house keeping were excellent. No dining option on premises for lunch or dinner.

title: Excellent location with great view but it needs a little renovation
text: The hotel has a prefect location directly to the 9/11 memorial. The rooms are pretty but they need a little renovation as it is getting old. The staff is friendly and you have subways all around the hotel so that you can easy get to other stations.

title: $600 Deposit?
text: Bathroom lights were too bright and need a dimmer switch. The Bathroom exhaust vent was clogged with dust and needed to be cleaned. The $600 deposit on top of the $1300 prepaid was unexpected. Otherwise a good stay in a wonderful place.

title: Value hotel in great location
text: This hotel has a great location in the financial district overlooking 9/11 monument and near Pace University.  Staff was kind and attentive.  Beds had clean, white linens.   Hallways and rooms can use updated painting and flooring. Has potential be a more upscale hotel if they did these changes. We got a very good rate and it was convenient and safe location to visit Pace University.

title: This hotel needs serious care
text: I'm not sure when the photos in the reviews were taken by the hotel, but it doesn't actually look like this at all. The hotel is so old, dark, and dingy. The front desk staff is unengaged and not at all affable. The bar is nice, and that's about it. My room wasn't nice, it was so hot cause the heat ran even though the wall unit was off (it's a typical winter thing in NYC, but still terrible). Overall, I picked this hotel because it's right across the plaza from my office and I was there for work, but next time, I'll choose a different hotel and walk a little further.

title: Overpriced
text: I’ve stayed in a hotel around the block for much less that was twice as nice, I’ll definitely go back there next time.  I just wanted to try something new, Might have been ok for 2, but the hide a bed was really bad.  I had 2 full beds for lower price .

title: Super bueno visitar
text: Me gusto mucho - las habitaciones y lo céntrico que estaba de todo.  Bueno para familias.  Las personas muy amables tanto en el front desk como los botones.  Siempre muy atentos y pendientes de nuestras necesidades.

title: Awesome Hotel
text: From check in to bell hops to bartenders in the hotel lobby, everyone was awesome and made our visit seamless and memorable! The location made for an great home base to see everything in the area on foot and short cab rides to Little Italy for dinner and a Greenwich Village jazz club

title: I had a pleasant stay.
text: Nice place to stay. Quiet with a great view! Value was also good. Bar and breakfast service was good. Right across the street from the Oculus. I actually like the eighties look of the interior. I will stay there again.

title: Over price, dirty and not very friendly
text:
Stains. Elevator shaky  help was not friendly, the entrance rotation door out of order , no help to open front doors which were extremely directly to open heavy and the wind made it almost impossible, rotating entrance walk through was out of order. The room was so hot we couldn’t sleep at night we were told building was on winter mode and the lobby bathroom is only for guest with key was Disgusting 
The two good things 
Location and view. Not worth the money charged

title: Great location
text: This hotel is in a great location for anyone venturing to the downtown area. The staff is very welcoming and the room is spacious and clean. The hotel has great amenities for if you want to stay in and grab a coffee or drink to a gym on the premises.

title: Lovely view!
text:
Had a wonderful stay and received excellent care!  In town for a special event with our Granddaughter.
Our room was on the West side with view of Ground Zero pool.  The staff was superior for the housekeeper to the bellmen!

title: Mixed Feelings in the Heart of New York
text:
During my last trip to New York, I decided to stay at the Millennium Hotel Downtown, driven by positive memories from 7 years ago. Unfortunately, my current stay does not reflect the quality and service I experienced then. The first thing I noticed was that the hotel is showing visible signs of time. The condition of my bathroom was particularly disappointing, where the wallpaper was partially peeling off the wall.

The service, which was once remembered as attentive and courteous, unfortunately only reached a mediocre level this time. A simple example: the attempt to order breakfast via the room phone repeatedly failed because the line was permanently unmanned. Only a personal trip to the lobby brought the desired success, but with further disappointments. The delivery of breakfast to the room was inconsistent - cutlery for the second person was regularly missing, and the presentation of the food in cardboard packaging seemed unloving and was not justified given the price. To my regret, breakfast was charged separately again in the bill, contrary to the booking agreement. The clarification of this misunderstanding has not been completed to this day, four weeks later.

It seems that the hotel is in dire need of renovation, not only in terms of furnishings but also in terms of service quality. For guests who are just looking for a place to stay and do not care much about extras, the Millennium Hotel could still be suitable. However, one highlight that must be mentioned is the fantastic view that the hotel offers. This remains an undeniable plus point in its favor.

Overall, my stay leaves me with mixed feelings. The location and the view are outstanding, but the service and condition deficiencies experienced significantly tarnish the overall picture. I hope for future improvements to bring the quality back to the level I experienced on my first visit.

title: Overall Experience
text: Need to take a look at improvement of the amenities. There was some renovation going on, so I understand those limitations. But there were moments when I needed a bottle of water or an extra towel. You only get 2 towels per room. The breakfast prices seemed a little high to me., There was a card for the breakfast orders but no instructions. There were instructions for the WIFI, but they didn't match hat the actual process was.

title: Aging hotel rooms
text: Parking was several blocks away. No dedicated space for car to check in. Guess I'm not used to NYC. The furniture appears to be 1970s age and style. No small refrigerator. There were continuous traffic noises all day and night. Temperature control was difficult with ups and dwns.

title: Splendid view of the city
text:
The junior suite and its view were consistent with the photos.
The price remains reasonable for such a hotel in New York.
Everything was functional in the room. Easy to regulate heating.
Responsive staff.
Disappointed with the breakfast given the closure of the restaurant which, according to the comments, has dragged on for a very long time. As a result, breakfast is the same every day, served in cardboard boxes brought to your room and for the same price.

title: Elevators sucked
text: Annoying that I have to put 200 characters here as I explained my issues on the last page. Needs working elevators. Need to fix my millenium site. Very annoying. Too many pain points for a hotel. Thanks!

title: DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY !! Absolute joke of a company
text: I would put a 0 star if i could, where do i start the hotel hasnt been updated since 2001 it seems it has stained carpets and room as a whole is dirty, also they have hidden charges ($41 a night resort fees) even though sky scanner says the price includes taxes and fees, May i also add im not using any of the amenities that they are charging us for, staff are clueless and no help what so ever, Avoid at all costs they will rob you with a smile on their face, worst hotel in New york, please dont waste of money !!! If i can save one person from experiencing this then thats a win 🥇

title: Reviews will start to matter!
text:
Management, I think your individual responses related to the reviews are noted but clearly not acted on, because the repeated reviews addressing same concerns. 
What about ALL the concerns about basic cleanliness? 
Some of these pictures are clearly disgusting. I get the $$ requested on hotels but on top of the extra room upgrade charge and resort fees it’s ridiculous, even for NY! 
Paying this much money for a motel 8 vibe, but with Park Avenue view is still way overly priced. 
You may not be able to do anything about the price, but you can clearly do something about the cleanliness, and the broken down appearance of a once incredible hotel that Hilton WAS proud to own!

title: Most beautiful view in NYC, financial district
text: A Hotel in a perfect location with perfect view. The rooms are large, compared to other Hotels, which is great. However, the rooms could very well be renovated. They are noisy and in winter the huge glass  windows directed the cold directly into the room. Lobby was not clean as well as the two bathrooms close to the lobby. During our weekend there was mainly one elevator in operation. This led to long waiting times up to 20 Minutes.

title: Petra the most amazing front desk
text: Petra is the most amazing front desk lady I have ever dealt with. They gave me the renovated room and I also made a wrong booking. They changed everything for me. I would of been lost without them. They made my trip especially my last night memorable.

title: It was mostly okay
text:
It's an old hotel with a stunning view!
The amenities could be updated as everything feels a bit dated, but it was lovely nonetheless. I would not suggest anyone staying here unless they were in a bind.

title: Looks great from the outside, old on the inside
text: Stayed here during New York Fashion Week for work. Mainly because of the access to the major subway lines. The first room I checked into was filthy but they switched me to a newer renovated room. The restaurant is closed since covid and I didnt know that until I checked in so that sucked. The gym is tiny. I would stay again if they make some renovations

title: Terrible Experience Staff/Service
text: Service/Staff Disgraceful - evening staff on front desk and evening manager failed to answer phones, deal with problems like room not being service for two days and quoted Union rules as to why they are not allowed to answer phones.  Worst front of house experience (on multiple evenings). Staff not fit for service industry.

title: Great location, poor customer service.
text:
This was to be a once in a lifetime trip for my wife so I spent hours meticulously looking for the ideal location and came across the millennium downtown. 
The location is brilliant and is a short walk or train ride from pretty much every attraction you can think of. It's a stone's throw from Joe's pizza the Manhattan bridge and two major subway stations.
I did have problems booking the hotel and my reservation continuously cancelled, however I don't think this was the hotel.
I did however email the hotel on multiple occasions asking how I could upgrade to a higher floor to ensure the best experience possible for my wife. After receiving no response I ended up paying probably 50% more for a better room only to be placed in the lower quarter of the hotel.
Don't get me wrong the views were okay but not what I was hoping for. When I arrived there was no offer of an upgrade to a higher floor and was told my room had already been allocated.
Having booked a more expensive room I was disappointed to see the state of it the carpets were extremely filthy which is surprising considering a large deposit they take off you when you book in. Would I stay in this hotel again? Absolutely. The location really is perfect if you can overwork its failings. My biggest regret is not being able to get one of the top floors... The rest I can easily overlook.

title: Great views, good value
text: We booked a corner suite on the 47th floor with a stunning view. Millennium was recommended by a friend and it did not disappoint. Very comfy beds, good showers, lots of space. We spent a few mornings and evenings eating in our room and gazing out of the windows. Would definitely recommend to others and stay here myself again.

title: You're paying for the location and view, not the amenities.
text: Guest rooms are showing their wear. Great location and views, but the furniture is worn and stained, the rooms are not always clean, some lights don't work, have had problems with room heating, the front desk is understaffed, and the restaurant has been closed for years. Unless someone else is paying for the room, it's not worth the rate.

title: Alicia
text: Our family had a blast here!! We will definitely be back soon!! We would recommend this to anyone staying in NYC. We was close to everything we wanted to do, actually within walking distance of everything we had planned for our trip!!

title: Not good
text: Room felt dated and not cleaned. Carpets were stained and the room smelled I had to buy l an air freshener. Paper thin walls where I could hear every movement from every neighbor. Front desk never answered the phone or called back

title: Disgusting service
text:
We booked the junior suite for a 3 night stay since it is close to where we work in. 

First night we asked for bottled water from housekeeping at 8 pm and they said they will bring some up. By 9:30 pm we kept calling to follow up. No response. We had to go down to the front desk to ask for water and the front desk personnel were just chatting with each other. They said they don’t pick up the phone because of labor laws. That doesn’t make sense to put a button on the phone to call the front desk then?

Second night, came back at 9pm after work. The room was not serviced. We left at 8 am for work and there were no door signs you put out to indicate you want the room serviced. Since they don’t pick up the phone why bother calling to service the room right?

Paid 160 a night which is a bargain for a suite  but this is beyond disgusting - room duvet is too thin, toilets are from two decades ago, and service is non existent. 

Was planning on staying here 3 nights a week for the rest of the year for work but that possibility is gone. Better to stay at Sonder (3-4 star) where they are upfront about not servicing rooms but have much better service.

title: poor service, dirty carpet, uncomfortable bed, very thin walls
text:
I used the QR code in the room for room services (ordered a shower cap and slippers -- the slippers were to protect my feet from the abysmal state of the carpet).

I received a text promptly that I would be receiving my items- 45 minutes later, I followed up. They confirmed again that I would be receiving my items.  After another 30 minutes of waiting, I finally went downstairs to ask the front desk, as the phone in my room would not work when I tried to call the lobby.

The staff were very rude and matter-of-factly when I provided this feedback about my negative experience.

As well, the check-in experience was negative because the staff had an attitude.

The check-out experience was negative because when I brought up the fact that I was not provided my $10 drink credit, the staff reluctantly credited the amount with zero apology.

All in all, I will not be staying at this hotel again nor will I be recommending it.

title: Great Location, Worn out Property
text:
We stayed February 9-12 in a Junior Suite corner room on the 42nd floor. The view was spectacular, overlooking the WTC as well as a view of uptown and Brooklyn.  The location was great: close to the subway and the 9/11 memorial. 

Our room was just ok.  There was a safe, an iron, and hairdryer. The bed was comfortable. The furnishings and fixtures were threadbare and looked somewhat worn out.  The thermostat didn’t seem to impact the room temperature. We asked for someone to come check and adjust it. The solution was to open the window!  That’s about the lamest thing I’ve seen in a high end hotel.  I didn’t know that’s what they’d done until we were awakened by loud street noise late that night. 
There was no mini fridge, which would’ve been appreciated since a canned coke was $6.44 at the bar.  Housekeeping was good and the room was cleaned every day. 

The entire property could use a facelift. The hallway carpeting looked worn out and was dirty. The revolving door was mostly out of service. The entry doors were very heavy and difficult to open.  

The $40 amenity fee was disappointing.  Most of what it covered (phone call, fitness center, business center, $10/day F&B credit, bike rental/bus tour discount) weren’t much of a value add. 
Either make it optional or embed it into the room rate. 

I wouldn’t recommend the Millennium. It’s not bad but it’s not worth the price overall.

title: Top
text:
Nous y avons passé 4 nuits en février, nous avons choisi une chambre avec vue, c était tout simplement époustouflant! Vue sur le brooklyn bridge! La chambre était très propre et assez moderne.
Le quartier est calme et les stations de métro sont devant et autour de l hôtel! 
Vraiment super! Rien à redire pour nous

title: Downhill from Hilton association
text: Hotel smelled like a marijuana dispensary every night after 10pm. TV size and quality of picture was very very bad. Bed was way too soft and uncomfortable. By the time we were checking out pillows should’ve been thrown away due to being flatter than a pancake. Very disappointed as we previously stayed there 3 years ago and had a great experience. We expected more for a 8 day 2,000 dollar stay. I especially for it being a “upgraded premium room”. Travelers beware do your research. If you like the smell of a marijuana dispensary then this is the hotel for you.

title: Great downtown hotel
text: The location gives you easy access to everything you need to get around NYC. The hotel itself was very quiet and clean. You will get beautiful, scenic views of NY and the Hudson River from the upper floors. I do wish the lobby had a cafe that was in operation for the entire day, instead of selected hours.

title: Very nice place to stay
text: Fantastic views, and great service!  This hotel is located near so many attractions, and from our spacious room on the 53rd floor, we could see the 9/11 Memorial, the Oculus, the Hudson River, the World Trade Center, and so much more! The place where the mini fridge is supposed to be was bolted shut, so we couldn’t store leftover food, and the bathroom was mostly clean- could’ve been a little cleaner. The front desk was friendly. The concierge was amazing as we navigated storing our bags for a few hours then getting back to our airport at the end. Overall our stay was very nice.

title: My experience at Downtown Millennium Hotel
text: Room temperature could not be controlled, thermostat did not respond.to temperature setting. There was a small bug crawling on top of the desk. No microwave and refrigerator. Overall experience was good. location was excellent..

title: Unforgettable hotel
text: This hotel was amazing not just the property but the staff,Oscar at front desk always wanting to help the greeting smile we will never forget him true gentleman.Mrs Castro in the back office remarkable lady always over and above always willing to make your experience fantastic,but really all the staff at this hotel were fantastic.My wife and I had a unforgettable stay.Thank you to all the staff.Basilio and Cristina

title: Business trip go-to
text: I visit NYC regularly for business and have stayed at a number of properties in the WTC area. This was my first time staying at the Millennium. I chose the hotel based on a co-worker's recommendation. I found it to be comparable to the other hotels I typically stay at, and better than some in terms of cleanliness and amenities. It's not spectacular or flashy... it's exactly what I would expect for the price. The hotel staff were friendly and attentive (especially the housekeeper on my floor, she greeted me warmly and with a smile every single day I was there). I will stay at the Millennium again on my next visit.

title: A Great Experience
text: I would definitely recommend this property to anyone. My room was spacious, great view, quiet, clean, plenty of hot water in the bathroom. Great shower. My bed was extremely comfortable . Wish I could have stayed longer.

title: Location Great- Rooms Poor Condtion and Old
text:
Location was good. But Rooms , No way! Soo old, online pics are deceving! Felt like i stepped back in time to the 1950’s. Wall paper, carpet, bathroom and couch. I was grossed out.
I complained and they put me another room, but exactly same issue. Renovations shud be done Asap. Third world countries have better n modern hotels than this. Unacceptable.

title: Hands down the best.
text: This hotel was by far the best one we have stayed. We visit annually for the past 8 years and this hotel and customer service is why we will continue to book here! Petra especially exceeded all our expectations and she’s was so welcoming! If she sees this we absolutely adore you and hope we see you when we come in April or 2025! My girlfriend proposed to me at the One world Observatory (Jan 20, 2024) so naturally we will be spending our honeymoon in NYC at this hotel next April! Petra’s hospitality is definitely the biggest perk among the big rooms, clean rooms, the doorman we just sweethearts! We love yall- always Texas Girls :)

title: Excellent value for money
text: I chose the hotel for the location and price. Didn’t disappoint at all. My room was huge for NY standards and had an amazing view of the World Trade memorial, tower and the river. I would definitely stay here again and recommend it. The price reflects that it is in need of updating but personally would rather pay less and keep it as is.

title: Wonderful hotel and staff
text: I really enjoyed staying at the Millennium Downtown New York. It has amazing views all around and a wonderful staff. It is super close to the subway and quiet at night. I will definitely be back and recommend this property to anyone. Thank you!

title: Vacay in NYC
text: This is my third time staying at this hotel. Really enjoyed our stay. Very good location and very safe. Perfect for vacay in NYC. Staff was very friendly and accommodating. Highly recommend for those traveling to NYC for business and travel.

title: No ability to control the temperature
text: The hotel is either all on heat or all on air. There is no ability to cool the room when they are on heat. Our only option was to turn the heat off and open a window. For those of us that cannot sleep well when it is warm, this is a problem.

title: Great location
text: I booked this on Priceline and after seeing some reviews, I was very nervous.  I could see how people would feel it needs updated, but we thought it was great.  The location was perfect and our room was clean.  I would recommend it and would definitely stay there again if I returned to NYC.

title: Customer Service
text:
Petra - the Receptionist, was ever so helpful and professional. I observed how she also carries out her job with a smile with the clients. Excellent location. The staff are very nice and respectful.

It is also felt that at the check-in point, some information were not divulged to customers but got discovered while checking out. Transparency goes a long way.

title: Rooms are filthy! Do not stay here!
text: Had to switch rooms 3 times before they found a "reasonably" clean room. Carpet is stained EVERYWHERE and torn all over. Rooms are obviously not cleaned after guests leave, only new sheets and towels. Dust and hair everywhere and items left behind from previous guests. The marketing team is obviously very talented because the guest rooms DO NOT look at all like the the clean rooms on the website. 100% Terrible!

title: Great Location but...
text:
The location is perfect, right opposite the WTC and Oculus Center and many Subway stations around. 
Unfortunately this was not a pleasant hotel experience. We booked a room for 3. As we arrived, they told us they would upgrade our room to a Junior Suite without charge, so that we get better beds. We appreciated their offer and accepted.
The room had no fridge and no mini bar. At the reception we were told that it was hotel policy, but if we wanted, they could get us a fridge, which they normally charge, but they would give us for free.
The fridge never came…
There was a weird smell in the bathroom and we couldn’t find out where it came from, until we used the shower: there was mold on the inside of the curtain and some unidentified yellow stains! (Really gross)
There were only 2 drinking glasses on the table. These glasses were never replaced by clean ones till after the 3rd day when we kindly asked the maid to do so. 
There were not enough hand and face towels for all of us. On the 2nd day we asked the maid for some more towels and she immediately gave us some. On the 8th day, we were left with only 3 bath towels and the maid told us that there were no more face or hand towels left. So for the next days we were supposed to dry our hands, face AND body with a bath towel....
The room was supposed to be a Junior Suite, but the furniture looked old and overused, most surfaces were scratched and discolored. 
There were no accessible sockets on the bedside so when I moved the bedside table to find one and charge my phone, I discovered a lot of dust and hair which was certainly hiding there for months. 
Under the bed couch, were my son was sleeping, we were confronted with the same situation: dirt, dust and hair which were not cleaned for months….
The room was in general not clean. And if you left a used tissue, or an empty chips bag outside the trashcan, you would find it at the same spot when you came back in your “cleaned” room. 
At day 3 we had to buy liquid hand soap, cause the little hand soap we were using was never replaced... 
For all the above, we paid 520$ per night....

title: Amazing hotel and exceptional staff Bravo
text: The hotel is amazing,but without exceptional staff a hotel is just a hotel.The front desk the first face to greet you Oscar what a wonderful person and Mrs Castro back office above and beyond amazing.

title: No real breakfest no Coffee in afternoon or night
text:
Its cool Location but i made a booking wirh breakfest and i onl get a 10 Dollar Voucher! It was Not good and there is no Coffee on afternoon or evening. Bed Are good.

Location is Perfect Its very nice and the substation is in Front of the hotel

title: Well located hotel
text:
Very well received, quality of service fulfilled.
Arrival and departure are easy and the location of the hotel is very good.
The cleanliness of the room was also impeccable. We recommend this hotel for a short stay

title: Great location
text: The place was extremely cleaned and well maintained. The skylight view was breathtaking. I enjoyed the restaurant nearby and it’s a walking distance from the 911 memorial. I will definitely return back.

title: Nice experience
text: I was a little bit "afraid" to discover the hotel regarding reviews of some people. But as usual I rather to see by myself. It was a perfect stay with a nice room with a nice view. Well positioned just next WTC (subway connections, etc.). Room was clean and was cleaned every day.

title: Cheaping on needed items
text: The hallway was hot when we arrived and several other times we went into it.  The A/C was never able to get below 73 degrees, despite being set at 65.  The bathroom has no handrails or handholds for the bath or the toilet, very dangerous.  There's no refrigerator.  The view was very nice, but the safety and comfort would have made it all much better.

title: (+)Price, Location (-) Elevators down, rationing in room products, phone lines undermanned, Bathrooms need remodeling
text: Great price and location but (1) 1 of 4 elevators worked until checkout when all elevators were down and everyone took the service elevators. (2) They are rationing towels and toilet paper. (3)Front desk staff isn't too friendly. (4) The phone lines were undermanned. (5) Bathrooms need a serious remodel. Stars of the show were housekeeping and guys outside helping us in.

title: Busy time trip
text: Lots to do in NYC if you like diversity and try new things. Hudson Yards, bus tour, museums, and all kind of food restaurants. Lots of walking and get your show tickets at least a month in advance to get a better price.

title: Regular
text: La limpieza es buena, la habitación con bellisimas vistas y cómoda. Carecía de caja de seguridad en la habitación aunque nos ofrecieron la del hotel. Muy buena ubicación con cercanía a lugares turísticos iconos de la ciudad.

title: Expect to pay $500 a night deposit
text:
The location of this hotel is great.  It's right by various subway lines.  

On check in a deposit of $500 per night was taken from my account.  This was not returned until well after check out.

The room was much more dated than shown in photos but the bed was comfortable enough and we didn't spend much time in the room.  I had intended to use the sofa bed but had to request bedding to do so and was given sheets rather than a duvet so it was not the most comfortable stay.  

Staff were most unhelpful after check-out and refused to send a simple email that would have helped me out immensely with returning the deposit to me in a timely fashion.

title: Piotr
text:
Hotel spełnił wszystkie nasze oczekiwania, obsługa była bardzo miła i pomocna, spełniała każdą naszą prośbę. Pokój był przestronny i wygodny, lokalizacja hotelu oraz widok z 46 piętra oceniam na 10!
Wrócimy tam na pewno.

title: 2 day stay at Millenium
text: Super hot rooms... temp in winter inside the room was 78 degrees and AC doesn't work. We complained and the best they did was to open a window on the 53rd floor and tell us that let the cool air come in. The whole night the loud sound of wind gushing kept us awake.

title: Great size premium king room!!
text: We chose this room due to the size of the downtown location. The room was gorgeous! With floor to ceiling windows and a corner room with a large floor space. Only problem was there was no AC option (only heater). This was in December but it got warm at night in the room.

title: Great location, not a great room
text:
The room doesn't match what I'd expect from the Millennium Downtown.

The TV resolution was pretty bad (like when we used to use antenna in the 1990s). The engineer was very responsive and provided a same size screen as TV upgrades are in progress throughout the hotel.

We also had to call to have him fix the radiator because it was only emitting cold air. He was great.

There was no handle on the refrigerator cabinet door and I found out (late) that the refrigerator wasn't working.

There was a power surge, with some wires, between the nightstand and the wall which is a fire hazard.

The room was overall outdated and below expectations.

title: Mediocre 2 Star Stay
text: The room needs a very deep clean. There was black gunk stuck in all the crevices in the bathroom. Was only allowed 3 towels for our family of 4. Front desk staff just assumed we knew how everything worked/ran seemed very annoyed with us asking questions on where to park etc. Oh, and the beds were the hardest mattress I’ve ever slept on in a hotel. Only thing going for them was location. Walking distance to subway entrances, shopping, Brooklyn bridge.

title: Dreamlike
text: Wonderful hotel with highly qualified staff. Available and kind even during booking contacts. Very patient and attentive to meeting needs. The view of Manhattan from the junior suite is spectacular

title: Broken down and janky
text: The location of this hotel is awesome and it has a ton of potential. Unfortunately it’s in a state of disrepair and neglect.  The elevators were broken the entire time we were there (they had us use the service elevator instead). The shower water was luke warm most mornings.  The air conditioning unit in our room was noisy. The mini refrigerator in the room was screwed shut. The lobby had an overpowering smell of Abercrombie circa 2003.  It was generally, just kinda janky.

title: Improvement

Parking is horrible. If I rent a vehicle in the area I should be able to park at the hotel I am staying at.
I shouldn’t have to walk two blocks to get my car. I missed my flight because the garage didn’t open until 6am. A patrons should be able to have assess to their car when they need it

title: An exceptional place.
text: An exceptional place in the center of downtown. Excellent accessibility and location. Renovation of the rooms on the 21.st floor would by appropriate along with solving the noise of the air conditioning.

title: Price Worthy
text: For the location, I would recommend it. All places in the city are quickly accessible via the Metro that depart nearby. Even though the rooms were quite noisy, it did not have any effect on our sleep. The deposit that was held, was relieved within one day. Price quality is perfect. Views are stunning

title: Good place to stay
text: Location was good for what we were doing - subway was right there.  Bedding was comfy.  There is no refrigerator in room.  Staff was nice.  The hot water was intermittent- sometimes it was hot and sometimes just warm.

title: Not what it once was!
text: The condition of the hotel has been on a steady decline and is no longer what it once was. The location is the best thing about the hotel. This will be my last stay at this hotel which is sad because I used to enjoy staying here.

title: Very old furniture dirty hotel ,non experienced staff
text:
The location is good but the hotel is very old with old furniture and dirty carpet and noisy assanciers
No good  room services ..arrogant duty manager (lady), non helpful,,junior staff were  helpful and cooperative..

title: Luxury Rest
text: As a busy appellate lawyer at the time working complex briefs. the luxurious stay offered by Millennium constituted a sensational and well-needed respite, with all the amenities for a unique escape to a heavenly experience.

title: So dirty
text: The room is dirty and the bed covers come off every 1 min, they don’t put it on correctly . So so dirty and room staff , I do not recommend to go here, I spent so much money which actually could of been spent at a begged hotel

title: 12/10/23 to 12/15/23 stay
text:
The hotel was conveniently located and smelled really good.  Staff for the most part were friendly and helpful.  I was shocked that there was no refrigerator nor microwave as being standard in the rooms for the price.

I wish there was more of a restaurant and elevators ran more as there were times when they only ran 1 elevator.  Also the elevator took forever to come but once in, went pretty fast.

title: Great location for business
text: Rooms are a bit shabby but the location is great and the price good. Staff were very pleasant and efficient. The view from my room looking over the Oculus to the river was stunning. I was able to walk to all my meetings in the financial district.

title: Not a great hotel - not worth for the money
text: The location is great but the staff/promptness to help is hopeless for the money paid. Response time to any request (like extra blanket etc) was 1 hour. No one would pick up the phone at guest services.

title: Update Needed
text: This hotel has potential to be an easy 5 if they take the time to upgrade the carpet and furniture in each room. It has one great feature to its credit is the rooms have great views outside the window.

title: Quick trip
text: The views were amazing. The rooms just need to be updated. The rooms could be cleaner. But I would absolutely stay there again. I wished they served a lunch or dinner menu. The breakfast menu was a little pricey

title: last stay
text: This stay was not a good stay.  from rude to wrong room broken tv broken fridge mold in shower broken elevator when leaving had to wait 30 minutes to be able to leave.   I brought my kids for their first trip and was very disappointed with our stay

title: Great location
text: Fantastic view from the high-floor rooms, very friendly and helpful staff and good location. Some room-to-room noise, but not critical at all. Bed was nice and comfy and it was very easy to get around as many subway lines are available just outside, or from WTC

title: Don't stay here the reception staff make additional charges  to credit cards.  We got charged 3 times
text: Horrendous service after the hotel reception staff charged my credit card three times instead of once. I booked it months in advance and paid. Then on arrival the staff tried to upsell me and I refused and then they charged me again. They denied doing it. My credit card pinged on app when I got to room. I went straight back down they denied it and showed proof they then accepted the error and tried to cancel transaction. But then 8 days later when checked out the credit card was charged several hours after I had left New York. So the reception made yet another unauthorised transaction and again they denied it. I sent two emails a day and they ignored, they ignored calls, there head office ignored calls and email. Their social media team pretended to help but I'm fact did nothing. I raised it with BBB, with NY attorney general, with NY police and Commissioner Cabbats office, with Millenium Group for the 16th time. Also 13 says after this debacle they made a small refund. They paid back 65% of what they owed. Then ignored emails and calls again. Plenty of other reviews say the same they are making illegal / unauthorised charges

title: Do not stay here. Reception staff make unauthorized charges to credit cards and lie about it. Then ignore complaints
text: Watch your credit card with this hotel. They have charged me three times for the room. They made unauthorised charges to card. They ignored 10 days of emails and then refunded 70% of what they owed. Three sets of currency fees charged. They currently owe me over $600

title: Third Stay at Millenium Hilton
text: This was our third time here. We love the hotel. The surroundings are great. Close to the Staten Island ferry, lots of little stores and great restaurants. The 9/11 memorial, Battery Park and Brooklyn Bridge.

title: Great views, comfortable bed and luxurious service!
text: Stayed at Millenium on Church Street for company sponsored trip. Thanks Medidata for allowing your folks to stay at these wonderful places. Thanks Millenium staff for letting me check in earlier and accommodating my requests.

title: Great stay
text:
Nice location and amenities. Would recommend for a short or long stay in NYC. The staff helps with any queries one might have.
The only minus is the cleanliness of some hard to reach parts of the room but only because I'm tall and a neat freak.

When I got there I had 4 bags in hand and the door guy was just watching me struggle to open the door when I had seen him help everyone else  prior to me.

title: No way for another stay in this place.
text: Appart the location, and the nice entrance hall of the hotel the rest is totally not acceptable for  good stay in NY. At this price the Room (junior suite) was dirty, totally not acceptable. Worn Carpet with stains, dirty outdated sofa, chair for the desk with holes. Hotel room is not at nowadays standard, common areas worn … we’ll clearly not remember our stay in NY because of this hotel.

title: Hot room
text: Will stay again. This time of year when it gets somewhat warm during the day and in the 40s at night it tends to get very hot in the room and the A/C is off so there is no way to fix it. Staff brought us a fan which helped, but next time I wouldn’t come between seasons due to that reason

title: room review
text: room was not clean and beds are not great. booked superior room with king bed but got regular room with two double beds. view is not world trade center got other side. did not complain to front desk . thought I mention here

title: Good if you need to be in the neighborhood
text:
Millennium Hotel Downtown is in an excellent location in downtown New York, adjacent to the World Trade Center complex, the Oculus, and other points of interest. If you need to be in this area for work or travel, it's not a bad option. With the location comes an incredible view out of the room window towards the Hudson River, looking down into the World Trade Center Memorial, and seeing the sunrise reflect off of One World Trade Center. 

Unfortunately, beyond the location, it is difficult to give high praise to this property. The room fell short of expectations in a few ways: first, the armchair was missing from the room (there was just a big empty space with a coffee/side table); second, housekeeping did only an average job refreshing the room, with the inner shower liner missing from the bathtub.  Another colleague of mine didn't receive any wash-clothes in their shower linens. Water pressure was really good for being so high up (30th floor)! Finally, the elevators are incredibly slow, despite the building being divided into two elevator banks to service all floors. It took about 5 minutes for an elevator to bring me back to the lobby, and my colleague even got stuck when the elevator that arrived to collect him refused to bring him back to lobby - he had to walk down 30 flights of stairs to make it to an early morning meeting (and was late to the meeting as a result). Sound insulation was average and worse than expected for a building of its stature - you could hear neighboring rooms' showers relatively loudly and the sounds of doors slamming in the hallways resonated into the bedroom. I will say (maybe because my arm chair was missing) that the room size was very generous for an NYC hotel. Mattress comfort was just OK.

There was a lively bar area in the lobby that was packed in the morning with business travelers game-planning their day, and in the evening with folks enjoying night caps. Front desk staff friendly and polite. 

Just a few things for the property managers to tighten up and my review would be a lot higher.

title: Rooms are very Tired
text: I stayed for two nights for a business meeting. So location was good for that, however the hotel needs significant investment to modernize the guest rooms. There is also a lack of basic facilities (No Restaurant/Breakfast). The price I paid was very high, even for New York so do not see it is value for money

title: Great Location & Staff - Desperate Need of updates
text: The views and location are spectacular but overall, not worth the hefty price.  The room is dated and dingy.  Carpet was stained and had large burn marks and holes.  The furniture is very worn and dusty.  The room was relatively clean, comfortable and quiet.

title: Ok, but nothing to write home about
text: I would like to give this a 3.5…the rooms were a decent size for NYC.  Mine was clean, though the decor is a bit dated.  I wouldn’t mind that alone, but the ancient grainy looking Zenith TV and serious lack of modern outlets was disappointing.  For a 4 star NYC hotel charging a premium, I’d like to see them step up.  Elevators are also minimal and small.  Having said that, great city views from my room, looking out over the Oculous and the World Trade Center memorial reflecting pools as well as the Hudson River.

title: Not well maintained
text:
Old furniture many scratch slow elevator .. it would be nice if the invest in renovation and get more attractive furniture .. 

Location is perfect has easy access to subway and very close to many restaurants

title: Check your card charges after you have left.
text: The hotel was good, and functioned but my spirits were dampened by them charging my card at the beginning and also the end of my stay, even though it was paid in full through BA.  Tried to resolve and no correspondence has occurred. Once is a mistake but multiple times is terrible practice and i would definitely not return.

title: We can do more... too bad!
text:
Fantastic and strategic location for moving around NYC.
Christmas atmosphere in the hall and themed fragrances at the entrance to the hotel.
Staff in uniform (not always clean), friendly and helpful.

Room cleanliness could be improved; the noise of the elevators is audible especially at night, lack of small refrigerator. In general I found the exact same Hotel (when it was Hilton in 2006): it lacks general maintenance and modernization due to its age.

There is a lack of transparency regarding the taxes due at the end of the stay: it would be appreciated to make it visible at the time of booking so as not to have any surprises at check-out.

If possible, the possibility of a sweet and savory international breakfast would be appreciated: currently the choice is very limited and the dedicated space is summarized in three tables and two chairs.

We can do more... too bad!

title: Nice hotel
text:
A nice hotel in a good location for travel into New York but not great for walking to restaurants and bars in the evening as there is not much about.
There is minimal food available in the hotel and the bar opens for a short period in the evening but is very small area
The rooms are good, comfortable and quiet and clean.

title: Magnificent
text: Excellent hotel, clean, comfortable, excellent location, spectacular views, very good attention from the staff, especially Antonio at the reception. Its location is privileged, with quick access to different neighborhoods such as Brooklyn, Jersey, State Island and others.

title: Clean rooms and Great Location
text: Nice room, some minor inconveniences, ie coffee machine did not work, phone to call front desk did not work. Otherwise it was a nice stay in a clean room, comfortable bed , and excellent location for seeing NYC.

title: Refund please. Room smelled. Toilet broken
text: The entire room smelled awful. The toilet made noises the entire time I was there. Something had to be wrong which is why the room smelled. Made my stay horrible due to the constant noise from the bathroom. Couldn’t sleep or enjoy the holiday.

title: Decepcionante
text:
No nos ayudaron con las maletas a la llegada y nos exigieron propina.
La habitación (suite) no correspondía con las imágenes que vimos, la única solución fue que pagasemos un plus para tener otra habitación.
Muebles sucios, cortina rota.
Mucha espera para recoger las maletas, un caos.

title: Great Experience
text: Excelent service from the front desk, the attention was supper from the personnel, will recommend to friends and family, and I will stay again without any doubt at the Hotel again.  Everything is very easy from the Hotel

title: Mal servicio
text: Por no atendernos en nuestra idioma, por retrasarnos en nuestra entrada, por cobrarnos cosas que no solicitamos, así mismo perdimos varias horas en hotel solicitando explicaciones de los inconvenientes y solo nos retrasaron nuestra agenda con las atracciones.

title: Disappointed!
text: For a 4 star hotel, there were many things missing in the room like water, slippers, mouthwash, body wash..etc. Besides, dust was all over and mold in the ceiling! And also, no restaurant in the property!

title: Great location, sadly in need of renovation
text: Stayed here for a business trip.  Two of the three elevators in my bank were not functional, which meant a very long wait (not to mention a potential safety issue).  The rooms are extremely worn, and there is literally no minibar.  The carpeting was clean, though very worn, but there are no slippers or robes offered, so I ended up walking around my room in my shoes.

title: Great Views and Location, but a little Run-Down
text: We stayed here because the weekend rates are a pretty good deal for the location. I used to live in the Financial District and there is so much within walking distance PLUS access to all the subways. Other good things: the view from our room was outstanding, rooms were clean, check-in was smooth. The not-so-good: this place could definitely use an update - the carpets and furniture were all pretty worn. One of the elevators was out, so it could be a very long wait for an elevator. Also, we booked a one-bedroom suite, planning for one of us to sleep on the sofa bed in the living room, however the sofa bed was so uncomfortable I woke up in pain every night, and I can usually sleep on anything. In spite of the good rates and location, I probably wouldn't stay here again.

title: Very bad
text:
This is the worst ever hotel stay in my life 
Horrible disgusting 80s hotel
Deceive people by the outer look n polished online pics but it's disgusting n expensive 
U have to pay for a fridge !!!! Unbelievable fraudulent 
Pool closed since covid 
I urge no one stay here

title: Millennium Downtown New York Review
text:
Con: Heat/Air Conditioner unit too loud. 

Pro: Great location to visit 911 Memorial, restaurants, and Financial District Restaurants. The rooms were average and the room amenities was older. 
 
The location is also close enough to enjoy the riverwalk.

title: Great location! Hotel and hotel rooms are not well kept.
text: The facility is in dire need of a deep cleaning. Everything is outdated and visibly worn. The TV’s aren’t even smart TV’s. I’m embarrassed that I paid $350/ night for accommodations in this condition.

title: The ac doesn’t work
text: The hotel was somewhat untidy, but the location was excellent. Unfortunately, I couldn't sleep all night due to a malfunctioning air conditioner and excessive heating. The staff was not able to resolve the issue promptly.

title: Wonderful location
text:
The hotel is in a splendid location, among the best in NYC, it's a shame that the furniture is old and above all neglected. The wallpaper is peeling in several places and the shower taps should be replaced. The carpet in our room was torn.
I will definitely return to this hotel, given the excellent location and good value for money, I'm only sorry that the property doesn't want to invest money in an upgrade, even a minimal one.

title: Great Potential,great staff but needs some leadership attention
text:
Location and staff excellent for my purposes.    A number of facility issues were present that should have led to a little more service recovery strategies that was in place.
I would still recommend this as a great stay but hope they take some time to look at the basics.

title: Great Location
text: Beautiful view of the city. The staff was friendly and the room was cleaned daily. Our room was supposed to have a sofa bed but did not when we arrived. We talked to the front desk and they immediately had another bed brought in to accommodate us. I would definitely stay here again!

title: Cons outweighed the pros
text: Pros: Staff was fabulous! Bed was comfortable. View out the rm window of the front was stunning. Easy to get taxi. Cons: No washcloths or hand towels, carpet is dirty, no way to control room temp, faucets old and challenging to use, tile dirty in shower, no restaurant or silverware in hotel, bar doesn't open until 5pm, you hear neighbors and ppl in hallway very clearly, no refrigerator unless you pay $35/day and it smelled.

title: Fantastic locations!
text:
I'm amazed with the location, but also with staff profesionalizm! Subways very close, shops, restaurants and main city points.
View from the hotel is breathtaking, so I really enjoyed this. Recommended!

title: Peut mieux faire
text:
Emplacement numéro 1 à côté du World Trade Center.
Proximité des lignes de métro.
Dommage qu’il n’y ait pas de petit déjeuner ni de conciergerie.
On dirait que l’objectif est de réduire les coûts au maximum.
Produits salle de bain : minimum syndical.

title: Need improvement
text: The view of the room and the friendly accommodating staff was impressive, the downfall should I say was the upkeep of the room and property, the wallpaper on the bathroom was peeling and the furniture needs update , a refrigerator would be a great addition as I can see they now have a safe and coffee caddy in the room . The view of the room was phenomenal. The area is close to nice restaurants.

title: Outstanding location
text: So conveniently located - across the street from the WTC site; atop several subway lines; walking distance to so many attractions in lower Manhattan and Tribeca.  Staying in the Financial District afforded me the opportunity to explore new restaurants and bars.

title: Rude staff
text: The staff is very rude and unfriendly. They don’t give you information about anything. Specially at front desk. The rooms have good views but are very old and outdated. The best part of the hotel is its amazing location. I guess that’s why everybody chooses to stay here.

title: Not Applicable
text: The location of the Hotel was quite good. Enjoyed allot. Everything was near like malls. Outlets, resturants and tourist attractions as well. Good benefits of subways were near surroundings.Freedom tower, Brooklyn Bridge were just near.

title: Vakantie 6 t/m 13 Oktober 2023 in Verenigde Staten, New York
text:
Ik verbleef in dit hotel tijdens mijn vakantie in: Verenigde Staten, New York.

Ik heb dit hotel als heel goed ervaren, want ik reisde samen met twee goede maten van mij. We hebben een kamer met 2-persoonsbed en 1 slaapbank, daarnaast ook 2 TV's, de matrassen liggen erg comfortabel. Ik sliep zelf op de slaapbank, dat comfortabel ligt. Onze kamer wordt dagelijks grondig schoon gemaakt. Dit hotel heeft geen restaurant, maar in onze arrangement hebben wij roomservice. De roomservice ontbijt is veelzijdig, je hebt een ruime keuze aan ontbijt.

Naast het luxe verblijf, is de bereikbaarheid ideaal. In de omgeving heb je een supermarkt en horeca, daarnaast is de infrastructuur erg goed geregeld. De tram, bus en de metro is enkele minuten van het hotel vandaan. 
Daarnaast heeft het hotel een mooie uitzicht en veel bezienswaardigheden bevinden zich in de buurt van dit hotel (9/11 Memorial & Museum, Wall St en enz.).

title: Junior Suite views
text: Birthday celebrations in favorite city. Close dinner reservations, best views for great value. Sunrises are the highlight of staying here. This hotel is my go to when staying in NYC, prime location, not too many tourists.

title: Dated but large Rooms
text: Mixed feeling about this hotel: it’s very dated and in urgent need of a renovation,  there are not many amenities,  not even a restaurant or cafe. But the rooms and also bathrooms are very spacious (particularly for NY standards) and also clean. Location is perfect if you need to be in downtown. Just opposite WTC and next to many shops and cafes. Need to walk about further for proper restaurants though. Second time stay. Would stay again for above reasons despite being a very dates hotel.

title: Millenium 2023
text: The Millenium has changed from 25 years back when I first stayed at the property.  It has shown some wear, but it has been through a lot with 9/11.  I liked the accessibility to the 9/11 memorial and access to the subways lines.

title: Amazing Experience
text: Petra provided an exceptional experience throughout my stay. From seamless check-in to personalized recommendations, she demonstrated efficiency and a keen understanding of guest needs. Her ability to quickly address queries and offer local insights enhanced the overall quality of my visit. We enjoyed our stay at the Millenium.

title: Avoid if you appreciate hygiene! Overpriced, tatty and filthy.
text: The rooms are NOT as advertised! Filthy carpets, no fridge/water. Gross bathroom complete with cracked floor tiles and ingrained filth. Crumbling grouting and peeling wallpaper. Human hairs were stuck on the bathroom door and filth in all corners. Absolutely gross and won't be returning. It's false advertising and photos photoshopped to make it look better. Needs a major overhaul of both decor management and housekeeping. You should be ashamed claiming its a 4* hotel, the lobby looks like it is but that's where it all stops.

title: Great Experience
text: I travelled in for a weekend business trip.  The staff were extremely helpful; the room was clean with great natural lighting and view; great location in lower Manhattan.  I would definitely stay again.

title: Once Great, In Decline
text: Great location, some great room views, but “long in the tooth”.   Looks like it has not been refreshed or redecorated for over 20 years. Only one of three elevators serving the upper floors was operating and it seemed frightening shaky. Also the staff often seemed indifferent or ill informed about conditions (broken elevator) and hotel facts (Uber pickup site).

title: Location is the best.
text: This place was the perfect location to do all things NY.  There are great restaurants within a stone's throw from the front door.  I was so excited when I made reservations to Nobu and to realize it was located behind our hotel.  Then to have Eataly caddy corner from the hotel and all the shopping.  We walked to Chinatown, Soho, and even went to the Hudson River and walked all the way to Upper Manhattan.  Even though it is across from the World Trade Center Memorial, it is still not crowded like Times Square so I never felt to overcrowded.  The staff was nice at check-in and we didn't really interact with anybody after that as we had so much to do outside of the hotel.  As for our room it was roomier than a lot of NYC hotels.  It might of been a little older, but it was clean and had a great view of the Oculus.  We truly couldn't of been more happier with this hotel and it's location.  I definitely recommend it, plus there is a small little lobby bar for drinks and coffee.

title: Terrible experience
text: I would never stay here again .  The bathrub was old and cracked .  It wasn’t cleaned properly and the bed was super uncomfortable.  There was like a deep depression in the center of the bed .  The air conditioner didn’t work properly or wouldn’t cool off the room .  Overall a very uncomfortable stay

title: Great staff, location, shabby rooms
text: The staff are lovely. We loved the location, but the rooms are a little outdated BUT if you come to NY to stay in the room the whole time, you’re doing NY wrong. Bed was comfy and that’s what matters!

title: Great location great value great views
