text: Great location downtown with subway options at the door on each Street corner.  Great value for a 38th floor view over the WTC memorial with Hudson River views.   We had beautiful photos of our view day and night.  So many dining and shopping options within tens of metres of the hotel

title: Poor quality and customer relations. No email replies. No bond returned. Just bad experience with reception staff.
text:
I'm going to add to the mass of negative reviews, sadly. Front desk staff are not hospitable - in fact rude and dismissive. We checked in for two nights and didn't get the room we booked. We let that slide. Was asked for $200 bond. Sure, tapped the card. No receipt given (other than bank statement). 
Upon checkout, the man at fron desk said " Leave keys in box", which was right in front of him.  When I asked about bond of $200 being returned, he basically ignored me. So I repeated myself, he said "after the room is checked." Fair enough. It's been two days since checkout. I emailed the hotel and have not recieved a reply. Based on others' experience, I probably wont get one.  I have since emailed TripaDeal and will inform my travel insurance if need be. So disappointing for our first trip to the U.S.

title: Fantastic location
text: Loved being so close to so many sites as well as the subway entrance. Easy walking distance to restaurants too.  The hotel is attractive and the rooms clean and spacious. The views from the windows are great too.

title: Not a 4-star as claimed
text: The room look like a 2.5 or 3 star at best. Old carpet and not convenient outlets to charge phone or laptop.  And then there is the $40 resort fee at checkout… for what? Fitness center and WiFi!? It should be just included in the price of the room!!

title: Great views but dated room
text: We had the junior suite at this hotel. The 360 degree views are amazing to wake up to. But for the price the room needs to be updated. No plug sockets and they were falling off the wall. Very dated room. Especially for the price.

title: Amazing view, large rooms, good deal
text:
The room size is good, juniors suite size is amazing size to price ratio. Staff is extremely friendly and welcoming. Housekeeping staff is really attentive and helpful. The view from the junior suite is once in a lifetime!
The slightly outdated carpets and furniture is just a very small setback in comparison to the amazing view. The A/C is loud, but then again, it’s NYC. Everything is loud here , so it makes no difference

title: A Nice Place to Stay
text: The location of this hotel downtown is great. Close to the sites and subways. Staff is friendly and helpful, rooms are clean, comfortable and quiet, I automatically got my preference to be near the elevator, and prices are reasonable. I had a wonderful view from my room as well. Thank you!

title: EXCELLENT HOTEL!!!!
text:
I was a pleasant surprise, one of  the best hotels I have  benne to in New York in its category.

 Fue una agradable sorpresa este hotel, en verdad es una verdadera insignia de Nueva York, la zona super limpia, ordenado, sin basura, ni construcciones, es lo hace falta en todo Manhatan
Felicidades

title: Great hotel
text: Great for the price, good location, big windows with a view. Very polite and helpfull staff. The tv needs an upgrade, but we were out for the most of the day so not very important. Very comfy beds and pillows.

title: Excellent
text: Excellent stay; amazing location and view; assistance from Antonio at frontdesk was fantastic; we will definitely come back ; from your window you can see the world trade center ; you can walk to all main spots in south Manhattan

title: View Amazing Amenities Lacking
text: The view is outstanding and the room worked wonderfully for three people.  the sofa bed was very uncomfortable and we ;moved it to the floor to sleep on.  The staff was nice and did take care of things quickly.  The furnishings are outdated but the space and location are incredible

title: Incorrect charges
text:
I been waiting for my credit card claim to finalize their investigation just so I can review this place.

Let’s start with the good things , friendly front desk, lobby smells amazing and the view is superb. 

Now the bad…. Elevators were not working when we arrived on August 2023. Had to take the employees elevator or else it will be be 15 minutes waiting with a line of people in front of us. Upon arriving they didn’t have my reservation which was booked, fully paid through a third party and CONFIRMED by the hotel. They took their $300 deposit and we went to our room . By the way the front desk lady had to go grab her manager to try to find the reservation , not ONCE did he acknowledge me or anyone …. As a manager it says a lot about a place.The rooms are huge and extremely outdated. The bathroom are not deep cleaned like they “say” , there was mold around the tub and curtain. (Don’t let that lobby smell I told you about fool you)Upon checking out I received my receipt which included the amount the third party stated I had to pay at the hotel which was the hotel fee , plus a donation they added without my concept. That same afternoon when I boarded my flight the deposit was credited and a charge of $600 appeared. I called and they told me they needed me to speak to the Billing Department…. They don’t return calls or voicemails so I emailed . Not one person emailed me back . So I filed a claim with my credit card company , which since August has been under investigation ….. today I received confirmation that I was being provided full credit. 

Therefore , go somewhere else …. Don’t give this place your money and let them lure you in with the price. There’s nothing to do at night , there is nobody on the streets . Go somewhere else, somewhere where they do their management job right and care about customers coming back. 

If it wasn’t because of the view I believe they would of been out of business a very long time ago.

title: PLEASE DO BOT STAY HERE
text: I don’t know where to start. I hope someone reads this and chooses a different hotel. First the hotel is clean and gorgeous IN THE LOBBY. Not the rooms. First all the people I spoke to were rude, at that point I gave up in trying to get help with the staff. Some of the words that were said to me- “I don’t know what you want us to do, we’ve shown you other rooms and you won’t choose. “ the rooms aren’t dirty just an old hotel … the pictures will show that is not true at all. “Choose a different hotel if you don’t like ours…. I was traveling from Seattle to New York, never been, I’m young and a girl and it was around 6pm at this point getting dark, all the hotels were booked since this issue was so last minute I couldn’t have known how bad the rooms would be before then. Although I’m sure the man who was “helping me” while talking down to me saying I could just leave thought it was that easy it wasn’t. I couldn’t find any other hotel to stay at last minute. The rooms, they were moldy, dusty, dirty, bed had stains(blood) the mattress was like laying down on a box spring. I’m not picky I am fine sleeping on the floor when I visit friends, but this bed was just springs, stained, and I got a rash after sleeping here. I actually avoided being here so I basically paid to have a place to store my luggage. I tried to stay out all day and leave around 6am -8am. I paid about 1,300 for three nights to get a rash, get talked down to, disrespected. Also the tv don’t work, I didn’t get any towels after the first day, every person at the front desk was so unbelievably mean, I feel like kindness goes a long way, apologetic, and all of that would’ve felt a lot better than what I got

title: OK at best.
text: Rooms are not upto date. Plugs are hard to use and loose. Little lighting. No refrigerator. Mold in the bathroom. Wallpaper peeling. All in all, was not that great for the quality we were hoping for and expecting.

title: Great location, smelly bathroom
text: The view from the room was the Oculus. Ground Zero is less than 2 min walk. Wall St is <4 min walk. Overall, incredible location. My queen bed room size was decent, no complaints. However, on the down side, bathroom smelt of mold (more intensely inside the shower). There was visible mould in the wall grout in a couple of places. Some water would leak out of the shower area each time I showered and I simply couldn't figure out how to stop it--I tried to arrange the curtain in every way possible. One of the bed sheets didn't smell fresh (it was visibly clean but not fresh smelling). Overall, the convenience of the location was appreciated but I really expected a much better experience for the high price.

title: A Bad Experience in NYC
text: Hotel very outdated! No restaurant as being remodeled, but was never told until went down for dinner, No one answers the phone when assistance needed, No bellhop outside and needed to ask for assistance once inside. Many taxes added on to very expensive price and donation to unknown Foundation (did receive a refund). Only positive is the staff was nice, although obviously understaffed. Pass 'go' when looking at this hotel!!

title: Location
text: I liked the hotel overall,  specially the location, personal was attentive and helpful. Our room was clean and spaceful,  Subway is in front of the hotel and next to  fulton Street with a variety of bussines and restaurants.

title: solo trip
text:
The staff was very polite. Anyways appart from the lobby which look brand new the rooms have very heavy wooden furniture which is not really needed.
The lining of the bed always slipped out 
There was no fridge and the shower was not easy to adjust

title: The hotel is just so-so.
text: Location is excellent, but there were stains all over the floor. they didn't provide enough towels for my 3 night stay, but they were quick to bring them up. You have to pay for a refrigerator--which is really odd. When I checked the bed for bedbugs, I noticed some of the sheets had stains. Compared to other hotels nearby at similar cost, this was fine. Not great, but fine.

title: Do not use this hotel!!
text: Terrible experience with this hotel, they took my credit card at check-in saying it was only for incidentals and charged my card over £300 a few days after I checked out. When I questioned the charge they provided an invoice with all these absurd fees and taxes, which were never mentioned when booking or at check-in. The hotel is old, the rooms are outdated and smell bad. Horrid bathroom.

title: We really enjoyed our stay in your hotel
text: The view from our room was amazing, very confortable and quiet, a real pleasure to come back at the end of the day. When we had some issue, the reception staff took care of it. If I had to stay again in Wall Street I will definitely choose this hotel.

title: You get what you pay for
text: Check your room before checking in to make sure you like the room, the pictures does wonders on the websites, but in person it was very different I was very tired and just need it a room so I ended up staying there (worst mistake), the room need it some TLC !!, No mini bar on a upgraded room? Some hair on the sink prior to it being used by me, carpet had stains, there was a random metal kitchen chair underneath a lamp ? The room was missing things forsure! The TV was like playing MINE one wrong button it went to a disconnected screen, and it was a anniversary celebration :/

title: Location!
text: This hotel is great because it’s close to major subway connections. The area is well kept and very tourist friendly. If your arriving from JFK it will take you here on the subway. Hotel just needs some updating. Felt like I was staying in a room from 2004

title: Worn and Tired
text: If your standards aren’t that high then it might work for you. The hotel has great views but has worn, scratched furniture. The bathroom is old and worn. My husband has a conference so this was a the hotel that was chosen as it has a low group rate. We looked at a couple other rooms and all were in the same poor condition. We checked out and will pay for a room ourselves.

title: Great location & view from room
text:
Hotel is next to a World Trade Centre. View from room on 23 floor was amazing overlooking Millennium memorial, river & New Jersey. 
Very comfortable bed. 
But no in room access to Netflix etc 
Also no lounge to sit as alternative to room. Rooms need refurbishment.

title: The service and staff were extremely nice and friend
text: Upon arrival, the staff was attentive. Helped with the luggage. Front desk was also nice. My view was awesome. The furniture needs upkeep, but I stayed in the room mostly to sleep. The toilet made random noises at night, but aside from that it was lovely staying here with friends and enjoying the city and taking a break from my routine.

title: Great location and views
text:
TW at the front desk was amazing, he helped us with upgrading to a suite 

I think this hotel is in a great location to f you like yo stay in downtown area, the have the best views, and prices are very reasonable for what you’re getting

title: Don’t stay here.
text: Don’t stay here. Hidden fees and very dirty rooms. Was told the room was fully paid for when checking in. Then found out that there’s a hidden facility fee. Carpet had very visble stains that didn’t took like it had been cleaned in months. Room had a musky smell like something died in there

title: ROOMS ARE VERY OUTDATED, DIRTY
text: ROOMS ARE VERY OUTDATED, DIRTY. Beds are very small (i had 2 double beds) - says it will fit 4 people, but it's not . Elevators are shaking  and scary to use. Location is great . I would not stay in this hotel again and would not recommend it. the price was $500 for 1 Wednesday night that is too much for this type of room.

title: My go-to place to stay in NYC!
text: This place is my go-to for all NYC trips. I was here with my parents. They loved the extra space (rare in NYC hotels), and it is the best if you are running around all parts of manhattan! It is super easy to to subway around the entire city, and it is easy to grab food all around the hotel - overall amazing!

title: Nice room, poor service
text: Housekeeping interrupted a business meeting 3 times, despite my late checkout (and telling each that it was a late checkout). I can’t stay there again with that kind of disruption. Was not asked about my stay at checkout, which was quite time-consuming.

title: Terquone from millennium saves the day!
text: Terquone was amazing he went above and beyond, to ensure my wife and I were comfortable and had everything we needed. He took the time to make sure our room was what we wanted. He was courteous and professional.

title: Sadly to say but very disapointed!
text: All in all I regret to say that I am very disapointed by this Hotel. Some employees are very friendly, some of them the opposite. When checking out there was no question at all how we liked it nor did they say goodbye (keep in mind we did'nt complain). The room itself is a disaster, old inventory, dirty floor, a lot of dust on the surfaces. Internet connection is a joke! Regarding the price: I have never paid so much for a hotel room like this. Not even close! It would be fair to pay USD 200 or less for a night in a room like this. The best this hotel can offer is the beautiful view on ground zero and the river.

title: Outstanding hotel
text: When in lower Manhattan, I ALWAYS stay at this hotel. The hotel location, front desk staff, housekeeping staff and the overall quality of hotel are all of the reasons I choose this hotel whenever I am in lower Manhattan.

title: Buona scelta
text:
L'albergo è elegante,ma si vede essere un po' datato... Le camere sono un po' vissute, ma adeguate. La nostra j.suite offriva un panorama stupendo, aveva buoni spazi e letto comodo. Le addette alle pulizie delle stanze super gentili e sorridenti, il personale al desk educato.
La posizione è strategica, un po' in basso nel financial District ma nel cuore di uno snodo di metro.
Al check out deposito bagagli gratis
Nel complesso una buona scelta, che rifarei.

title: Nice location and cleanliness!
text: Having brown bag breakfast was disappointing with no options. Also, no mini-fridge or microwave in the room was disappointing.  Otherwise the room was great, shower and bathroom were up to date, internet was good along with the TV channels....

title: Good location. Needs some tlc.
text: The price is decent for a NYC hotel. They only had one elevator operational for a 55 floor hotel. It made mornings quite annoying. The air barely blew cool in the room. No fridges in room. The staff was lovely. All in all, just a place to lay your head for a decent price.

title: They threw away $300 worth of my items
text: I came to help host a ball and the night of the ball, an hour before the event I looked for my accessories only to find it all missing. I had crowns, earrings, a necklace, rings, hair pins, makeup, my heels and more. All gone. I immediately called and was transferred between guest services and security but no one could tell me where my stuff was. I had to attend the event in my sneakers, I was so stressed and it definitely impacted my night. To this day I still don’t know what happened to my stuff, I was told they’d reach out to me but haven’t heard anything. Never will I stay here again.

title: amazing
text:
todo muy limpio, una vistas inmejorables de WTC, museo memorial etc. volveremos pronto.
personal muy amable y profesional. simpáticos y te ayudan en todo lo necesario para que tu estancia sea inolvidable. resumiría todo en una palabra: "AMAZING"

title: Emplacement idéal
text: Nous sommes restés une semaine au Millenium Downtown New york. Je vous recommande fortement cet hotel de part pour son emplacement mais surtout pour sa vue! Nous étions au 48 ème étage juste en face du one world trade center et c'etait magique! Nous avions une suite junior elle était tres confortable, la vue etait exceptionnelle, cependant le mobilier est assez vetuste et il manque un frigo dans la chambre. Vous avez beaucoup d'attractions à proximité et le metro juste en face. Un quatier vraiment parfait! Je recommande cet hotel.

title: Wouldn't stay again
text:
Elevator was broken- was on the 34 floor. Only 1 elevator was available , which one morning none of them were working and walked all the way down. Then when the one elevator was working, people piled in like a clown car.
  Listening to other guests speak, it had been out of over week.
 Hotel Hallway leading into our room on the floor looked like food, the carpet needs to be replaced in room #3401, it was gross.

title: Our Stay at Millennium Downtown New York
text: I am very sad to say that our experience was not the best.  The maintenance of the property is obviously not being kept up.  The location and the views from higher floors are outstanding. The Bell staff was very helpful.

title: Good location and good value
text: Good location and good value.  Room was clean and size was pretty big for that price range. Location was great, next to subway station. Waking distance to everything. Next to Oculus building. Will come back next time.

title: Very disappointed
text: Was disappointed that there was no comp breakfast as when Ai booked it said we would receive each day. Also, the elevator on the 32nd floor wasn’t working & had to walk downstairs to another floor to get to the lobby. This happened for the 4 days of my stay!

title: Down and no fridge
text:
Only have down pillows available even though when booking we were told they could accommodate the allergy to down. 
No working fridge and no care to help with it. It was covered in a think layer of dust and had exposed wires instead of a plug.

title: Great location for a visit to 9/11 Memorial and Museum!
text: The location and view cannot be beat (five stars).  The rooms were nice, but in need of a refresh (three stars).  Thus, an average of four stars overall for the Millenium Downtown New York Hotel.  I would definitely recommend this property.

title: Beware BEFORE You Book
text: Upon arriving at the hotel, my 1st room was noticeably dirty. Toilet stains made me go down and request a new room. I was given a voucher for drinks at the bar for the inconvenience. Next, the bar staff was unfamiliar with their menu. The room had broken tiles on the floor and an odd smell throughout, plus the hotel doesn't have updates for USB cords. Charging my work equipment was challenging, with only one charger port connected to the alarm clock.  Lastly, and most importantly, someone accessed my room WITHOUT permission. Would NOT recommend staying here.

title: Disappointing stay
text: Seriously disappointed that only one elevator (out of 4) was operational for the entire tier and with a sign stating that only 5 passengers are allowed per car. Each trip down was accompanied by at least a 10 minute wait for the elevator and once even had to be escorted by security to the service elevator. Furniture was scuffed and dated.

title: Find something else
text:
Not worth the price, at all. 
Dirty rooms, with food items and used paper towles on the floor at check-in. Arrogant and unfriendly staff that made me feel uncomfortable for pointing that out. 

Charges a 40 USD facility fee extra per night, for facilities you might not even use, as CitiBike, sightseeing bus etc. 

Safe in room not working, no one took responsibility and wanted to assist. In total, this hotel has staff with a complete lack of customer service. 

The rooms are somewhat large, but are really worn down. Feels like you’ve taken a time machine back 30 + years. 

The only positive is the location, and view from the room. Be aware, it reeks of pot in the reception, as people stand just outside the door and smokes it up, 24-7.

title: Don't stay here
text: That hotel isn't worth the price, it has terrible Mattress pillow, ordered wasn't delivered to my room. So it's not worth it in my opinion. The toilet is my gramma's age, and hard to flush. They need to upgrade the hotel.

title: Great location!
text: We enjoyed our stay & would def return!  Our only issues were the elevators (only one in service) and the lack of usb ports in the room.  That being said, the location was everything! The staff was super helpful and friendly, as well.

title: what a great location!
text: we loved the view from our room of WTC memorial, the Oculus, One World Trade Center Tower, and the Hudson River.  and it's convenient to NYC subway for easy access to all the sites.  and what a beautiful area for walking and catch the local sites!

title: Unexpected from a luxury hotel
text: The only positive is the location. Otherwise even a cheap motel provides better amenities. You won't get basic things like microwave or mini refrigerator in the room. The elevators were not working for a high rise, so you can

title: Petra was phenomenal!
text: Petra is simply amazing. She accommodated me with an early check in and made sure I had all I needed for my stay. She provided recommendations for healthy places to eat and she advised that I should be bundled up as it can get chilly. Petra was simply a delight and I hope she is rewarded for her hard work, professionalism, and overall customer service skills.

title: Excellent location. Dated rooms.
text: As the title says. You could not be any closer to the WTC museum and actual site of the twin towers. Very centrally located in south Manhattan near major attractions (The Statue of Liberty, New York Stock Exchange, Chinatown, Italy town, etc.).  Rooms are a bit dated.  Clean but not ultra clean.

title: Worth it!
text:
I read some negative reviews of the hotel, and agree that it was deffinetly better in a past. But, for the price I've booked it, and location in the city, it was definetly great choise and I would book it again. Room was clean, had a great view, but You're still in a skyscraper, so some technical noises and sometimes water pressure problem can happen. It did not made my stay any less good. I loved it, felt like in a heart of the city a lived one of the best stays of my life :) 
STAY IN OCTOBER 2023

title: Came for years, new management, will never, ever return
text:
We come once or twice a year for work, big group, 40 people, long stays, 2 weeks.
They had a change in management and it went from being a world class service hotelto the kind where everyone is unhappy, unhelpful and they seem to want to cause you more issues than help resolve them. If you like to over pay for rooms and be mistreated by staff, this is your place. 
If you want someone that is sure to not help your business with having conferences and such when you're paying top dollar on their penthouse- that is simple some really horrible business management, IMHO. I say, stay away and if not- good luck with that.

title: CHECK YOUR BILL - DONT GET SCAMMED
text:
Be sure to double check your final bill - The “facility fee” came with a daily $10 credit which I used below the $10 limit everyday. However, the final invoice charged me for all those items and did not subtract the $10 credit for those days at all. Given I stayed for many nights, this was a substantial amount.

Although I wanted to think it was an honest mistake, the staff took an hour to sort it out and were EXTREMELY RELUCTANT to do so. Horrible attitude, and made me think the charges were done intentionally. But finally got the charges reversed after a long time. STRONGLY RECOMMEND GUESTS TO CHECK THEIR BILL if this “accidental” oversight was actually intentional on a systematic basis.  

ROOM - very basic, dirty towels and carpet. YOU NEED TO ACTUALLY CALL TO REQUEST FOR ROOM SERVICE! THIS IS NOG FONR AUTOMATICALLY! (This is assuming you get to reach their guest hotline which took 30 mins). 

LOCATION - good view and location. The only redeeming factors of the hotel. Get rid of the rude staff and renovate all the rooms, and it will be a good hotel.

title: A pleasant and good value hotel to stay and discover lower Manhattan
text: A week-end in New-York for my pleasure and my 73 anniversary : have a lunch at the restaurant the Peak, discover Summit One, revisiting the MET and the MOMA, strolling in Manhattan from Battery Park to central Park.

title: Bad experience!
text:
We was there at the end of September for a weekend.
We reported that the room was too cold , they sent blankets,
That room was getting colder and colder so we reported again, they sent a technician, by that time at 2 am the temperature was 62* in the room , ac wouldn’t shut off and the technician couldn’t do anything about it so as the night went along early in the morning, we feel sick. He was so bad that I had to take my wife to the doctor.
Sure after that, we spoke with the staff at the hotel and asked if they could do anything to move us to a new room or do any type of discounts this way we can leave the place since it wasn’t healthy for us. They said it was nothing they can do about it. They charge us full price and so we felt so disappointed that we just went to the next door hotel, which is much much better than that one for a lower price. Hope you guys can fix this problem is because it’s not fair for the terrorist of people that I need to take some sleep in your place as we charge so much money for a room doesn’t operate properly so sad to experience this. In New York City

title: Great View and Staff
text: We enjoyed our stay. The room had a great view of the 911 memorial. Skyline was great. Staff was friendly and always helpful. Would have like to have a fridge in our room and the extra chair was just a padded kitchen chair, so some improvement there.

title: very good
text:
Location is excellent.
The rooms were neat, towels we neat.
Breakfast was ok, but not the best. You could improve by opening up a restaurant.
Room services were very good. Mini fridge in rooms will be great.

title: 55 Church Street Millennium Hotel
text:
Dear Millennium Management,

I was disappointed with the value of the accommodations for the price I paid. The absence of basic amenities such as a microwave or fridge, combined with the additional $35 per day fee to have one, was unexpected. Additionally, I noticed that the rate significantly increased during my stay due to a local conference. I believe such practices may deter guests from returning to your establishment in the future.

title: Excellent Service
text: Very friendly staff and exceptional service to include reservations, front desk, housekeeping, and the concierge. Rooms were clean and comfortable. Close to subway lines and all lower Manhattan sites. The hotel is directly across from the 9/11 Memorial. Highly recommend.

title: Needs a Severe Renovation/Updating/Cleaning
text: My wife and I stayed there last week for two nights. The location was great. It was across the street from the Freedom Tower and the subway was in front of the hotel. The lobby was quite nice as was the gym. The room was pretty bad.  It smelled like body odor and the carpeting had stains everywhere. The furniture was old and the bed was horrific. Both ends of the bed sloped down so you felt like you were sleeping on the Titanic after hitting the iceberg. The bathroom was dated and the entire place needs to be upgraded. The room was very disappointing. It was like going on a bad blind date, we had such high expectations and then found out our date was Uncle Fester.

title: Best Views great safe
text: Wooow!!!! The view was amazing and the room was clean. I was very scared to stay at this hotel at first because of the reviews that I saw online.  I was like I guess I’d just have to take my chances and see for myself, THE BEST!! . I definitely recommend here. The baggage area had this really nice man named Kofi he took very good care of us and our lounges. The elevator that they say goes really slow, lies you get to your floor in no time n I was on the 53rd floor. Very thing was just great and I would definitely come back

title: Gross
text:
We had water issues in our apartment and had to stay in the neighborhood. A friend had stayed in their suite a few weeks prior so we figured we would stay there. Apparently they have renovated only the upper floors. So if you choose the lower floors beware.  Room was absolutely disgusting. Stains all over the carpet that looked like they were from vomit. The room smelled like body odor and the tub didn’t drain when we took showers. There was no hairdryer in the bag and the coffee maker didn’t work. 

I asked the front desk for my bill to be emailed which it never was. So then called and asked once again and it never was. So my girlfriend had to go back just to get a physical bill from them. I still have yet to receive the email and the charge on my card is 100.00 more than the bill which I will be disputing with my credit card company if it is not removed. 

What was already a bad night became even worse after staying here. Awful!

title: Not what I expected
text: The location is fabulous if you want to be near the Oculus, shopping and the 911 memorial.  I previously stayed when the hotel was owned by Hilton, and it was fabulous.  The new ownership, however, has some work to do.  Our room didn't have a refrigerator, safety handles in shower or very good lighting.  The restaurant was closed too. The bellmen were super friendly, but I can't say the same for the front desk staff.

title: The Cheaper Cost of the Room Is So Not Worth It - Stay at Conrad
text: This was the worst hotel I can remember staying in.  4 banks of elevators with only one working. 25 minutes to get to your room.  Front desk never answers the phone. 4 attempts, all over 30 min before giving up. Dirty, Run Down.  Simply put, DO NOT STAY HERE or at any Millennium Property

title: rooms
text:
Rooms were small but clean. Needs more outlets that are not behind the beds. staff is excellent.
Would like a cheaper Government rate. more tribute inside the hotel to 9/11 since you did so much for us responder after 9/11. You are more than a hotel to us.

title: Excellent location and reasonable price
text: Great location. Close to WTC, tourist attractions, subway and restaurants. Excellent view from the west side facing room. Helpful staff. Interior is a bit dated but good value for lower Manhattan. Neighborhood is clean and safe by NYC standards.

title: slow draining shower and one large roach
text: stained carpet and worn carpet threads (loose carpet around rolling chair); slow to nondraining shower (stand in >ankle deep water while in shower); found 1 VERY LARGE roach roaming on floor at which point we were relocated to another room. 2nd room much cleaner and normal draining shower. wish we were in 2nd room the entire trip

title: Sorely in need of a deep clean and better staff training
text: The location is great, near the WTC and Oculus building and right next to several main subway lines. The rooms are old and dated, as expected and the hotel is very much in need of a renovation. The worst is the service, from check in, to housekeeping to valet - consistently rude, unhelpful or gave wrong information. No one seemed to know anything about even basic questions like where to get coffee in the morning or do you offer laundry service. Calls to the operator or guest services went unanswered throughout our whole stay. No amenities to speak of other than a pre-set breakfast that can be delivered to your room at the same time every morning. I think if the hotel offered better hospitality, it would make up for some of the other shortcomings but as it stands we would never return.

title: Lost Item Will be Returned Thanks to Manger, Tim
text: After leaving something at the hotel, Tim, the manager, went above and beyond to help me find it. He is even helping to ensure that it gets shipped back to me out of state. I really appreciated all of the he help he provided.

title: Good stay, needs updating
text: Before my stay I saw a lot of reviews about the cleanliness of the rooms, siting dust and general upkeep. I found my room to be very clean and the staff was very friendly, however, I think it’s important to note that this property is across the street from where the World Trade Center once stood and the hotel sustained a lot of damage. Given what happened that day, I understand why there would be a lot of dust that lingers. Lastly, the lack of upkeep made the stay a little uncomfortable. I think there’s a lot of potential here but renovations should definitely be done.

title: Horrible and worst hotel! STRONG DO NOT GO!!
text:
The absolute worst hotel that I have ever been to! Firstly, I stayed for 10 days and specifically requested a quiet room. When I checked in, they gave me a room next to the elevator, and an ac unit that didn’t work. I then requested a room change after day 1. The 2nd room they sent me to, the ac unit was so loud that you couldn’t even hear the tv and was dirty. Then I requested another room change. Mind you this is the 3rd room which was also old and dated and smelt putrid. I realised the poor standard of the hotel was the normal standard. As I was working as well from the hotel, I needed a proper internet. There was no option to pay for a fast internet so I had no choice but to use their internet which kept dropping every 15-20mins while I was in meetings. Needless to say, I was not able to conduct my meetings resulting in a loss of revenue. I complained several times to the manager and spoke to IT, but IT never called my back when they promised someone would attend to me in person. In addition to this, I would request room service for breakfast. However, these in room dining requests were never sent to the kitchen, so I was left with no breakfast coming to the room. I complained to the manager about this. The cleaners were absolutely rude and demanded that I leave the room so she could clean, even though I said that I was working. I complained about this yet again to the manager. Then it got worse. The cleaner wouldn’t pick up the dirty towels, then I complained to management. It continued to get worse. The cleaner wouldn’t replace any towels, any toiletries nor vacuum. I complained yet again to the manager. Then the concierge staff was most rude to me when I asked to collect a package which was delivered to me. Not only that, but the concierge would be chatting away loudly in the lobby talking about ‘a b**ch’! 
I’m utterly disgusted by the lack of concern by management. Seems it falls on deaf ears. But when I have to stay in a dirty hotel and basic things like cleanliness, manners and respect are not shown, it is a grave mistake my management and will be detrimental to the hotel.

title: Great location
text: The hotel was nice but ridiculously expensive. I did note the cost dropped significantly the day before my stay which was annoying. The elevators made some unsettling noises and the bed was hard as a rock. But it was quiet, clean and modern. The location can’t be beat for access to the WTC

title: Sub par service
text: I would give this hotel a zero rating if that was an option. The front desk process was terrible due to not enough staff. The complimentary waters were “out of stock” and housekeeping never provided pillows to the room after multiple calls to guest services.

title: I loved it!!
text: The staff was the most helpful and pleasant. I can not ask for any better services. I was given a room with the most wonderful view of new york city, the world trade center, and the entire financial district.

title: Fantastic location with a great view and spacious room
text: Great hotel - definitely recommended for a stay downtown. My room was on 52nd floor and had the best view I've ever had from a hotel. The room was a great size and the bed and pillow were very comfortable.

title: Deviant Employees will try and scam you
text:
I thought this would be great due to its location and advertising online, but it’s a very outdated and broken hotel. There was only one elevator functioning when I was there, and it was dark and claustro to be riding with 10+ other passengers.  I was visiting for an engagement party, and the next morning found a bunch of stuff in my bag that wasn’t mine (gum, vapes, receipts…as one tends to do after a fun night). I threw out my shoes from that night, and all the junk in my bag in the hotel trash bin in my room. 

The same day I checked out, a bunch of different charges were attempted- for a few hundred dollars each -by the hotel. One was for $300, $400, $446, etc. I didn’t have room service or drink at the bar, didn’t destroy the room or break anything, so I called and had lots of difficulty getting answers but when I did, the staff member said it was “we have AI technology that detected smoking in the room so there was a $500 charge.” 

First off…maybe Google has that technology in its HQ but an outdated hotel with a ton of broken elevators most certainly does not. I wasn’t smoking either. I guessed  they found the vape in the trash and a deviant employee thought he could make a few hundred by making up some smoking charge. I wouldn’t recommend staying here. If you do, don’t use anything in the hotel. Not even the trash.

title: No Irony that it's Called the Millennium
text:
Staff is always friendly and helpful. The rooms are 20 years out of date. You're paying for location only. There are zero USB outlets (at least in the room we stayed in); a light was inoperable; and there was a brownish liquid splattered all over the bathroom door. 

The location is great if you are working in or around FiDi.

title: Good hotel
text: Location is very convenient. Price was not bad. Room was clean but it did seem like it needed to be a little updated/remodeled. Staff was very helpful and nice. Overall this is a very good hotel to stay at.

title: Beautiful View, needs updating
text: The hotel staff were wonderful. The rooms are outdated. They tried to make it work but there were stains in the decade+ old carpet, clearly very used furniture, and a hard mattress.  It worked for my work trip but until they update, I will try to find other places to stay.  If in a pinch, I would stay at the Millenium again.

title: Good experience except minor Hotel Amenities issue.
text: Good experience except for minor Hotel Amenities issues. Nice front desk representatives and staff, the location of this hotel is super convenient, easy drop-off as well as walkable to the subway stations and the city view outside is superb.

title: Lacking customer service skills but good location
text:
We had booked three rooms with the Millenium for six nights at the end of August as we were a family of 10. A week prior to the booking I called them from the UK to request all three rooms be located on the same floor and/or within close proximity to each other given we had elderly and young children in the group which they acknowledged and accepted (10 mins I was on the phone with them). Upon turning-up to the hotel they provided us two rooms on the same floor a fair distance apart and the third room was on a completely different floor. Upon requesting and reminding them of the phone conversation I was told that would not be possible and that I would need to keep coming to reception on a daily basis to check if any floor had three rooms available in close proximity. Basically my pre-calling a week ahead was a complete waste of time and money.

Upon checking in we were assigned a room with two double beds. The beds in the room were tiny comparative to normal double beds in other hotels. My two kids (7&9) struggled to share a bed, let alone us adults (the room itself was spacious just the beds were small). 

The bathroom itself was smelling of stale urine the bath, shower and shower curtain very dated old school. Upon calling room service to complain about the stench in the bathroom I was met with no answer thus informed reception about this and they said they would have someone come take a look. Nobody came and the whole night passed. The following day the same thing happened by which point it was clear my calls/words were not being heard. 

Long story short, I would not rate this hotel a four star. The location is prime but the hotel itself is dated, the reception and managerial customer service is non-existent. The concierge desk on the other hand had some helpful individuals in terms of providing local advice and direction.

If heading to the hotel be prepared for a lack of quality service and dated rooms.

title: Screams renovation
text: Your lobby is a fabulous façade to the poor conditions in the upstairs hallways and guest room (that we stayed). You very well know how behind you are in renovating the place. Nevertheless, having only two medium size towels in the room, single ply toilet paper -- do not only show sign of poverty, it shows lack of taste.  It is a pity that you cannot take pride in you to your guests.

title: Nice hotel in good location
text: The hotel is in a great location. The junior suite we had booked had amazing views. We had a couple of issues around billing and bedding for the sofa bed, which the hotel has quickly rectified. All the staff were extremely helpful and friendly. As the owner of a travel agent in the UK, I will be recommending this hotel to my clients as an alternative area to stay when visiting New York.

title: Millenium Downtown
text: Excellent hotel.  Amazing location. Staff are very friendly and very expedient with requests.  Rooms are a generous size. Would highly recommend.  Across the street from The Oculus Centre, World Trade, Ground Zero.

title: Last minute booking
text: Our flight was canceled so I called and we were able to get two rooms last minute. The views from the room were spectacular! Loved the location and overall great experience.   Only downfall was no refrigerator in the rooms.

title: Absolutely Awful Hotel Stay
text: We chose this hotel as our place of stay for our wedding weekend. They only give 200 characters of space to write in this section and I need 4,000-6,000 spaces, but overall absolute terrible experience.

title: Outdated but good location
text: The only reason to book this is for location. The rooms are outdated, old TV, uncomfortable old spring mattresses. Internet is annoying and makes you join every day newly. Carpets had stains and walls had splatters.

title: Needs improvement
text: Room needed revamped (carpet was in poor condition and No fridge in the room) and there was only basic antenna channels on tv. For $300/night, I expected better. But the staff was amazing. Very helpful and kind.

title: Find somewhere else!!
text:
I will keep this brief..... find somewhere else. 

The location is the only thing going for it. No restaurant, shocking reception 'bar' at 23.05 last night they couldn't even sell me a bottle of water

title: Great Experience
text: Everything and everyone was amazing, my experience the entire trip was comforting. Never had a single worry, loved every minute of my stay. Will definetly be back and will definitely recommend to friends and family.

title: Excelente ubicación
text: El hotel estaymuy bien ubicado, cerca del WTC, el Oculus, estaciones de metro y de Battery Park. Nos parecieron un poco viejas las habitaciones pero la atención del personal compensó los inconvenientes.

title: Mold in room, falling ceiling, rude desk staff
text: Mold on the bathroom ceiling, falling ceiling throughout the rest of the room and a rude desk staff when these issues were raised. I've stayed here several times and this has been my worst experience to date. Things happen and I understand that but a rude desk attendant on top of the poorly maintained facilities made this an overall terrible experience. Empathy at the front desk could have resolved this and I would've understood and had no issues.

title: Room not worth the money
text:
The toilet was running upon arrival. 
The rug had large stains and was wrinkled.
There were stains at the top of the drapes (clearly there was a leak at some point).
The room is not fit for guests unless they fix the issues.

title: melania
text:
un pernottamento perfetto , molto confortevole 
super conisgliato per comodità di posizione e pulizia del hotel 
sttruttura vicinissima alla metro 
vista dalla stanza mozzafiato 
staff eccellente 
suuuperrrr

title: It's for the location. And the view.
text: Great place to camp for a short visit to downtown Manhattan. Everything is a walking stride away. A stunning view of the city, either the One WTC or the other side - definitely a great spot for a first visit to the city.

title: Room with a View
text:
The hotel has a great Downtown location adjacent to the Oculus and WTC site.  Fulton Street subway station on corner has every subway line which is great. Plenty to do within walking distance including tourist sites, eating (Eataly, Nobu, Shake Shack, etc.), shopping. 

The hotel itself, a former Hilton property, has an old business hotel vibe. Zero character and needs badly updated: stained carpets, older bedding, dated furniture, etc. Lacks virtually all onsite amenities: no restaurant, no convenience store, super limited bar hours. 

Staff was friendly and place was generally well staffed (except bar which was almost always closed).

Good hotel if looking to stay in Downtown at the right price!

title: SECOND TIME VISIT AND STILL THE BEST
text:
This is my second stay at the Millennium downtown New York.
The location is spot-on just right in front of the World Trade Center near the Ground Zero in Manhattan the customer service is outstanding , we have upgraded into a Delux room big shout out to Antonio at the reception who offered us this option !
The view from the 53rd floor is amazing best view ever.
After checking out we have realized that the hotel took a few dollars extra for the upgrade, Taxes and fees however this is not going to spoil our stay as I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for luxury comfort and cleanless.

Thank you again
ROOM 5304

Ps: it will be nice to show the customers the bill there and then so they can pay it straight away as upon upgrading we have been told a price and after you have taken the money it was a different price!More

title: Super
text: La vista che sognavo. Svegliarmi con affianco la Freedom tower. Staff disponibile. Super pulito e silenzioso… La Posizione comoda con metro a due passi…  Vista fantastica, la nostra stanza affacciava su downtown da un lato e su Ground zero dall’ altro. Fantastico

title: Great views, friendly staff, a nice hotel
text:
We had a great and clean suite on the 27th floor with great views of the 9/11 Memorial and One  
World Trade Center. The chambermaid was also very friendly. The hotel is located very close to many landmarks and subway stations.

title: BE CAREFUL OF NAME CHANGE
text: I made reservations for MIllenium Hilton Downtown and ended up at Millenium Hilton Midtown. The downtown location drop the Hilton name TWO years ago.  Causing a complete snafu with my unrefundable reservaton.

title: Enjoyed my stay!
text: I loved staying here. The staff were nice, the hotel was was close to everything, and the room was very nice. We were able to walk to all the various places we were going to, including the train station. We had great food and entertainment nearby. It was a really great weekend.

title: Good hotel in amazing location
text:
Amazing views over the world trade centre and ground zero.

Our room had a large king bed and sofa bed. It was spacious with lots of storage.
We were out all day travelling round so it was just what we needed in terms of accommodation.
If we asked for something from reception we had it straight away.
The lobby was small but nice to sit and have a drink.
Location was amazing, so much on the doorstep to discover.
Ground zero museum and memorial pools opposite hotel.
The Hudson River is a few minutes' walk where you can see the statue of liberty.
Food halls and shopping centres, including Century21 very close.
Subway is outside.
We were on floor 47, incredible views of the skyline and water.

title: My stay at Millenium Downtown New York
text: My overall experience is very good. The staff is knowledgeable and very friendly. The concierge staff is very accomodating. The 24/24 availability of the fitness center is very helpful. The WIFI connectivity needs some improvement.

title: Amazing
text: Breathtaking views and amazing location! ❤️ how to not enjoy an ice cream in front of world trade centre?  Thank you for a pleasant stay, for making our Holliday even better! We enjoyed it and would recommend it!

title: Never again
text:
Out of the 10 or so hotels I’ve stayed at this year so far, this one was my least favorite. The one great thing about it was the location.

The two persons there who were pleasant to deal with were one of the evening shift managers who did a service recovery after a super unpleasant check-in experience, and the cleaning lady who really tried everything she could do to help me when I was locked out of my room, because their door lock was out of battery (it was fortunate that this was the only day during my stay when I didn’t have to be somewhere on time in the morning!). Oh and an Asian guy at the concierge that made eye contact and smiled when I passed by. so I guess that makes 3 nice people out of the many I had come across in the entire place.

Room wasn’t clean, carpet was way overdue for a good steam clean: many black spots, 5-6 bits of something red that looked like bacon on the carpet, overall very dirty-looking. Bad-smelling bathroom, super gross (dirty) phone (I had to use it because they called me on the room phone and when I called 8-10 times over a span 20 minutes to order breakfast, and no one picked up). Breakfast took 91 minutes. That’s an hour and a half if you feel like waiting, or you can DoorDash the many options around. Wrong order arrived, I did not complain because I was grateful it arrived.

I left a day early. I paid to change my flight. My business partner, who stayed at a different room on a different floor, said her room was not any better. It really is so disappointing because I loved the location.

Disclaimer: we didn’t pay for our rooms, my client did. Thank goodness.

title: Sadly, not everything worked in the room and I had to clean the room on my vacation!
text: Wish I did not have to clean a room I paid to be ready and cleaned before I got there. Outlets, phones, and such didn’t work. Carpeting, tv, tables, desk, and windows were all dirty and smeared with greasy stuff. I will not recommend this hotel.

title: Denise at Millennial Downtown is the best at her job
text:
Denise at check-in provided exceptional service to accommodate my visit.

She was exceptionally kind and professional to quickly respond to my requests for a very comfortable stay.

Apart from Denise's great service, the hotel stay remember me from a prior visit and also fully accommodated me.

D. R. Wall, P.E.

title: Highly disappointing!  This is not what you expect in a $400 a night hotel room!
text: The room was filthy!  Feet stuck to carpet.  Couch cushions stained on both sides.  Large stains on carpet.  Pull out bed linens not changed and trash underneath pullout bed.  When brought to the attention of staff they said they were undergoing renovations and offered me breakfast.

title: Nothing special
text: Having to unexpectedly find a hotel in the area (City Hall/WTC) we chose the Millenium for its location. Not really a *bad* hotel, but nothing really special for the price. The meal services were the worst: bad fast-food level breakfasts only; and inadequate hours even for that. At the cost, insulting. Also: shower (needed disability access) was weak and the water was scarcely warm, still less hot.

title: August 2023 Stay
text: Maintenance could be better.  Staff were excellent.  No restaurant in the hotel.  Bar hours were limited due to plumbing issues.  The view from our room was spectacular. Sufficient elevators so waiting was limited

title: superb location
text: fine facilities and excellent location make the Millennium an ideal venue for NYC trip - good access to all a traveller could need. This combined  with the basic and unfussy room at a realistic cost is the optimum !

title: Once Great Place, Now Terrible
text: Everything that used to be great about it, is gone, I wouldn't stay here again, and I've been a patron for many years in the past.  Really too bad as I used to look forward to staying here and having family here because of the convenience.

title: All smiles
text: The staff was amazing. Everyone was always smiling and very welcoming. I would stay here again. The check in process was smooth and staff was informative. The line was long but the manager was engaging.

title: 2 star service. Tsk tsk.
text:
Something suss going on for a 4* hotel. 

Purchase a room with breakfast included - told that the only breakfast available is room service. When asking what’s included for free, get told “it depends what you order as to if it will be free” but wont actually tell us whats included. ???

When breakfast arrives it’s in a very sorry state. Stone cold potatoes. Ordered sausage NOT bacon. Ordered white bread NOT brown. Wtf kind of service is this? Sort it out. 

4* hotel is a JOKE.

title: Nice location
text: Very good environment and location. However, our room wasn’t in its cleanest state, as there were the previous clients’ pyjamas in the drawers. The view from our room was nonetheless amazing, and we enjoyed our stay very much!

title: Terrible
text:
We booked this hotel a week before our dates of travel. 
We were given a confirmed booking. On the day of our arrival we reached the hotel at 11 pm , as our flight was delayed to nyc. Upon arriving at the hotel there was only one person at the reception serving over 5-6 guests. Upon waiting for half hour I was then informed that the hotel had cancelled our booking on their own, no intimation was given to us via mail or phone. 
I showed them my hotel reservation confirmation mail , which was sent to me by the general manager of the hotel, but the staff was clueless and not interested in addressing or solving their mistake. 
They then said the hotel is sold out and could not offer us a room , the same they did with two other guests in line with me. 
How do they expect travellers to look for new accommodation at 11 pm at night. 
Worst hotel experience, terrible unhelpful staff. Rude and very I don’t care attitude especially a spanish guy who was the assistant supervisor in a red jacket on the 19th august night. 
Mr. Alex the manager who made our reservation was unavailable and the staff refused to even check with him to rectify the situation.

title: Vacaciones!
text:
Excelente ubicación para hospedarse!!!
Reyna la mejor para introducirnos con todos los servicios del hotel en español  my esposo y yo preferencia; además nos daba información de afuera para comer y tiendas cercanas
Gracias Reyna por todo tu ayuda!!

title: Nice location but needs improvements in the room
text:
The phone was not working, there was no slippers, toothpaste and toothbrush.
The restaurant was closed so the breakfast was in room service with a mandatory 20% gratuity fees (we didn't know the restaurant was closed).

title: Sicher nicht top, aber durchaus in Ordnung
text:
Ich gebe aus unterschiedlichen Gründen nur 3 Punkte:

1. Über 300 Euro pro Nacht muss mehr Luxus bieten 
2. Teppichboden im Zimmer
3. Aufzugproblem. Wir mussten einmal 15 Minuten warten

Das Hotel liegt ideal im Herzen von Manhattan Downtown. Direkt gegenüber vom neuen WTC. 9/11 Memorial 3 Minuten zu Fuß, Broadway und Financial District direkt in  der Parallelstraße. U-Bahn-Station um die Ecke. 

Kein Frühstück! Nur Room-Service, der unbezahlbar ist. Late Check-Out (zwei Stunden später als üblich) lässt sich das Hotel mit 50 Dollar vergüten.

Alles in allem okay, aber überteuert.

title: Room
text: I didn't like it due to type of money I paid to be here and it was no mic in the room yo reheat my foods. I think that sometimes they need to reconsider in the future.  Because people come there from all over the world.

title: fantastic location
text:
Just across the street from 9/11 memorial. yet the room was very quiet even during the weekend.
bed very comfy.
good A/C.
an underground station just under the main entrance.
the "oculus" shopping mall across the street.
many resturants nearby.

title: Great location
text:
Property can be noisy. Too much fragrance sprayed i. lobby?
Used to be more elegant. Our room was in need of facelift, toilet seat completely worn out.
The location has an incredible weath of sights and history, Good access to public transportation, too, good access to eateries and popular surrounding neighborhoods like Chinatown, Tribeca and Soho.

title: Terrible
text: It was an awful experience; the hotel has false advertising as well. The pool was under renovation, and the rooms were unsanitary. I will not return to the Millennium; the hotel is overrated. I wish I would’ve gone somewhere else.

title: Hilton was taken off the sign.
text: Horrible customer service lost my reservation and then found it without me giving any other information. Lies about amenities and tv was broken. Probably just waiting to demolish or majorly renovate the hotel. Would be better as condos. I am sure there are worst hotels but they scammed me.

title: Enjoy a Prosecco at Millennium Downtown after a shopping spree
text: After beating the pavements shopping on a hot summers day in NY city it was lovely to sit at the bar in air con & enjoy a cold glass of Prosecco. Casual & relaxed atmosphere. Great service too & come & say hi to Sogudo & he can fix you the cocktail of your choice.

title: Great Location but Room Didn't Meet Expectations
text: Considering that one cannot check in before 4 PM. I thought that great care and attention would have been given to all aspects of the room and amenities but that was not manifested in the room that I was assigned. Instead, the first question asked upon check into a mini-suite was, "did I wish to pay $50/nt for an up-grade?" Really!!!

title: Downtown NY
text: Absolutely loved every bit of the stay. Wife and first time out in NY and the hotel helped us enjoy the experience with it being in the middle of everything. The staff from the receptionist to the doors men, it was truly amazing. We’ll be back.

title: Super ligging
text:
Een heel mooi hotel, super gelegen zo vlakbij 9/11 .
Vanop de 22ste verdieping een fantastisch zicht  tot aan het water.
Grote kamer, niets op aan te merken.
Enige minpunt is personeel, niet echt beleefd, doen  nogal uit de hoogte, daarom maar 4 sterren en geen 5.

title: Outdated and needs thorough cleaning
text: Our room’s carpet had stains on them and even the side of the bed had stains. Room is outdated and should have upgrades and replacements made ASAP. Wonderful location, but outdated and dirty. Had previously stayed at this hotel, but about 10 years ago. While the exterior and the lobby are attractive and maintained, the rooms are not.

title: Nice hotel but is looking tired
text:
When we arrived at the hotel we loved the location. It was perfect. We had a lovely corner room on the 32rd floor overlooking the world trade centre which was amazing. We could also see the Brooklyn Bridge. 

We were disappointed however to walk in the room and it smelt a lot like weed/old musty smell. We had to buy air fresheners and room spray to get rid of it…..which did help a lot. We were also disappointed that we were travelling with 2 children aged 7 and 11 and the VERY small sofa bed was not big enough to accommodate both children. I asked in reception for another room with 2 double beds or at least another bed for our room and was told this would be extra per night which I refused to do considering the amount we had already paid to stay there. So we had to make a bed on the floor with the sofa cushions for my 7 year old son. ( not ideal at all).

Overall we did enjoy our stay here and would stay again but the rooms do need some refurbishment as they are looking tired and the smells need to be addressed also.

title: Couples trip -
text: Perfect location - convenient transportation to other locations in nyc. Shopping - food - perfect spots - good crowds- noise level controlled - security controlled areas as well - amazing cleanliness!

title: Thank you for making a trip better!
text: Denise and the night manager made this trip so much better. From losing my debit card so I couldn't check in to losing my key card at 10pm Denise was there with a helpful smile and solutions so my problems! I don't normally leave reviews to places I've only been once but I'm making an exception bc I have found the service experience amazing while I've been here. The building is older so I can't fault some of the outdated facilities for that. If you're able to overlook some superficial cosmetics for a good CS experience this is for you!

title: Good Hotel, but a little lacking
text: Overall, the hotel was great for my stay. My only issue was the lack of vending machines to purchase a soda or water, the ice machine on my floor was empty my entire stay, and the rooms had no fridge or microwave. The only other thing is that a restaurant was advertised but the hotel did not actually have one. These were minor issues and not a dealbreaker. I would definitely book again!

title: Upgrade
text:
The hotel was nice but can use some updating to the rooms. 
The location was great.  
The view from the room was great.
There was not complementary breakfast. to serve guest.
That should be something to offer.

title: Great view, nice staff
text: Oversll good place to stay..incredible views! Nice lobby and bar area. Internet was ok most of the time but at times spotty. Clean, comfortable..dressers a bit worn but overall standard hotel type stay.

title: Bad Trip
text: Elevators broke down while staying on the 53 floor. Lobby bar bartenders had poor customer service. Reserved room was not the room that was given, 2 bed reservation changed to 1 bed. No communication by front desk about change, no customer service or communication about all the problems encountered.

title: Our millennium Stay
text:
Loved the close proximity to transport (walked out of train station and across to the Millennium. We entered the modern foyer where we were greeted by staff with friendly faces and lovely attitudes. The staff member also offered us an upgrade for an extra $50.00 so of course we took that. Once we were given our keys we took the lift to the 48th floor and entered our room... we had a corner room which looked over to the World Trade Centre building and memorial as well as the train station. Then when we wanted to charge out phones there was 1 multi box by the coffee maker that was the only one apart from a single plug by my wife's bedside unit, not ideal. Then I had a look in the bathroom and was a little disappointed with the out dated amenities a walk-in shower instead of a bath would've been better for wheelchair access. The room was tidy and reasonably clean apart from the skirting boards and behind the door (which I noticed while sitting). The carpets were worn and the walls in the main living area could do with a clean or paint as they were scuffed up with something black. We had roomservice for our first day and the staff did not read the form that we filled out and my wife only got half her meal. 

Overall a pleasent stay.

title: We expected better
text:
This establishment is not worth its 4* rating 

Old-fashioned rooms, forced to have breakfast in the room, telephone out of order, despite our many requests, no-one ever came to fix it. 

Junior suite: no pillows or duvet for the sofa, we had to go downstairs to ask for them.

title: Great location but rooms ne to be renewed
text:
Location in downtown great. Staff very friendly - but the rooms need to be renewed.
Everything was very clean. Great view to the OWT. We had no breakfast. We stayed three nights. 
The Junior Suite had also enough place - the sofa b ed was for my daughter no good, old.

title: Hotel room felt like a cheap motel room.
text: First room carpet was dirty, AC was making noise wine refrigerator had a bad smell. Second room again the carpet was dirty, Both TV wasn’t working. For the price & location those room should look better

title: Great property - don't prepay for your booking if you are using Expedia
text: Great hotel,  great location.  Love the views.  If you book through Expedia the chances seem fairly high that your room could be double booked.  Expedia and the hotel don't have an easy line of communication.

title: Rooms need upgrading - but amazing location and helpful staff
text: Great location - perfect for a business trip to downtown financial district; very helpful and friendly staff (all but one person); rooms very dated and some minor issues with amenities.  The common areas smell strongly of something - old cologne maybe?  OK for business.  Would not take family there.

title: Millennium hotel/wedding dress shopping
text: Location—great. View— great. Service— great. Room— ok.  I would stay there again. Air conditioning was fine.   The bar was nice. The doorman was very nice.   Booking was easy.   Check in staff were great,  area was petty nice,

title: Great views / Great Location
text: I booked the wrong Millenium Hotel but was very pleased with my experience.  I was greeted with most attentive door attendant, front desk clerk very pleasant and the atmosphere was friendly and clean. Great location and terrific views.  I was disappointed that it was the wrong side of the Island for my business trip and only stayed one night.

title: Stay somewhere else
text: This is not a 4-star hotel despite what the reviews and descriptions would have you believe. This is 2-3 stars at best. The staff is lovely…but the room isn’t clean, and there is something very wrong with their booking system. I arrived close to 6:30pm and was told I wouldn’t have a room until after 9:30pm- when I got back from dinner after 10, I was finally given a room, but the carpets were very dirty, my booking requests weren’t honored (but resolved fairly quickly). Thoughts and prayers to anyone unfortunate enough to have to use the bathrooms in the lobby (covered in water, no towels, dirty).

title: For New York in July, the best ‘like for like’price we could find!
text:
NOTE 
No restaurant 
No pool 
NOT GOOD AS ADVERTISING MISLEADING!….

However …..

Fabulous views : Ask for a room facing the Hudson River.
Be aware that the hotel does overlook where the twin towers stood / The memorial.
Fantastic location, couldn’t fault that!
Yes, the rooms are dated but I feel good value for money (in Nee York anyway!)…
Reception and concierge need some training in customer service…
However the lady who cleaned our room was charming, smiling and extremely helpful…. I’d put ‘her’ front of house!
The room 2508 if you’re listening hotel manager???
All in all, I’d recommend !

title: Convenience
text: Overall, my stay at this hotel was great. Location was very convenient to the subway and restaurants. Besides the lack of service received from housekeeping, the room itself was great.  I loved the view from our room as it faces the World Trade Center.  Front Desk employees were friendly.  Our check in and check out went smooth.  I will stay at this hotel again when I come back to New York.

title: Why is there no refrigerator???
text: Overall, I produce a 20,000 person event across the street at the Oculus Plaza. I need to stay in a location that would allow me easy access as well as some of my team members to the venue even though are New York residents. The most disappointing part was that there was no refrigerator and there was clearly a place where refrigerator should be. We were working at all hours of the night, and to not be able to even store Food was an extreme disappointment. Additionally, there were billboards left in the room and the Bell Hop’s assisted us with removing those items and when we contacted the hotel the next day because we realize that they were left there, no one knew anything. housekeeping absolutely should’ve returned those items to the front desk, the front should’ve contacted the residents who are staying in the room to ask and see if they were things that were important. Moreover, when we booked the room, we specifically said what was going on at the World Trade Center at the Oculus and the staff didn’t know anything about it. These kinds of things are imperative to know when guess you’re staying at your hotel because of increased activity in the vicinity and it just enables service to be a lot more fluid and ensuring that all needs are met.

title: Tired, overpriced and poor service
text:
Tired and overpriced with poor service.

Currently staying here and what a disappointment! Nice views but nothing else i can find to say good about it - the cupboard screwed shut where a fridge used to be , broken safes, despite asking three times for a fridge to store medical supplies and agreeing to pay an additional $35 for it and waiting hours, it has still yet to arrive!

title: Hotel with Beautiful View
text: I always enjoy my stay but be cautious of items left in your room.  The view is always wonderful and the rooms are always clean. Food is not really an option but many restaurants in the area that you can go to or have delivered.

title: Great service, thanks to Rheina
text:
Nice hotel, great location, clean area and amazing view from the windows.
Customer service - I would like to point out excellent service by one of your employees, who works at the front desk, her name is Rheina.
She checked us in at the hotel, was very professional, and upgraded our room, which point we will be long term customers of the hotel.
Thank you!

title: A wonderful mistake!
text: I booked the Millennium Hotel thinking that I was booking the Millennium Broadway.  The Millennium was a WONDERFUL hotel.  An extremely professional staff including Petra at the front desk who was so accommodating and Mike the doorman was so helpful with directions and recommendations for places to eat.

title: Location and view are the only stars I would give.
text: Location and view are the only things I would give “5 stars”. We reserved a junior suite with a missing sofa lounge. It had just a coffee table. We notified staff and they said they would take care of it, they didn’t. Several of the outlets did not work, drapes were in bad shape. Room was clean, comfortable bed and pillows. If you pay for a suite you should get the entire ensemble!

title: Great stay
text: Great staff nice location overall good stay in this Hotel would recommend  to any one . please keep doing what you do cause your flow of your staff they work hand in hand with each other. Quality all the way.

title: Horrible Service
text: I was traveling for business - chose hotel due to proximity & reviews.  After being in airports for 12 hours I requested early check-in and was denied without explanation.  Worst experience ever. Avoid.

title: Dirty room.
text: Dirty. My room was dirty and the toilet made loud noises off and on all night. I asked for another room and they said they were fully booked. I checked out the next day and went to another hotel for the rest of my stay.

title: Friendly staff
text:
Very costumerfriendly and professional staff. Had problems with one of the beds. Petra helped us and gave us an upgrade. All fixed in no time. 
Great location and value for money.
We had a great time at our stay at the Millennium Hotel. 
Best regards from a happy costumer.

title: If it wasn’t for Denise…
text:
…My stay would have been miserable. However, on my first night, when I raised concerns regarding my room I was lucky enough to be meet Denise at the front desk! She did everything in her power to ensure my stay was comfortable and worth the cost. Could not thank her enough. 

What the hotel lacks they make up for with the views and the amazing staff.

title: In DESPERATE need of renovation!
text: We stayed four nights at this hotel. Location was fantastic and the view from our room was amazing. BUT this hotel is in desperate need for renovation/updates. Sketchy elevators that seem like they will stop working at any moment. Disgusting stained floors, peeling walls, stained furniture, stained sheets, awful pull out couch, moldy iron. We paid a lot of money for this room and it was definitely not worth what we paid. If you are going to charge upscale prices, you have to have nice rooms. No fridge in room in the junior suite either but was available for another upcharge. Seems like it hasn’t been updated in well over twenty years.

title: Better service at Holiday inn not to mention the price that goes with it!
text: Better service at Holiday inn and not to mention the price that goes with it!  No parking and guess service sucks. We asked 3 times to get and extra pillow delivered to our room. $138.00 for one day parking because hotel does not have parking on top of $700 per night to stay in this hotel with a view. Terrible place for the value and service received.

title: catastrophe
text: pire experiance que j’ai eu. l’accueil était horrible la dame était très désagréable et nous a envoyer balader. on nous a dit de payer 50€ pour aller à plus de 18 étages alors que quand j’y suis allé en novembre il n’y avait pas ça. N’en parlons pas de la propreté.. je déconseilles

title: Great location Great Views But…
text: Staff is great along with location and terrific views.  However, very expensive for outdated rooms . We had one night here … no bathroom amenities , website not user friendly and phone reservations over promised and under delivered the one night price

title: Crappy hotel!
text: The staff behind the reception is extremely unfriendly. We stayed as a family for a week in two rooms. Afterwards $40 per room per night was deducted. This was not told to us on arrival. It is a facility fee for the use of wifi and the gym. Really scandalous. The quality does not match the price. Outdated rooms and dirty toilets in the lobby. Only the view from the room is beautiful. It really all is a scam!

title: Illegal charges
text: Illegal charges. When you check out they charge a 40$ fee a night per room. It is mentioned nowhere, not a booking.com and not at your check in in this hotel. We had to pay 526$ . Saw it a few days later on our credit card. This is an illegal charge and we will file a complaint and sew them .Rooms are dirty

title: Good location
text: Downstairs lobby is really nice, but the rooms are definitly dated. No microwave or refrigerator in the room we booked,however we were able to rent a refrigerator for an additional $35! The location of the hotel was in the middle of everything.

title: Spectacular view….very nice people; very helpful!
text: Thoroughly enjoyed NYC! Great hotel, great people, great view! Thanks for the help Larry Odia!! Close to the subway system—unbelievable view of One World Trade Center. Very close to the wharf where you can see NJ, Statue of Liberty, etc.

title: The Best View in NYC
text: Great customer service, interesting downtown location, lovely comfortable clean room, incredible view, solid Internet connection, some hallway noise faintly audible, the bed was firm and the pillow heavenly-

title: Great Location
text: The hotel is in a great location surrounded by lots of shopping and sites. Overall, the hotel is nice but need a few upgrades. Elevators are very slow so prepare to wait. The rooms are comfortable and we had a great view.

title: Good location
text:
Good location, clean rooms. BUT no bar or restaurant in the hotel. And breakfast even if included is delivered in the box to the room. 

Check in was delayed and for someone who is in travel for 18hrs that's not a good experience.

title: Perfection!
text:
I start with Miss Petra; Wow! Thank you, and much gratitude to you, Sweet Soul. You were an Angel in my paradigm, and I'm thankful. The kindness genuinely delivered, and the eye contact were much appreciated.

In relation to the Hotel in its entirety, I had a spectacular stay. I enjoyed the other guests I interacted with, and found the bartenders to be rather sweet! Kind individuals indeed! That felt nice to experience. Everything was clean, and I felt welcomed. I will recommend y'all when asked, and it aligns. 

Also, thank you to the gentleman and security who put up with my energy the night before, because whewww.. chiiile I was h o t to find out I booked a different check-in date. Teehee! Oops on me! Mad Respect Y'all. Peace and Love! 

xxMiss Honey Bee

title: Great location, but left with bites on my legs
text: Booked a two bed double suite, and did not receive that. Only a king. The location was amazing. While on our stay, I received a bunch of bites on my inner thigh, which seem to look exactly like bedbug bites (after googling.) While the location is great and the property is good, I am sad about the bites (and I know this can happen anywhere, but this has never happened, and we travel quite often) and not receiving the room that was initially reserved.

title: Clean rooms, no mini fridge or usb charging outlets
text:
Surprisingly, there was no refrigerator in the room. I thought this was standard in all hotel rooms, so check for this wherever you plan to stay. 
Also, bring a usb charging adapter with you as there is no usb charging stations in the rooms

title: Good location, dated rooms
text:
Rooms are dated but large size for the location and price paid. Clean and comfortable. Mattress a bit on the softer side.
I wish hotel were prompt in provide stay receipt after key drop checkout. Still awaiting after 3 weeks.

title: Dates rooms
