text: Got two rooms, Stayed for 3 nights. Conveniently located. Hotel lobby restrooms were dirty. Lobby Overwhelm with fragrance. The rooms smelled moldy and sour. Furnitures we’re dusty and old. Not quite a 4 star hotel in my opinion. Views were great if you get the city views. Would not recommend or stay again.

title: It’s Ok!!
text: The overall hotel is nice! Could the price point be reduce yes!! There are no microwaves for guest! You have to pay for refrigerator in the room! The beds are a little on the hard side! If you like that then you will sleep comfortably!! Some of the staff was friendly others not!! The view was the best part of the whole entire room!! So I guess if your paying for the view it’s worth the money!

title: Nice hotel, great views, good location
text: The hotel was nice.  The front doorman was excellent.  Staff was friendly.  The amenities or lack there of were off putting.  Also the fact that every contact was in person or via text.  No phone calls for questions.  The room was older looking kind of run down but clean and comfortable.  Very much a lack of tech capabilities and modern plugs.  Three outlets in room.  Computer and ubs do not exist and were actually removed from desk unit.  TV did not work properly and had no way to connect to devices. Plus hotel menu did not work at all.  Also, everything is an upcharge regarding basics at other hotels.

title: Location is basically it.  Everything else is sub-par.
text: First, this is not a 4 star hotel.  I have stayed in 4 star hotels and I’m not sure how they can continue to invoke this status.  My understanding is that this property used to be run by Hilton or Hyatt - and they made the decision that it wasn’t worth updating it to meet their standards.  So they sold it to the Millennium Group.  It’s obvious the MG didn’t want to put the requisite money into it either.  The rooms are dated and the furniture and carpets show considerable wear and tear.  You can tell the cleaning staff do their best, but when all you have is ripped sheets and cracked wallpaper - it’s not an easy task.  I found a contact lens in my sheets.  Gross. The main pro’s to this property are its location and price.  They do charge the sneaky “resort fee”, but that seems to have become universal in Manhattan.  There is enough competition in the financial district now that I would look elsewhere.

title: Disputing over charged BF
text:
The plan included free breakfast but that was not true. I was charged over $270 for two breakfast for two days, which was originally complementary services. 
They instructed us to use room services for breakfast alternatively due to the closure of their restaurant but bill was charged at the check out. I asked to delete the charge and they agreed, but the hotel charged the fee in silent to my credit card. Terrible.

title: Tired hotel
text: Great location and staff is super nice. Front desk check in was extremely positive, but rooms are tired dated and not kept up.  The hotel has no room service. Evening bar was nice.  Location is ideal for a NY experience.

title: Nice lobby, terrible room.  Beware the housekeeping staff.
text: The lobby makes it look like a nice property, but the rooms are a dump.  No refrigerator - the cabinet where it used to be is glued shut, lol.  Bathtub leaked all night.  Worst, the housekeeping staff stole two chargers - one phone and one computer - from my room and they refuse to address it.  When I called to try to get them back they hung up on me and then put me on indefinite hold.  Do not stay here.

title: Perfect location in NYC.
text:
Perfect location is all we need when in NYC. Millenium hotel completed this task.
Entering the lobby’ we were greeted by the nice signature fragrance of Millenium hotel (trust me this is very important thing when you’re in NYC).

The spacious Room is fitted for family of 4;
The bath tub completed our needs to relax after long day of walking (we all need a nice long hot bubble bath).

The hotel provided coffee machine in each room (although I prefer the old water kettle).

Located right in front of the New ICONIC Oculus at WTC.

4 subway station just 2 minutes walks will take u all over NYC.

1 step away from the perfect 24 hr “stage door” deli.

We spent 3 nights, No Complain at all.

We would highly recommend this hotel for our fellow travelers.

title: Poor services and room
text: upsetting for the first time in the city. expected better for the location and how the hotel look on the outside and lobby. Fix up the rooms, clean, make things enjoyable for a extended stay. Better customer serives

title: Millennium Hotel Downtown NYC
text: The hotel is ideally located in lower Manhattan. The rooms are decently-sized, modern and clean. Most importantly, the staff is outstanding - always willing to go above-and-beyond to help guests (especially Denise).

title: Avoid this outdated disaster
text: I knew this was not going to be a good stay upon check in. The agent was rude from the moment we spoke.  I was looking to check in early since I was a Prestige member in the MyMillenium loyalty program and they allow for early check in.  Before I even handed her my license or gave my last name to ask if I could check in, she very rudely said “you can’t check in until 4pm” without even saying hello, asking me who I was, if I was a Prestige member, and what my reservation was for.  Service quality and being friendly to guests is something she could use more - or even some - training on. I had to go away, have lunch and come back later to check again for checkin.  Although their loyalty programs says they have priority check in for prestige level, there was no such thing at this hotel. Wait in line with all other guest and not be recognized for your level. The room was a junior suite. When I opened the door I thought I had stepped back in time 15 years.  The rug was all stained and ratty - I wore flip flops the entire time as it was gross and needed to be replaced.  The couch and armchair had large mystery stains on them - again gross. The pillows were filled with small Chunks of foam, not feathers, and very uncomfortable for sleeping. The bathroom had Mildew around the bath faucet. The TV and cable TV system did not work on the work area TV properly with the remote - it only worked in the bedroom. The air conditioning system barely cooled off the room and you had to close all the drapes to even get it close to cooling off in the summer heat. They have those motion sensors as well which are awful since you get very hot while you sleep motionless. One plus was there was daily bottled water. The WiFi was also free.  One final huge pet peeve - there were literally NO electrical outlets anywhere except for a hidden group under a shelf above the desk in the living area. Not a single plug in the bedroom - all items like tv and lamps were plugged in behind the 1990s wood paneling surrounding the bedroom that guests could not access. All in all - this was AWFUL. I would not stay here EVER again, and I would not recommend to anyone either.  If I could give it zero stars if I could.

title: Great
text: Petra was so polite and professional from start to finish. Something about her energy just brightens people’s day I noticed that every customer that she helped had a big smile after bro greeted by Petra. The hotel is ver nice and clean.

title: Skip this hotel
text: This was a very disappointing stay.  We were given a hard up-sell upon check in so that we could check in at 2pm instead of 4pm.  Ended up paying $48 extra for an awful room.  Motel like furniture that was chipped and worn.  80s style bathroom with mold around the tub.  Internet didn't work because we were on a high floor.  Security was iffy, and our door looked like someone had tried to break in at some time in the past.  There was no elevator security, so all floors could  be accessed by anyone in the lobby.  The third floor bar and restaurant are closed. It was astounding to pay over $300 a night for such a run down property.

title: Front desk staff
text: Petra was the best staff, I had an issue with the room she was attentive and took care of it immediately to make sure I was happy. All the stuff was accommodating with our bags and found us a parking garage to park for the nights.

title: Excellent place to stay
text: Excellent service and the place is on good location , the personnel  has good attitude , polite , good service, the response when required something is fast , We recommend this Hotel to our relatives and friend's .

title: The most spacious suite ever for a family stay
text: I am a New Yorker who lives in a tiny apartment. So when some relatives visit me and I need to play host I check into a suite at a hotel and this time it was millennium downtown NYC which was the most spacious suite I have stayed IN MY LIFE! With dream views of WTC and Brooklyn bridge from two different sides of the tow bedroom suite our stay was a dream. The housekeeping staff was amazing and beds were comfortable!

title: Decent
text: the Check in process was terrible and the staff are super rude. Everything else was fine. Rooms need some remodeling, the bathroom floors were stained made it not really attractive. Views were great too.

title: Great views
text: The hotel is in a great location. The lobby is beautiful.  Our room (a junior suite) had amazing views. The room itself was just ok. The floors (carpet) were very dirty and stained. The carpet needs to be cleaned and the sleeper sofa was also not clean and stained. The views from the room made us overlook these issues or else I would have asked for another room.  Hopefully they will clean the floors and sleeper sofa soon.

title: Trip with grandson
text: It’s the perfect location. I took my 17 year old grandson to see New York and had a great stay. One little issue was when the bathroom door locked when we closed it for the night but maintenance came at 3 am and fixed it in a minute.

title: Great stay
text: Great staff. Rooms were roomy. Place is very clean and came with a great view overlooking the North tower pool and the oculus. Sonnets was a great housekeeper and took great care of us. Perfect location to downtown activities and close to plenty subway stations including Fulton center.

title: Really gross room. Staff was fine
text: Horrible room quality ! The sheets were stained … the bathroom floors look like they hadnt  been cleaned in a month. I was told it would be a luxury room. The bed didn’t have a adequate blanket and was small. I did not sleep knowing I was in such a dirty room

title: Good place for the money
text: Staff goes the extra mile. The rooms are showing signs of age. My stay was good and would stay again. Had an issue with the temperature but once the staff was informed they addressed the issue quickly and successfully.

title: Marvelous Location to see the less bustling side of NYC
text: I love this hotel.  The staff are wonderful.  Ray Torres was extremely helpful on helping us with the subway and suggestions on where to go.  It is across from the 911 Memorial Museum and Reflecting Pool, Oculus and Eataly,  Subway is very convenient from the hotel and Century 21 just reopened and it is fabulous.  Lots of other shopping right near by, South Street Seaport on one side and Battery park on the other.

title: 10 day stay
text: The hotel is located in a very good place, close to the World Trade Center Memorial, Brooklyn Bridge, ferries to the Statue of Liberty. The hotel itself looks good from the outside, but the rooms definitely need refurbishment because they are already showing years of use. we had a room on the 43rd floor and the view from there was really great.

title: BEWARE of RATS and ILLEGAL CHARGES
text:
Worst hotel experience of our lives. BEWARE!! I have travelled around the world and have prepaid rooms and never in my life have I had such an experience. 

This hotel is a scam and a ripoff. Travelled with a group of 4 for business. 4 rooms prepaid for more than two weeks. There was a rat in one of our rooms and they said that they “had to take our word for it” and could not verify it. The plugs did not work in two of the rooms. The staff was aggressive and disrespectful when we voiced our concerns. In fact, they called security to threaten us. The only reason why we didn’t leave was because the rooms were paid for and non refundable. Once we checked out, they charged a $40 daily charge that had not been disclosed either at booking or check in. It amounted to more than $600. They refused to remove it. At least four people were complaining about the same thing when we were checking out. We are now refuting charges and filing a complaint.

title: Excelente
text: Muy buena relación ubicación y precio, la lineas del subway quedan a pocos metros del hotel asi como varias atracciones, las instalaciones son muy acogedoras y tienen una vista increíble hacia la ciudad.

title: Great views with value for money
text: Overall, I had an amazing experience. Checkin and checkout were a breeze. I did not get to use all the hotel amenities, but next time I definitely will. The room was clean and comfortable,but the carpet did look old.

title: Great location, suspect quality
text: Stayed here for three nights on business - room is fine, bed decent, good wifi, great location - no food options in the hotel. Major issue was the shower, no hot water on 2 out of 3 mornings, and water coming out brown.

title: Donnette is the best! Ask to stay in the 27th floor
text: The location of the hotel is perfect. Service is perfect. Donnette was the lady in charge of the 27th floor and she did everything posible to keep us happy! Thank you very much :-) whenever I come back to NYC I will definitely come back to this hotel and if possible will ask for a room in that floor.

title: I love the view and location
text: View and location was perfect. Staff was also very helpful but room carpet was dirty and had bathroom issues with toilet flushing on own and cold shower in am but knew it worked since took a hot shower in pm in between activities. Overall I would still go back for price and location and liked the set up just hope they fix the water issue.

title: Frais abusif
text:
Hôtel très proche de ground zero en face même 
Chambre spacieuse propre un peut désuet mais comfortable 
Par contre gros point noir on nous a pris 261€ par chambre de frais totalement injustifié et une semaine après notre départ vue que l’on vous fait une empreinte de carte bancaire à l’arrivée 
Honteux !!! 
En sachant t que nous n’avons pas utilisé le room service ni aucune autre suggestion de l’hôtel

title: Beware - the hotel billed me for a fraudulent smoking fees charge of $500.
text: BEWARE of smoking fees charge. I have never smoked a day in my life and i receive a $500 smoking fees charge on my bill. I was not made aware of this charge during my stay and was informed there is no way for me to dispute. This is a perfect way to scam and defraud visitors who are in a rush and have no way of disputing. I would NEVER stay here again.

title: Oz in NY
text: Great location across from 9/11 memorial next to public transport, hop on off bus stop and 5 min walk to shopping centre and wharf for Statue of liberty ferry. fantastic friendly staff. Very comfortable bed.

title: Very average room and experience, but amazing location and view
text: Staying here is like being in a 2.5 or 3 star hotel, but with exceptional views and in a prime location. It's hard to figure out whether I want to keep coming back, because I mostly care about the location. But I feel at this price point and being the hotel it is, it should have way more value than it has now. The rooms are just okay. The beds are not true to size, a lot smaller than what they say they are. And there's no food options except for room service breakfast that costs $29 for eggs, potatoes, and bacon. And the service is just okay.  But I've stayed here twice and found it super convenient to go where I need to go in the city and I love the view.

title: Sad Decline of a Once Nice Hotel
text:
I have stayed at this hotel years and years ago and was glad to see it had one of the more reasonable prices for the area it is in. I booked for 6/13-6/14 with a co-worker for one room. We checked into room 3301 and were immediately met with 75 degree temps in the room. We tried to get it to work but it would not. Also, the two beds were different sizes, one considerable smaller in width than the other. I called down and was told to bring my keys down to the front desk so we could  be moved. The woman at the desk was very nice and she asked me to please take pictures of the beds to show her. I went back up to the room and dropped a bottle of water and about 3 ounces feel on the floor. I grabbed a white wash cloth to wipe it up and was appalled to see the towel looking like I wiped up a floor in a hallway. In addition, the carpet is an absolute mess with pulls and stains all over and attached is a picture of the arm rest which looks like a dog chewed on it. I went back to the desk to be moved and showed the front desk associate the pics of the beds and room issues and she gave me a number for her manager and asked if I would forward the pics which I did and said we would be getting some adjustment to the bill. We moved to room 2201 which frankly was just about in as bad of shape as 3301 but the air conditioning worked.

Upon checking out, we were told no adjustments were made to the bill. What is absolutely even more insulting is this place has a $35 facility fee (it shows as resort fee online). Fee for what? Restaurant in the building is closed and all "amenities" in this building are so beat it is pathetic. Also was charged a $2.50 optional donation which if optional, should have been asked if I wanted to donate.

I was told they realize the building is tired and needs a renovation which is supposed to happen next year. Until this is completed, I would not consider this hotel at any price. I travel on personal and biz travel probably 70-80 days per year and this is by far the hotel in the worst condition I have booked in the last 25 years.

I contacted the hotel this morning and spoke to the on call manager Mike Diaz, who was very personable and apologetic but only offered to remove the "optional" donation of $2.50 and the $35 resort / facilities fee. I expressed to Mr. Diaz that I thought that was not a sufficient olive branch for the experience and suggest a $100 credit which he basically did not acknowledge I had asked for and asked that the next time I stay at the hotel they will promise me a better experience.

That will not be happening and Millennium Hotels are on my "no stay" list going forward if this is the level of brand quality for this chain. They are a far cry of the days when it was owned by Hilton.

title: Great NYC stay
text: Choose this hotel based on location and reasonable price.  Very pleased with the service and cleanliness that came with the decision.  Had a great experience in a wonderful NYC location.  Staff was around and very friendly and attentive.

title: Great location old rooms
text: Unfortunately long waiting line during check in , max 2 persons at the checking counter available. room requires maintenance. Old fashioned  and used furniture. Less good looking as on pictures , noise from outside is rather loud little value for the rate charged

title: Unclean, overpriced and terrible customer service.
text: This hotel is the worst hotel I've been in since I can remember.  The place was dusty like it hadn't been used in a while.  The TV didn't work the night I got in. The hot water wasn't working in the morning so I had to call maintenance.  It took a half hour to "reset" the hot water causing me to have to reschedule an appointment.  When I asked if there was some way I could be compensated for the inconvenience, they said no. Overpriced, unclean and terrible service.

title: Polite and Professional Front Desk Associates
text: Front desk associates were fantastic in getting room assignments and check-ins processed working through a computer system failure. My experience with the front desk associates has always been positive and professional. Especially TQ and Petra.

title: Definitely not a four star hotel
text: There are other hotels with similar amenities in the location so I would not go with this one again. This is definitely not a four star quality hotel. Everything seems to be old and not well maintained.

title: Glosantos
text: This is the hotel to stay when you travel to New York!!!!!! Staff very friendly and helpful. Location is perfect, near the 911 monument, near train station. Near a mall if you like shopping. We will be back in a couple of months.

title: Anniversary Staycation
text:
My wife and I had an incredible time celebrating our wedding anniversary. Staff was very friendly, room was clean and spacious. The view at this hotel is spectacular and the location is perfect. 
We can't wait to come back!

title: Sleepy hotel in the city that never sleeps!
text: The location is great but everything else just lacks… everything! The reception is dark as and dreary, the elevators reminiscent of an 80’s Horror show leading you to you room with grubby carpets to your 80’s style room. It just all feels unloved and underinvested in. I had the misfortune of having an adjoining room with neighbours who decided to come in at 3am, party and have sex with my wafer thin doors! NOT GOOD FOR EITHER RESIDENT. There is NO room service at all accept the over priced breakfast, if you were inclined, and if you wanted to dine in - good luck if you want to eat on a Sunday and Monday as the bar and restaurant is closed!!! Wake up hotel management! This is 2023 and your closing for two nights a week in peak season? It’s another reflection of what I can only describe as a done care enough attitude!

title: Issue with release of hold on my credit card
text: The hold on my credit card has not been released, I was told by management it would take 5 days it has been 3 weeks ! I checked out on the 21st of May, I have been in communication with front desk management on numerous occasion and was told to allow 5 days. Today is the 11th of June and the hold on my credit card still stands. This tarnishes an otherwise good experience with the hotel.

title: Mugrero / Dump
text:
Comentarios Inglés y Español 
comments in english and spanish

Llegamos al hotel alrededor de la 1:30 pm, el check in debía  de ser a las 4pm y eso es algo que se toman muy en serio en este hotel, no te entregan la habitación como en muchos hoteles de New York y el mundo antes, después de esperar, regresamos al hotel a las 4:30 pm y en ese momento  comenzó una pesadilla mugrosa!!!, si quieren conocer realmente las habitaciones del hotel vean las imágenes que estoy dejando en estos comentarios, la imágenes que envían ellos a los proveedores de servicios hoteleros y las que suben a la página web de hoteles Millenium son imágenes falsas,  las habitaciones huelen a mugre, sábanas con huecos, toallas Sucias, el mantenimiento de la habitación es deplorable, las paredes rotas, muebles en muy mal estado, el polvo hace olas por todos lados esto incluye corredores del hotel, los elevadores muy sucios, en general este hotel está para remodelarlo y limpiarlo en su totalidad, en mi habitación había una caja de seguridad está en las imágenes, la caja de seguridad de arriba no trabajaba, entonces en el piso había otra caja en la cual había que dejar tus pertenencias de valor, esa fue la única opción que me dio el personal de seguridad que enviaron para tratar de solucionar este problema, el día 9 en la mañana llame a recepción para preguntar en qué piso estaba el restaurant para desayunar y me contestaron que el hotel no tiene restaurante para desayunar (TERRIBLE) hay que pagar 30 dólares por un té y un pan en servicio a la habitación, el termostato de una de mis habitaciones no trabajaba bien, definitivamente no les recomiendo que compren en este hotel, LA RELACIÓN PRECIO-SERVICIO-HOTEL es desproporcionado, hay hoteles mejores en New York, más baratos hasta con desayuno incluido y más céntricos. NO PAGUEN ESTE HOTEL REALMENTE EL SERVICIO Y LA LIMPIEZA ES DEL MÁS BAJO NIVEL DE CALIFICACIÓN.  

We arrived at the hotel around 1:30 p.m., check-in should have been at 4 p.m. and that is something that is taken very seriously in this hotel, they do not give you the room like in many hotels in New York and the world before from the scheduled time 4pm, after waiting, we returned to the hotel at 4:30 pm and at that moment a filthy nightmare began!!! If you want to really know the hotel rooms, see the images that I am leaving in these comments, the The images that they send to the hotel service providers and those that are uploaded to the Millennium hotels website are false images, the rooms smell of dirt, sheets with holes, dirty towels, the maintenance of the room is deplorable, the walls are broken, furniture in very poor condition, dust makes waves everywhere this includes hotel corridors, very dirty elevators, in general this hotel needs to be remodeled and cleaned in its entirety, in my room there was a safe box it is in the images, The upstairs safe didn't work, so there was another box on the floor in which you had to leave your valuables. That was the only option given to me by the security personnel they sent to try to solve this problem, the day 9 in the morning I called the reception to ask what floor the restaurant was on for breakfast and they answered me that the hotel does not have a restaurant for breakfast (TERRIBLE) you have to pay 30 dollars for tea and bread in room service, the thermostat one of my rooms did not work well, I definitely do not recommend that you buy in this hotel, THE PRICE-SERVICE-HOTEL RELATIONSHIP is disproportionate, there are better hotels in New York, cheaper even with breakfast included and more centrally located. DO NOT PAY THIS HOTEL REALLY THE SERVICE AND THE CLEANLINESS IS OF THE LOWEST LEVEL OF QUALIFICATION.

title: Top Location, Top Service and Rooms
text: The hotel is located across the One World Trade Center. The Subway and PATH trains are reachable within Minutes by walk. Brooklyn Bridge and Battery Park can be reached in 10 Minutes by walk. The Staff are all friendly and helpful.

title: Great location!
text: Great location. Quick access to everything being so close to subway. Beautiful area and awesome views from room. Staff was great. Room was quiet and bed comfortable. Would definitely come back when visiting the city.

title: Great place to explore NYC
text: We really enjoyed our stay and the hotel was a really great starting point to explore the city with so many different subway stations around. We can recommend any traveller arriving at Newark Airport to take the bus (62) to Newark (!) Penn station and change to the Path train to WTC - you will be right across the street of the hotel fast and for almost no money ;)

title: good for a short stay only
text: don't expect too much... It is a pitty that the hotel does not invest and could then get better values. It's not the stated 4 stars - and it doesn't even have its own restaurant in operation anymore. Europeans expect a different/higher 4 star standard

title: Good location & service
text: The Millennium Downtown is a great place to anchor your trip to NY. Easy subway access, solid location & friendly staff. The room, a junior suite, could definitely use a refresh. Multiple water stains on window coverings, the furniture is worn to the point of being unusable in some cases. I think it’s just a matter of replacing basics like furniture and artwork (all of which were in various states of disrepair at the time of our stay). Electrical outlets were also a problem and extremely limited in both quantity and quality.

title: Great location but filthy hotel!!!!
text: The only thing good about this hotel was the location, the view and the front desk staff. The common areas and the rooms were filthy!! The cleanliness  is subpar! Not worth the price. I would not recommend this hotel.

title: Terrible condition of rooms
text: Unbelievable how run down the rooms are given the location and brand name. Not worth the ridiculously high cost. Not a 4 star hotel. The lack of attentiveness to how many towels are needed based on how many are in room, terrible musty smell in bathroom, lack of enough shampoo/cond/body wash/lotion, carpets worn, etc.

title: Gross and awful experience
text: We went to 3 rooms before settling on one. All were disappointing. Some were absolutely dirty and gross. Front desk check in took an hour.  AC didn’t work. Room remained at 78 degrees.  Ripped carpet. Curtains were falling down. No restaurant. No bar. No apology for the bad service. Way overpriced!!!

title: Save your money and book elsewhere
text: This place is a total rip off. The only nice thing is the view. The rooms are old, they charge you to use a fridge. They made me move rooms and promised an upgrade.  The suites are awkward shaped and feel smaller than the normal king rooms. They outsource their guest services so when you dial 0 from your room it connects you to someone in a different country. They give you false info and it takes forever to get service. This place is incredibly disappointing!

title: Great view and clean room with comfy beds
text: Great view and clean room with comfy beds. The elevators took a long time and you could tell they were a little outdated. The bellman and staff weren't as helpful as I would prefer.   Overall I would return

title: No Longer My Go to NYC Hotel
text: Whenever I used to visit Manhattan this used to be my go to hotel. I’d always highly recommend the hotel. Over the years I’ve noticed the huge staff turnover and worn out rooms. This used to be a great hotel with great staff and up keeping. That is no longer the case. I will no longer be staying there or recommending it to friends and family.

title: Great location, outdated
text: Great place to stay for location if you are looking for clean accommodations. This place was probably amazing in the 90s but has seen some wear and tear. Views are spectacular if you can get a high floor.

title: Overall I recommend!
text: The hotel is very nice, the room is small but it’s next to the NYC skyline, it was nice having that great view. The staff was 10/10. Only issue we had was wifi. Still, I definitely recommend! It’s location is very convenient, right next to world trade.

title: Good stay
text: Great location beside the World Trade Center, staff were friendly and room was well equipped for working professionals. No major issues experienced overall and would definitely would stay again next time.

title: Katastrophe für viel Geld
text: Als Hilton Hotel gebucht, leider entspricht das Millenium nicht den 4 Sterne des Hilton’s. Zimmer sind veraltet und sehen aus, als ob diese vom Sperrmüll kommen. Die Betten und Lampen verschmutzt, Möbel abgenutzt. und staubig Pool und Restaurant geschlossen. Daher eine spontane Buchung von Frühstück nicht möglich Tee oder Kaffee an der Bar nicht erhältlich. Keine  Minibsr auf dem Zimmer ( wurde einfach zugeschraubt) . 35 $ wurden jeden Tag für eine Reinigung einfach der Kreditkarte belastet, wir hatten eine Pauschalreise gebucht….von Reinigung kann keine Rede sein.

title: Great Hotel Experience in NYC!!
text: The Millenium Hotel is a wonderful place to stay! The rooms are spacious and the views are incredible! Having the Oculus and the Freedom Tower right outside your door is a bonus. It's just a short walk to the ferry to Liberty Island. Go eat at Hank's pizza just a hop skip and a jump from the hotel!  What really makes the Millenium stand out is the customer service!  Denise checked us in and was kind, thoughtful, efficient and fun! Mike, the Concierge was top notch! He easily got me a cab to mid town and to Newark airport.  All done with a smile.  I wish I knew the bartender's name because he was awesome as well.  The beds were extremely comfortable, the room was clean and there were plenty of towels! Highly recommend The Millenium Downtown for your stay.  I will be back!!!!

title: Ex Hilton property - a decaying building, an unpleasant stay
text:
Stay away. This is a old Hilton property that was purchased and then left to slowly decay and degrade. I've stayed here a couple times now for business and it has become worse over time. On my latest stay (June 2023) the room was not completely clean at check-in, the TV did not work well, the room had items from renovation cycles left in the dresser drawers, the elevators did not work well -- some were completely out of service, and the staff was as unfriendly as any I've encountered.

The upsides about this place is the location and the view from the side of the hotel facing the city/ground zero.

title: Just Awful
text: I've traveled to most states and 40+ countries and can say without hesitancy that this is the worst hotel in which I've stayed. NO SOAP (or body wash) in the room and no one answered when I called down via three service button options on the phone. No light in the bedroom. The outlet in the lounge pulled out of the wall when I tried to plug in the iron. And the iron was covered in a film that ruined my pants when I tried to use it. I ended up going to my business meeting irritated and in wrinkled pants. Just absolutely awful.

title: The Highlight to my last night in NYC
text:
I stayed at this hotel for 1 x night. The location is perfect, walking distance to all the local attractions, food and general stores are around the corner.
The view from my corner room was amazing with all round views of the city and Brooklyn Bridge.
Front desk were very helpful and attentive.
Responses to my messages were quick and clear.
Subways and just outside the hotel and the Fulton Centre is 1 block away.
Short walk to the Brooklyn Bridge
Bed was comfortable and room a nice size.
Furniture and carpets have aged.
Bathroom was clean and acceptable.

Negative - No water in my room and was only provided the next day. Did call guest services and in room dining - no answer

title: NON PRENOTATE QUESTO HOTEL ANCHE SE SU BOOKING LO SPACCIANO CON CANCELLAZIONE GRATUITA
text:
Avevo prenotato questo hotel su booking con cancellazione gratuita entro il 24 maggio, per fortuna in data 18 maggio l’ho cancellato per prenotare un altro hotel visti i tanti feedback negativi arrivati, e’ sporchissimo per dirne una e mi bastava anche solo questo.
Il 25 sono arrivata a new york e mi sono trovata un addebito di 308 dollari, li chiamo e non sapevano cosa rispondere, il loro billing department non risponde. Il giorno dopo altri 3.65 dollari di addebito. Sono dei truffatori che non sanno lavorare.

title: Memorial weekend
text: Great location being next to fulton train station and oculus. Service was ok, not amazing. TV has a 90s style of menu setup and you cant plug your own streaming service. Prices are way off, basically add 80 dollars each day and incidentals are 100 a night, which they do a terrible job of spelling out. Room attendant didnt knock.

title: Outdated and poorly maintained
text: Very dated room, slow internet, bad service. They do not change the fitted sheet on their beds fyi so make sure to get an extra sheet and sleep above the flat sheet. Internet was horribly slow, could not do even a zoom call with it.

title: Great location in lower Manhattan!
text:
Perfect location if you're wanting to explore lower Manhattan! Plenty of subway access too. 
The hotel is nice and the rooms are clean. I would definitely stay there again. 
Just be careful if you're using any hot tools/blow dryers/irons because it will set off the sensor in the room without you knowing it and you'll get billed automatically for smoking. The hotel number to call will lead you round and round and when you finally get a person they will tell you the only way to dispute the claim is through your credit card company. This may be true a many hotels but this is the first time it has happened to me. It was a bit of a sour ending to an otherwise TERRIFIC  stay. 
Highly recommend.

title: Awesome Location, Great rooms
text: Was located a block away from One world center, plenty of food joints around and close to everything. Great views from the room, comfortable bed, clean rooms and facilities (iron box, hair dryer, daily change or supply of towels and toiletries). The only nit  was the elevators which can take some time and it seemed only two out of 4 were working. Internet was solid. Would book again in a heart beat.

title: Toyjoi’s NY trip
text: The staff and service was superb!! It was heavy rain during my trip and Jiggs let me use his personal umbrella! That was extremely thoughtful and kind of him. Kofi greeted me with such a welcoming arrival every time I came back into the hotel. The front desk ppl were very pleasant as well. I wasn’t pleased with the cleanliness of the room but Antonio worked with me and reassured me that my next visit will be much better if I decide to stay there again. The location of the hotel is great.

title: AWFUL
text: Lights didn’t work room is disheveled everything is old and they had the nerve to charge for early check in for an hour I had surgery and needed to lay down! That’s not customer services that’s disgusting! I stated here many time when it was Hilton at least it was clean after being a 20 year patron of this Ho tel I WILL NEVER BOOK AGAIN!

title: Good hospitality
text: I stayed seven nights in a row, and was satisfied with the service provided. The hospitality staff members showed me was heart touching. Among them, MOR, one of doormen, gave me an extra hand when I checked in with huge luggage. Much appreciated.

title: Wonderful Hotel
text: This is a wonderful hotel. Service was excellent. Check in-out was very easy. Across the street from the 911 memorial. We had a corner Jr. Suite and it was perfect for views and quietness. Staff was very friendly and accomodating. Will stay there again!

title: Consider the beekman
text: Rooms are very tired outlets don't work bc they are loose and plugs fall out.  Phone didn't work.  Bathroom was tired.  Needs updating.  For the price the least good hotel I've stayed at in the past 2y.  Staff was great tho

title: Just OK
text: The hotel hallways were dirty and had visible streaks of dirt. The carpet in the actual room had multiple, visible stains and it was clear the room had not been properly wiped down. There was no fridge in the room and the phone did not work, meaning I had to call the hotel from my cell phone to ask for cutlery to be brought up. The front desk stated I would have to go downstairs to get plastic cutlery from them which is strange since they offer room service. Overall, the location is great but the hotel could use some TLC.

title: Some Work needs to be done
text: When this property was a Hilton,  I had nothing but praise for it.  Room was adequate.  Staff needs a hospitality course.  The best thing about the hotel is the location.  Virtually every subway in NYC stops either in front of the hotel or directly behind it.  If it weren't for location,  I would pass it up.

title: Awesome hotel!
text: What a great hotel. Directly beside the Oculus and 911 memorial. We got 2 junior suite rooms 2211 and 3011 which overlooked both. The higher floor room also had a great view of the Hudson as well as the city. Both had king beds and a little hallway that led to a small sitting area with a couch. Super nice rooms! The decor is a bit worn but it was very clean and the views could not be beat. Bed was comfy. Staff not overly friendly but that was fine. Rooms cleaned daily. There is food all around within walking distance and probably 4 or 5 subway entrances so the location was great to travel around the city. Price per night for the room was stellar also. I highly recommend this place and think I’ve found a new home on my future NYC trips.

title: Pick something else.
text:
Hotel is purely a bare bones business hotel. Completely run down and in desperate need of renovation. Severely stained carpeting in room with thick layers of dust in corners. Changed rooms. Second room was first than first. Broken furniture. Dangling by a wire - bathroom mangnifying mirror. AC would not go below 75. Over head bathroom lights didn’t work. Ice machine on floor didn’t work. One of windows was permanently frosted/fogged over (completely obscuring view). Broken/scratched furniture. They eventually upgraded me to one of their “renovated” rooms which was a big improvement (though still bare bones basic with no personality) - but at least it was very clean and seemed fresh, with nice view. Location is great and front desk staff were nice. But, for the price - much better options in the area)

Rooms are large.

title: Good location
text: Confusing checkout experience. Invoice not provided or emailed. No response to email and no one answers the phone. Location was good but rooms very average. Would probably choose a different millennium

title: Not what is used to be
text: Zero customer service, no valet, no bar, no room service, no bedding for the pull out sofa. I have stayed here many many times when it was a Hilton property. Night and day. experiences  Actually thought this place was going bankrupt given the lack of service and condition of the rooms. Embarrassed to have brought a guest to this hotel.  Used to be my favorite place to stay in NYC.

title: We loved it here!
text: We loved staying here. It was a different area that we are used to staying but we really enjoyed it and we had an excellent view. We would definitely stay here again. Staff was so nice and hospitable.

title: Wonderful trip
text: Hotel was perfect for grandma taking 14 yo granddaughter for her 1st visit to financial district. Great views from 24th floor. Lots of food options. Wonderful visit to 9/11 museum across the street. Easy trip from Moynihan Station on subway. Reasonable price.

title: Do Not Stay Here!
text: Unfriendliness of security staff and the room was pretty rundown. No microwave or refrigerator in the room. Bangs and dents in furniture and walls. Revolving door constantly lets in smoke from those smoking outside the front area. Toilet was very low and not working well. The only thing good about this hotel is its views of NYC.

title: NYC jaunt
text: Short-notice trip to NYC & this was one of the availability options. Did not have opportunity to take full advantage of all the amenities but the stay certainly did not disappoint. Will definitely be in the mix for consideration during all future trips to NYC.

title: No parking
text: Fix your parking , that’s is highly needed and allow guests to use the basic amenities such as fridge and microwave , asides that my stay was splendid and the view was excellent at the 50th floor, yup

title: Great location, clean room and friendly staff!
text: The location was about a $40-$50 Uber trip to Time Square but was worth it as the financial district is a bit less crowded. It was right across the street from the 911 memorial. The parking garage was on Barclay Street about 2 blocks from the hotel but an easy walk. I will definitely stay there again.

title: Worst Hotel I have ever stayed was the Millenium Down Town NYC
text: I booked the Millenium Down Town NYC from 1st May to 10th May 2023 two premier suits for myself and my children. This hotel should be closed down. The condition of the hotel was terrible, dirty, dusty, smelled of weed and mould, the beds were terrible and the pillows were as thin as tissue paper. The thermostat was not working and when we repeatedly asked for toilet paper and water bottles they delivered an arm chair instead and the service was terrible and dismissive towards our concerns and requests..We had to ask for four days to get toilet paper and water bottles. The staff have no interest in their customers. I highly recommend that  this hotel be removed from your  list of hotels that can be booked in NYC. Extremely disappointed with the poor, old and dirty condition of the hotel the poor service and it certainly it is not a 4 star hotel and the rating is extremely misleading in fact it is a minus 4 rating hotel. Our holiday in NYC was clouded by the  terrible memories we experienced as a family due to this hotel. A total waste of my frequent flyer points and cash.

title: A stained worn disgraceful room
text:
Every piece of upholstered furniture and the rug were covered with stains 
I had to request extra sheets and towels to cover the furniture so I could sit on it
The rug was not stretched and bunched up 

Not remodeled since 2003

title: Disappointing
text: The hotel was ok but the follow up to check up has been terrible charged the wrong card did not let me change it and was overall incompetent. The hotel was average but overpriced but the attempt to resolve the issue has been non existent

title: Muhteşem Manzara !
text: Otelin içi eski olmasına rağmen, Manhattan bölgesine göre fiyat - performansı çok iyiydi. Otel konforluydu. Odanın manzarası inanılmazdı. Check-out işlemlerimizde Petra bütün sorularımızı eksiksiz yanıtlayarak bizlere yardımcı oldu. Kendisine buradan da teşekkür ederim. Otel metroya çok yakındı. Bir dahaki ziyaretimde de bu oteli tercih edeceğim.

title: Very nice hotel
text: Very nice location room and staff. However the double beds are quite small and the state of the carpet leaves something to be desired, while seeming cleaned it was damaged in some area and we hesitated to walk barefoot

title: Dated and tired rooms
text:
Rooms need TLC. Fan didn’t work well and carpets were sticky with dark marks. Some mildew in the bathroom corners. Bed was uncomfortable and lumpy. The porters all expected top, even when just getting you a cab. I do t mind paying for good service but don’t demand it. 

However the view was splendid and the reception staff were very helpful.

title: You pay for the view and location of this hotel. OK for a business trip but not for a holiday or a romantic weekend  in New York
text:
Great view on the WTC. You pay for this view, not for the friendly ess of the receptionists.
I stayed 2 times there within 10 days - unfortunately I could not cancel anymore f.oc.the 2nd booking.
Location: The hotel is centrally located. Overpriced. Outraged rooms (partially dirty carpets/defect showers, scratched tiles in the bathroom), defect safes (in both rooms), but a nice gym; a less appealing bar & lounge - not an inviting atmosphere to have a drink after work, no terrasse.

title: A Very Expensive Mistake
text: My room wasn't maintained. The badly needed ADA shower had no reliable hot water for the 5 day stay. The bathroom sink had no hot water for two of the 5 days. Irregular maid service that required many trips to the front desk for coffee and cups. Broken USB outlets. No chance to talk to the Manager who I was told didn't talk to guests? No restaurant. Worn, lumpy and dirty carpets. Indifferent Concierge desk.

title: Proximity with Stunning Skyline
text: I had hit the lottery with this reservation with accommodations galore. The harbor, 9/11 memorial, and downtown views worth the stay. My assigned room allowed me to appreciate the city in 360 degrees. I also recognized NYPD's importance when I wanted to venture and enjoy the city night life. Thank you for hosting me and keeping me safe. The best business trip I had in my existence.

title: 2/3 Star Hotel: Good location but lack of cleanliness and unclear fees
text:
There were several issues:
(i) the state of the furnishings and carpet: very old and dirty. Further this is more like a 3 star hotel at the very best- with no fridge, or even any mugs! The front facing staff are friends and polite but they have limited discretion and the management are not customer friendly,, very profit oriented.
(ii) on the Friday Night - there was nuisance caused by other Hotel 'guests' (shorting and singing from 3-5am in the morning) which although reported, nothing was done.
(iii) I was not aware and the staff did not inform me of the full benefits of the Facility Fee charged. 
(iv) I requested an early termination due to an emergency but the Hotel stated no refund/credit for the remaining 3 days would be provided as I had paid in advance- a very profit minded as opposed to any emphatic  consideration. Accordingly, the reputation and long term consideration or customer was not considered. I will not be using this chain

title: Experiencia decepcionante
text: Experiencia decepcionante ,el hotel sufre una falta de mantenimiento total,al llegar nos asignan una habitación,cuando entramos la habitación estaba usada ,las camas desechas ,una botella de vino el el lavabo …bajamos a recepción y nos asignan otra ,nuestra reserva era de una habitación con dos camas  dobles ,nos asignan una con dos camas de 1,30 cm ,mi marido y yo casi no cabíamos en la cama ,los muebles con un desgaste increíble,la maneta de la puerta del cuarto de baño rota ,nuestra reserva era para tres personas y solo nos ponían toallas para dos ,la ubicación del hotel si es buena y la zona muy tranquila por las noches pero por lo demás el hotel necesita una renovación total

title: Hotel Fee Is Not For Me
text: This is one of the nicest hotels in NYC and very convenient for those traveling in from Newark. The views are great and picture worthy every single day. However, the staff is less than warm and the $40 hotel fee per day is quite a shock. The Hilton never charged a daily fee.

title: Muy bueno
text:
Las habitaciones. Personal limpieza. Y ubicación y precio excelente.
Lo único que cambiaría es que si uno necesita una noche no contemplada. Es necesario realizar la reserva de nuevo en línea. Pero todo realmente muy bueno.

title: Needs a facelift
text: We stayed here about 20 years ago & it looks like it has not been updated since.  Furniture  in ou room was old/nicked up, the mini fridge was sealed up, the carpet was dirty.  As. Soon as you entered the lobby there was an overpowering heavy perfume smell.  You could even smell it in the elevator & our room.  It was very strong & cloying,   This smell was especially a problem for our friend who has allergies.  Makes me wonder what smells they were trying to cover up!  The location was great &staff was helpful especially the bellmen.

title: Disappointing
text:
This place is a complete bait and switch.  The junior suite cost $1200 for 3 nights and there are stains all over the carpet and couch (that look straight out of the 1970s).  As soon as I opened the door, I got hit in the face with the stench of stall cigarettes.  They charge an incidental fee of $100/night and there's no way the room could look any worse than it already does; I don't even want to walk barefoot on this carpet or sit on the couch.  What a joke; the city view isn't even that nice on the 11th floor.  There is no refrigerator or microwave in this "suite"; they want to charge $50/day for each appliance. 
We literally arrived from Dublin (15 hours of travel) and the doorman/bellman kept trying to make small talk (fishing for a tip) and all I kept saying was, "I am exhausted and just want to go to sleep", he didn't get the hint.   
Oh!  And they want to charge $35 for an "American breakfast" (eggs, toast, sausage) and $10 for cereal/milk.  What an absolute waste of money.

title: Parfait
text: Vue incroyable de la chambre ( suite au 54 eme étage conforme aux photos du site ), localisation parfaite ( quartier sympa et métro en face de l’hotel ), prix correct pour cette ville… à recommander pour un voyage à New York

title: Needs cleaning and remodel
text: This hotel has a fantastic location and views. We stayed on 41st floor and had breathtaking views towards the Oculus and Freedom Tower. However, we were taken aback by the shabby condition. As someone else wrote "disappointed in the overall cleanliness of the hotel". Dirty carpets, furniture, towels, the non-smoking room smelled as if someone smoked there, stale. Unexpected. We checked in late for one night, so we didn't want to ask for another room, and not sure if it would've helped.  The public restroom in the lobby was filthy and the sink was broken. Needs serious deep cleaning and/or a remodel.

title: Nicely located business hotel, great gym and view.
text:
The staff is amicable, the gym is great, the view is fantastic, and the rooms are bright and comfortable.
BUT the hotel is getting on in years. Defective fittings in the bathroom, dirty carpets, and some scratches on the furniture. Millenium just.....

title: Best view and location in Downtown NY
text:
You can't find a better location to move to NYC attractions or crossing to Jersey. WTC station is across the Hotel main entrance. 
Eventhough there is no operating restaurant in the location you have room service or different eating places alternatives around the Hotel. Staff is very friendly and helpfull I am very satisfied!

title: Nice location and view
text: The rooms are not nice, old furniture and flooring, there are no USB sockets to charge phones, slow internet connection, phones with reception not working, what I liked was the view and the place. staff not friendly , Bar not equipped and not professional people

title: Business Trip - May 2023
text: I recently took a business trip to New York and stayed at the Millenium as it was recommended by my employer.  The bar staff were attentive but I was disappointed in the overall cleanliness of the hotel.

title: Needs an update
text: Needs to be cleaned and redone. Needs a restaurant.  Should offer water bottles for guests...bedframe had questionable stains.  Everything is dated and absolutely no security -anyone can walk up and head to elevators....grossly overpriced

title: Avoid at all costs
text:
As a business traveller I had a very poor experience staying at the Millenium.

The location is convenient, close to WTC and the PATH and Fulton St. Subway stations. The views from the rooms are amazing looking at WTC and the waterline

The hotel itself in terms of facilities is shockingly poor.

1. Internet is slow (5 mbps) to non existent
2. The IT systems that enable the hotel staff are constantly breaking down..so checkin, asking for additional keys etc takes forever
3. The room temperature is not adjustable. The HVAC is a glorified fan
4. The front staff are poorly trained to anticipate the needs of the guests. So when you ask for a change (ex: additional key) they go back to the horrible IT system and its a forever wait

I will be skipping this hotel completely

title: Excelente ubicación a precio accesible
text: Hotel con una ubicación excelente al frente de World Trade Center y con múltiples accesos al metro. Ademas para caminar en el area downtown cerca de todo. El gimnasio muy bien. Estilo un poco viejo pero nada relevante.

title: Perfect location!
text:
Perfect location in Manhattan! Great staff and large room, helpful service. 
We would recommend this hotel if you want to discover New York in a couple of days. 
Close to metro, busses etc. 
Great concierge and helpful for taxi

title: Good location
text: A good location to discover New York City. Nice and helpful personel. Only the rooms could use a make over. They are a little dated, but the size is good. A plus is the metro station nearby. And the hotel view is nice.

title: Great location the room is very outdated but the bed is nice.
text: Too bad the sleeping sofa looks much bigger on the website. It only fits 1 person allthough we clearly indicated that we are a party of 4 (2 adults 2 kids) after checking with the reception The alternative would be an upgrade for an extra $300 per night (negotiated fee). We already paid $350 per night so paying $650 per night for a 2 queensize bed room was just too much. Instead we took one of the kids in our bed. Also the carpet is old, outdated and torn. Too bad because the location is excellent. Welcome to New York….

title: Good Value
text: Great location and friendly staff. I had an awesome view of the World Trade Center memorial. There's great shopping and lots of activities nearby. The hotel is also next to all subway lines. The amenities were not great, but acceptable.

title: Not a 4 star for sure
text: Terrible service.   Agent at check-in tells me I have to go sit in lobby to fix reservation cause he can’t, then back in line, and then more stuff he can’t fix. No parking despite booking saying there was.  No hand towel and had to call twice to finally get some. Never again!

title: Look elsewhere
text: Beds are tiny and uncomfortable. This hotel doesn’t have basic necessities in the room like microwave or mini fridge. The staff is not helpful or concerned about the issues. I would likely never stay here again.

title: A spectacular view… but that’s all
text:
Was here on business, so can’t really complain too much.  But, for those who are spending their hard-earned cash on a luxury vacation spot, steer clear.  Clean and serviceable, and with a worthy view (be sure you ask for a west-facing room, and high up in the tower), but they would not earn any Michelin stars for quality of site or service  Total failure to keep up with the fine details of a luxury establishment (such as the decaying door stop and half-peeled stickers in the bath — see pics) or a modern one (no USB charging ports and way too few standard electrical outlets for the modern complement of techno prostheses we all carry).  As for service, see the pictures of what I got when I ordered breakfast from “in room dining” (looks like it came from the local Wendy’s and didn’t taste any better), and I had to fight tooth and nail with the front desk to get a “complimentary” one hour extension on check out (see narrative below for details).  Might do better (and save money) to hire a helicopter tour of Manhattan, and stay at a more affordable and less pretentious establishment.

My experience with a request for late check out (standard is 11am; I was hoping for 12 or 1):  When I called to inquire, I was told that it was “subject to availability,” only complimentary until 12pm, an extra $50 for 1pm, and $100/hour after that.  I went ahead and requested the 1pm checkout; but then, after “checking further,” the clerk told me there was actually no availability for late check out all, and I would have to leave at 11am.  Stunned and, quite frankly, incredulous, I asked to speak to a supervisor.  After putting me on hold for about 10 minutes, the clerk returned to tell me that no supervisor was available (they must also have been unable to get a late checkout); however, after checking further with the front desk, I could be given the complimentary 12pm checkout. Nice, eh?  I suspect someone was hoping I wouldn’t write this review.  Too late (no pun intended).

title: Erroneous Charges, Be Aware!
text: I was charged without notice or receipt for a false discrepancy. When I called about it, I was brushed off and the issue is still ongoing. The exact words; 'you must go thru your bank, we cannot help'

title: long wait for checkin
text: staff up on check in staff, wait to check in was too long.  This was a major inconvenience for me as had to change my business plans. The Bellman were very accommodating and I ended up changing in the Lobby Bathroom.

title: Not worth the cost of services or amenities
text: This hotel charges 45$ USS per day - for such things as unlimited use of the business centre and wifi. Avoid paying for services you don't pay for at other hotels...also stay home where wifi doesnt cost 45$ a day.

title: Great and Friendly Service
text: The bellhops were very informative about the city and which transits to take. (Even walked me to one in front of building) Room was nice but definitely needed a little cleaning.. water was hot and good pressure… amazing view of the bridges and city.. elevators were quick.. just wished the room had a microwave and fridge since we brought back a lot of food from nearby places.

title: Room issues, but kind staff
text: Could not control the temp of the room (you could set the temp, but it would never actually cool down) and the air conditioner clanged so it was hard to sleep. No fridge, bed lamp didn’t work. I was only there 2 nights so it wasn’t a huge deal but pretty surprising for such a nice hotel. Staff did provide me with a complimentary toothbrush when I realized I forgot mine, everybody was incredibly nice. View from the room was also incredible!

title: Great location in FIDI (Financial District)
text: The Staff at the hotel was excellent. I arrived early and my room wasn’t available, but they held my luggage so I could attend a conference. I asked for a room with a view and was rewarded with a beautiful view of the Oculus on the 30th floor. My room was outdated and the carpet was clean but had aged stains. This dulled the experience only slightly. Staff and location made it worthwhile. Checked out Suited restaurant which is a short walk. Also a short walk to Brooklyn Bridge, Southside Side Seaport and Statten Island Ferry. Can’t miss the 9/11 Memorial. Overall, a great stay.

title: Excellent location, amazing views.
text: We went on a family trip and this hotel location was the best around. The views and the easy access to the tourist attractions was wonderful. We traveled with 3 little ones and the room was big enough for all of us. Comfortable beds and friendly staff

title: Terrible
text: I was extremely disappointed is the amount of deferred service at this hotel. The images on line did not meet the quality of room I was given. Also why does my comments are mandatory of 200 characters. After completing this long survey that is frustrating

title: Great place to stay in lower Manhattan
text: Very much enjoyed my stay at the Millennium Downtown. Large corner room with plenty of space to work and recuperate. I was graciously provided with an early check-in, which helped tremendously with my ill-advised scheduling. Room and bath were both very clean, but no fridge or microwave (small inconvenience).

title: Never Stay Here
text: Not only will they not have your room that was booked weeks in advance ready even 5 or 6 hours after check-in time starts, but the elevators do not function well and you may end up taking the stairs (keep in mind I think they have 55 floors so best of luck). Will they answer the phone if you call to tell them the elevators aren't stopping for people? No. Will they send people up to try to get you? No. Will they apologize? Also no.

title: Great location needs updating
text: Location is great! Views were awesome. To make this a more pleasurable trip, the rooms need updating! The room was clean however the drapery was old the carpets were old and stained. The color of the room was very outdated. For the price and location it was worth it.

title: Disapointed
text: No shower gel when it's empty, no water bottles every day , no restaurant for breakfast, no mini bar in bedroom, bar of hôtel closed two nights a week in our période... We often travel, and for this kind of hôtel, these services are included everywhere

title: Great View, Great Employees, Working on some issues
text: Booked online and had seen some not so great reviews but were pleasantly surprised by the space in our room and the view was amazing.  Yes the rooms are dated and the carpet is not perfect and we had issues with  the elevators, but for NYC this hotel is great for the price.  If you want fluffy towels and want to pay $600 a night to get them then don't book this place.  If not, Location is nice for downtown tourist stuff but close enough to Soho, Tribeca and Nolita to walk.

title: Recomendado
text: Excelente ubicación, cerca a todos los sitios de interés del bajo Manhattan, viajamos en familia, con niños y fue fácil caminar a todos los puntos, hay una estación de metro a la salida del hotel. Excelente relación calidad precio, nos gustó mucho!!

title: Good from far but far from being good
text: Might have been very unlucky to get the only dirty room of the whole building but as I have been promised it cleaned and changed for the past 40h I think I can just say that if you are ready to be called darling and sweetheart by a total stranger who is not helpful and spend time in a room full of stains on carpet and furniture then you are in room 3405 at a Hilton Hotel which is just Hilton by the name on the door but certainly not the service you would expect for the price and the location

title: Poor and Tired Hotel
text: This hotel is old and needs to be refreshed.  The elevator banks were not working, except for one which created long lines at the lobby and on each floor.  Staff did not even ask how our stay was since they didn't want to hear the feedback.  I will not stay here again.

title: Great View and location
text:
View is unbeatable! Rooms are a bit outdated but super clean and comfortable. Fitness room is Good , Restaurant closed (but great alternatives everywhere around). We did not any adjacent rooms/guests. Ja Ing a Junior Suite with 2 children was a Good Choice. We would come back! 
I would have loved to know in advance that there was no real breakfast. Serving it in to rooms without a table is no alternative…

title: Guest
text:
The location is excellent, close to all transportation to downtown.
I think some stuff could be more kindly and friendly. The elevator do not worked well and it is short for number of guest. Besides those little big things it’s perfect  place for a weekend

title: Don’t stay here!
text:
This hotel has seriously gone downhill since dropping the Hilton name. 
The rooms are outdated with furniture literally falling apart.  Water temperature goes from cold to hot and back. Only one elevator was working in the upper tower leading to long wait times.  
The price and location are awesome, but there are other hotels close by that are much better.  This place is just mailing it in.

title: JUST NOT A 4* HOTEL
text: Poor Room Quality, Unclean, Outdated furniture. Outdated bathroom. Non existant services, No Fridge, Dirty coffee machine, Dirty Linen, Smelly Bathroom, Dirty Carpet. Poor lighting..... You feel taken advantage off.

title: The best for your bucks!
text:
We would stay again. The rooms could use a renovation/ make over! 
The view was really pretty from 46 floors up at night! If your out of state driving GPS WILL CONFUSE YOU!!! Suggest getting a Uber/taxi when you enter cause you’ll be doing circles… Uber to time square range from $30-$50 not bad you get to see everything while going to your destination which is nice!

title: Being swindled
text: Guests should not be hustled or have to bid on rooms they have previously or appropriately reserved.  I was coerced and haggled to pay additional money to have assess for a room I reserved timely.  I felt like I was being swindled.

title: Gran experiència.
text: Excelente ubicación y comunicaciones. Vistas y servicio post-estancia. Nos ayudaron de forma excepcional a recuperar nuestra camara fotogràfica que descuidamos en el hotel. Muchas gracias. La única pega q tuvimos es que la cafeteria estaba en obras.

title: Good stay
text: A good place to stay; close to stations (many railway lines) and ferries to NJ and Downtown. Many shops and stores nearby. Friendly staff, helped in storing luggage after checkout. Just, the facility is a bit old.

title: Camere sporche e vecchie
text:
Hotel con camere sporche e mobili vecchi. Moquette inguardabile da quanto era sporca.
Ho prenotato una suite con camera matrimoniale e salottino con divano letto, che  è inutilizzabile, con materasso molto fine, si sentono le molle sotto. Inoltre la forma del materasso è a banana quindi impossibile dormirci. Mi sono fatta dare due letti aggiunti, me ne volevano far pagare uno dei due, che alla fine non ho pagato dopo aver quasi litigato con la ricezione. 
E alla fine, sorpresa: mi hanno addebitato due volte la stanza in due giorni differenti, me ne sono accorta solo una volta lasciato l’albergo, adesso sono in attesa del rimborso, speriamo che oltre che avere poca cura dell’hotel, non siano anche disonesti !

title: Convenient Location but Unclean
text: I needed to change rooms multiple times do to issues with rooms being dirty. I was stuck in an elevator because only one was running and it took 20min for the elevator to arrive in the first place. My company was having remote members stay here as it is close to the office but after the most recent experience our company will be having our staff stay elsewhere when they are in town.

title: How is this considered a 4 star hotel ?! Beware!
text:
Sad to say our stay at the millennium was far less than great. I’ll start with the pros : location, it was quiet, incredible view, and very comfortable bed. Otherwise - huge thumbs down. Only one elevator is working so I spent over an hour each day trying to get up and down from the 39th floor. One day I had to climb down 39 flights of stairs with my young daughter. If you read reviews you’ll see that this has been an issue for months. How can they not fix this? Only at the end of our trip did we learn from another guest that we could take a service elevator, but most don’t know that. 
We paid for a junior suite so our daughter could sleep on a pull out couch. That pull out couch was broken but we were thankful they could deliver a roll out cot for us. Most things in the room were broken though… the safe, the ac, the shower… and everything was very beat up. Wallpaper peeling off the walls, etc. I just don’t understand how this hotel is operating.

title: No Promised Amenities
text: I booked a trip for my sister who is a veteran to experience WTC and enjoy a hotel experience where she could swim in a pool and have breakfast in a restaurant. You waited till we got there before you notified us that those things were not available. Front desk staff were limited and calling food services to order breakfast was very challenging. It was fine once it arrived but we had to eat it in our room.

title: Great Hotel
text: I will stay again, super clean, has nice staff, amazing location. The location could not be better, the staff was so nice and our room was spotlessly clean. The Staff was amazing, our daughter got a bit sick from something we ate at one of the museums and the cleaning lady was super helpful, she brought us extra water, blankets, and tissue. She was super nice and said goodbye on our last day. Now we love NYC even more.

title: Nice Stay
text: We had an 4 night stay at this place.. and overall we enjoyed the location, facilities and property.. there were many eateries nearby.. and the hotel is just direct opposite one World Trade Center… overall good experience

title: Amazing location!
text: Everyone extremely kind, located in south Manhattan in strategy location! The rooms a bit old style but the view takes your breath away!. The subway is in front of the hotel: yellow line for the main entrance on 55 Church Street  and, blu line in Fulton Street .

title: Great location and awesome view from the room
text: The staff is friendly and helpful. They gave us a warm welcome and did their best to make us feel comfortable. Location is great and the view from the room was amazing! We would definitely come back, especially if we can find a good deal.

title: Family visit
text: Love our stay, location and view amazing. Near the subway, walking all weekend loved it. Hotel was clean, view, the space , comfort was perfect. Staff were polite. Restaurant right in front of the hotel. Could ask for more.

title: Excellent downtown hotel
text: The location is excellent, close to shopping, restaurants, sightseeing and the WTC Memorial. Our first visit but it will not be our last one. My only comment is that only 2 elevators were working to the upper floors and we had a long wait at pick hours

title: A beautiful room in a beautiful place
text: We stayed in the Junior Suite at the 26th floor for one week. The skyline by our room was stunning and the staff was very kind and helpful. The room was spacious and clean and there was everything we needed. It was a beautiful experience.

title: Below expectations
text:
Improvements needed to meet the expectations of a 4 star hotel.
Despite the very good location, the arrival was far below what would be expected. Our Reservation was confirmed by the reservation website, but the hotel system seems not to be connected to it. It took us some time to resolve the problem. This cannot happen again.
Being four people in one room, our need was not met. For example, every morning there were only 3 towels instead of 4, and our first breakfast was delivered wrongly (only for 3 people again).

title: Excellent Millenium experience
text:
Excellent location and price value 
Near very important attractions and restaurent. 
Beside was a Delly breakfast and lunch, so delicious, fresh and tasty, sandwiches, pan cake with blue berry, eggs, cheese cakes , cappuccino etc.. etc… for very affordable price. Daily breakfast there 8 days in a row.  Walking distance to another wonderful resto Barbula italien dishes and steak.  Next year for sure we stay at the the millenium.

title: Thieves at the front desk.
text: We stayed there 5 days and every day when someone cleaned we were charged for cleaning fee. They made up that we smoked in our room so they could charge us $500. They told us it’s a free high floor upgrade and yet we got charged for that.

title: Didn’t have any amenities inside the room, the jacuzzi didn’t work, awesome view.
text: Didn’t have any amenities inside the room, the jacuzzi didn’t work, awesome view. Only one elevator worked it was a line getting up to my room. The security made me feel unwanted by stopping only me when entering the build and no other guest

title: I did not have a comfortable stay
text: The heating and cooling systems of the hotel were two separate systems, and now that it is spring, only the fan was on. The room temperature was 82 degrees at noon and cold at night and everything from the bedding to the shower curtain smelled unpleasant.

title: Nicole
text: The location is great, but the rooms are extremely outdated and the carpet has rips and stains all over. The rooms were also very warm and the air was not yet turned on in the building. The solution from the front desk was to open a window. I would not recommend this hotel and will not be staying here again.

title: Light and shade
text: Located very close to nearly all Metro lines and path. Located in front of WTC and close to a lot of pubs and restaurants. The upper levels have a great view. We had 48th level to Brooklyn. AC was not working because of spring season.

title: Not recommended
text: Not a good experience from arrival to departure.  Poor service.  unclean common areas.  No response from staff for simple requests. Restaurant was closed but no option to buy snakes or water. had to selp park blocks away.

title: Beware of hidden fees, they will never get paid
text: The views of the hotel are great and the room was extremely cozy and the locations is great. With that being said, be mindful that the post reservation care is quite slow, I've been waiting for a deposit refund for 2 months, sent emails and never got a response. I had a phone call with some sort of customer service department and my refund request seems to never have been logged. Makes no sense to me that I need to chase a refund for something so simple for 2 months.

title: Wow! What a view!
text: This is our second stay at the millenium, and I highly recommend it! When we checked in, it was late on a Saturday, and our room was on a lower level. It was a beautiful view overlooking the Oculus, but knowing what the higher floors were like, we spoke with a very kind gentleman Terquane, who told us to come see him the next day and he would help us. When we went back in the morning, he was not there yet, but spoke with an absolutely lovely woman, Petra. She was so kind and moved us all the way up to one of the top floors with the most incredible views!  The staff is all just so friendly. Michael from guest services was such a wonderful person and brought us everything we could’ve possibly needed! Comfortable rooms, comfortable beds, and so close to everything. Subway stations are right there, restaurants, coffee, shops, drug stores. And being so close to the One World tower was spectacular. Thank you so much for the wonderful stay! And almost forgot to mention Vince from management. Shortly after booking, I realized it was a no cancel option I had chosen. Prices had come down after the fact, and after reaching out, he waived the resort fee as a courtesy. Hard to find that service anymore. Thank you again!

title: Amazing Hotel
text: This Hotel has amazing staff and some of the best views.  The location is unbeatable, don't miss an amazing hotel.  Not only will you be stunned by the breathe taking view but you will be comfortable in their well appointed rooms!

title: Do not stay here
text: Hot, uncomfortable room. Was stuck in the elevator for 45 minutes. The security team members were rude during the ordeal. Management offered to cover our stay and then the next morning only offered to comp one night.

title: Nice Hotel in great location, but be carefull with the pricing
text:
We had a great time at the hotel. The view of our Junior-Suite was stunning. The Kingsizebed was so comfortable. The size of the room was great. There were some small issues which didn't lesson our experience: the heater didn't work properly, it was not possible to lower the room temperature; the refrigerator didn't work; the convertible couch was not comfortable at all.
But the prizing of the room was a big issue. I was offered a great prize, but by the end of the booking procedure the prize was 50% higher than the original offer. As someone else had made the reservation for me, I didn't realized the prize different before the checkout. -

title: Excellent services that I would recommend to my friends and family.
text: The services are excellent and the staff very helpful. The guide in getting transport to my business area was good and the site is exciting being in the historic city of WTC. I would recommend the hotel.

title: Fun visit to NYC
text: The location was perfect for visiting the 9/11 area. Loved being on the 41st floor with a wonderful view of the city. All staff were courteous, friendly and attentive. Parking was close by and we did get a discount.

title: Ubicación perfecta, mejor imposible.
text: Muy lindo hotel frente al WTC. La habitación es amplia y cómoda. Pero deberían modernizarla un poco. Tiene una alfombra horrible. El baño muy deteriorado. La limpieza impecable. El wifi por momentos no funciona bien.

title: Good Location Bad Suite
text: The location was good and convenient for walking to 9/11 memorial, and Battery Park/Statue of Liberty. The room suite was outdated, old dirty couch, hard bed, no refrigerator or microwave. The construction noise was loud which made it hard to sleep in the morning.

title: Hilton honors is a total scam
text:
I purchased a prepaid trip to Sedona Arizona with the promise of $15,000 points 
The only reason I pre-purchase The hotel was to get some free nights in my hometown of Goleta California. Lo and behold it cost 26,000 points to get the CHEAPEST hilton hotel possible... Goleta is a nothing town.  Total scam and total ripoff!

title: Poor quality room but a great view.
text: Extremely outdated, dirty rooms as well poor communication between staff. Beautiful view and great deal for the observatory package but room needs some desperate TLC. If you don’t mind the trade off then it is great but this is by no means a 4-star hotel in my opinion.

title: Great location
