text: The bathrooms and carpet need some refurbishment. The location is excellent. Close to subway and local attractions. The staff is attentive and nice. Easy check in and check out process. Close to shopping.

title: Disappointing
text: This hotel is at such a great location! I was very hopeful it would be a good stay, but I was extremely disappointed with my experience. The room was dusty and not very clean. There was vomit in one of the elevators. The heat was so intense and there was no way to change it in your room - I had to sleep on top of the bed and not in the bed.

title: Good experience
text:
This hotel is a great location for touring the 9-11 museum and then hopping a tour bus to see the rest of the city.  The staff was great and the room on the 23rd flood gave us a view of the monument from above.

We only had 24 hours and the hop on hop off bus was the way to go.

title: Eva B.
text: Perfect location and very friendly staff. The room was clean, nothing fancy, but the view was fantastic from our room on the 45th floor overlooking the 9/11 Memorial. We only spend one night at Millennium Downtown, but I'm sure we will be back.

title: Filthy, with appalling customer service.
text:
Hard to know where to begin. The room was filthy. I reached down to lift what i thought was a piece of thread the cleaners had missed, to discover it was some kind of red sauce; there were multiple older stains on the carpet and the sofa was too dirty to sit on. I worked in the room for a couple of hours and then got a little chilly so turned the heat on just before going out for an hour. On my return I quickly developed an allergic reaction, sneezing, eyes streaming. I turned off the heat and the problem eased. On examining the HVAC vent by the window I found it was disgustingly dirty - the dust it was sending around the room was the problem. 

I had to extend my stay for work reasons. The staff member I spoke to was astonishingly unhelpful. She told me the hotel would not extend my room - I would have to make an online booking that they would then connect to my existing one. She refused to acknowledge this was in any way bizarre. I followed her instructions as I was left with no choice and on checkout I was asked by another member of staff why I had two bookings for the same night - I had to fight to avoid being charged twice. My colleague extended with another staff member with no issues. I may stay again as the room size was helpful to my work, but this was one of my most negative hotel experiences ever (my line of work means many of my nights are spent in hotels).

title: NYC Experience
text: Overall good location with great views of the city. If you’re into architecture, this would be an ideal place as long as you stay on the higher floors. I would definitely consider visiting the hotel again if I’m staying in Manhattan.

title: Hotel with serious SECURITY and HEALTH issues!
text:
Please, read all!

I had a very unpleasant experience staying at Millennium Downtown New York. 
I booked a Junior Suite for 3 people for EIGHT (8) nights and the price was not at all equivalent to the services provided (300 USD a night):
Arrival day: 
-	No towels, no extra bed made, no fridge, heating not working (that was a serious problem during our 8 nights stay).
-	Extra bed to be done took more than 4 (FOUR) hours after first call.
-	The publicity of the Hotel showed a comfortable queen sofa bed at the entrance of the room (that the room could be for 4 adults and 3 children), the reality was a small sofa bed that a person with 1,60 cm slept with her feed outside.
-	Very cold room, when trying to put the heat on it did not work and it was like a “stone crusher” was being used inside the room.
Second day: 
-	At the reception, when I explained that the room was cold and asked if there was an electric heater available, the receptionist told me to BUY ONE AT A SHOP CLOSE TO THE HOTEL. Do you think it is acceptable as an answer?  
-	For the bed he said they would install an extra bed. What was done, but it was a VERY old bed. 
-	For the fridge I was told it could be installed and I WOULD HAVE TO PAY for it. What I did, but in many years of traveling I could never imagine a hotel without a fridge with a room costing around USD 300 a night. Can you?

Hotel had no restaurant; in room breakfast was brought on a bag (really bad presentation and food); had no bar; there was a construction going on the main entrance; carpet was very dirty all over, corridor and room, very old, dirty and unhealthy carpet; the hotel had no direct call to hotel itself, guests would speak with someone in India or elsewhere, anything you had to ask would take hours.

Worse part: check out day, around 8:30am,  there was a couple sleeping on the corridor, probably for hours, pissed on themselves, snoring and totally obstructing our passage. Their belongings spread allover.
Where was security? How can no one have noticed? 

Were we safe the eight nights at the hotel? I do not think so.
Is the heating certified for human health? I do not think so.

It is a hotel with very serious problems!

PS: it is not a Hilton!

title: Charges additional $30+/day for INconvenience!!
text: This hotel has hidden charges and they don’t deliver basic amenities, like bottled water and a working thermostat.  In my room there is a thermostat on the wall, but my room got warmer after I turned the numbers down.  When I called the desk the lady told me the entire hotel is set at one temperature and can’t be changed.  She sent a building engineer to turn off the heater in my room.  When he arrives he said turning the heater off was not possible.  He sent another engineer and he told me I needed to move to a lower level to get the room cooler.  He said he would get me a fan for the evening.  No one brought me a fan or followed up in any way.  The next day the coffee packets and water were not restocked.  When I called the desk the lady said someone would bring it to me in 20 minutes.  They brought me a bag of coffee packets, but no sweetener, no cup lids, and no bottled water.  I called the desk again and I was told someone would bring it up.  No one has come to my room or followed up in any way.  Considering I am charged over $30/day for “convenience” which includes “complementary water”, I would expect to get water.  Do not stay at Melinium Downtown if you want anything more than a stuffy room and tap water to drink.  Disappointing!

title: Terrible experience with hotel
text: Terrible experience. Strongly recommend not to book this hotel. One word the staff loves is my apologies. Better hotel another hotel. Hotel is at good location just. Rest everything’s not good. Please beware.

title: No mattress cover/fitted sheet
text: Disgusting and not helpful. They didn’t have a fitted sheet or mattress cover on in room we had to pay to get into slightly earlier and there was one helpful person and she couldn’t do enough to fix the problem herself and it just took forever!!!!

title: Fantastic stay on my husband’s birthday
text: I wanted to say that our stay has been wonderful but it started the day we checked in. Terquone was wonderful. He provided outstanding service the minute we entered the door. He was courteous, friendly and made our stay even greater. Thank you so much! We’ll come back!

title: Worn and dirty
text: These rooms could be nice if cleaned and not so tired and worn.  Everything was dirty there were things on the walls, doors, and handles.  There was poop spray on the tub curtain from the toilet, there was blood on comforter and curtain, the curtains were stained in multiple places, the baseboards were filthy.   I gave the room a 2 only because the views and location was wonderful.  The staff promised to move us, but when I returned in the evening no one knew anything about this . They were slow and no one seemed to know what was going on.  When I asked what was taking so Lon as I was late for reservations a very rude staff person said they are working on it things don't just happen.There were no more rooms.   They cleaned some and credited back the facilities fee.  Not much comfort.

title: Disappointed
text:
No time to write 200 words 
It is the worst dirty hotel that stay 
No chair no electric cord absurdly disgress not recommended to future gust 
Rain day no umbrella available they carved 10 usd and they charge everything no service except they had 2 bottles of waters

title: The views are amazing but the money isn’t worth it
text: So let’s start off by saying, driving from DC and the hotel not having parking is insane. Secondly, they will charge you a $300 deposit which isn’t mentioned when you are booking. After i checked out they didn’t return my deposit like they said. I had to call them for them to release my fund twice. Tbh im still not sure if it was released because i still haven’t gotten it back yet. The service was trash, no one came to clean our rooms or anything for 3-4 days. The rooms are outdated and have mold in many areas. But the view was amazing. That’s the best part. Everything else sucked fr. No refrigerator you have to pay for that no microwave. The blow dryer didn’t work and i was pissed because i had already washed my hair. Besides the view there is no reason im ever going back to this hotel. I want my deposit back ASAP

title: Welcoming place with great views.
text: Mike, Jiggs and Seth are the most welcoming doormen in NYC, they are what hospitality is all about. The hotel has amazing views, and the best location, close to public transportation the beautiful Brooklyn Bridge, the WTC, the Oculus. There is no other place where I would rather be.

title: Nearby tourist place
text: It’s a place nearby to many important tourist place on the down town so it easy to come in and walk around the city very convenient if you want take the round and visit the whole city even so close to the subways

title: Amazing
text: This is a beautiful hotel with spectacular views. I could see the one world trade center and 9/11 memorial right out of my room window. Beautiful sunrises and sunsets. The location was extremely convenient. Everything we needed was in walking distance.

title: Amazing Location and Views
text: I have stayd with Millenium in another city and had a great experience. This stay was no different as far as the level of service. The amenities were lacking. The television service was severly outdated and the bed felt like I was sleeping on a rock. The bar area seems to be under construction right now which was a surprise.

title: Its okay for the views
text: So the stay was okay i guess. When we checked in we had to pay a $300 refundable deposit that i haven't gotten back yet. The views were amazing dont get me wrong but a lot of things didnt work in our room, hair dryer, no microwave or refrigerator. The hotel a scam to me. Never going back after they charged me more money than my reservations said. They will charge you extra tell you its refundable but they dont refund the money back to you.

title: Best views!
text: Amazing views from our room on 54th floor. Location was everything for us. Near any subway you need to take, directly across from World Trade One Building. Every single staff interaction was friendly and kind. Room was spacious!

title: Slapped with a fee.
text: Didn’t know you couldn’t smoke vapes in the hotel.  Got smacked with a $500 smoking fee, no warning.  This is on top of the $300 security deposit they already charge you for!  For that type of fee you think someone would mention that at check in!

title: Great view, lacking in other ways
text: I was amazed by the view of the WTC from my room.  However, there was no food in the hotel and I was very hungry and didn’t know where to go.  Of course I figured it out but was not prepared.  Also, there was a really disgusting stain on the carpet next to my bed.

title: Helen Y. - Great housekeeper!
text: I loved this hotel as a long stay guest. The staff were always very nice and friendly. Helen was my housekeeper for several months and she always went over and beyond for me. She was always willing to accommodate me with whatever I needed. She is my friend at Millennium!

This hotel is great for its price, especially for the city view! 
I was located on the 22 floor and it was quiet throughout the night, which was really good! The room and bathroom were clean so no issues there.

title: Overall, disappointed.
text:
When I booked the reservation, I called to confirm there was a refrigerator in the room. My partner has allergies so we pack food for her. We get to the hotel and there is no fridge in the room. So, we had to purchase a fridge for $35, which is ridiculous considering that is standard in every hotel I have ever stayed and travel a lot. When they did bring the fridge up, they plopped it on a table I was using to charge my phones and I was asked to remove my things  and just plugged it in with the fridge facing sideways.

The hotel itself was very dated and not well kempt. The lobby was doing construction, one of the elevators was out of order. Just not aesthetically pleasing to the eye in general. 

Our hotel room itself, aside from the views, has a very motel-like feel. Our mirror in the bathroom was broken. We could feel the springs in the mattress, but the sheets were decent.

They charge a "resort fee" of which includes, access to the gym, unlimited international and long distance phone calls, unlimited use of the business center, 1 Citibike pass per day, $10 F & B credit daily, ad 15% off Classic Hop on and Hop Off Big bus tour. Aside from 1 Citibike pass per day, $10 F & B credit daily, ad 15% off Classic Hop on and Hop Off Big bus tour, everything else should be included. So, I think the resort fee is silly. 

Speaking of the $10 credit, we went to go find the restaurant on the 3rd floor to find it completed gutted. So, we were confused where we would use our credit. Maybe they had a grab and go? So in the morning before I was leaving for work, I asked where can I use the food credit. They said oh, you have to order room service.........?

Overall the communication about how things work was non-existent. This all should have been gone over during the time of the check in. 

This brings me to my parking experience. When I called ahead of time before getting to the hotel I asked which parking lot my park and play package included. They told me Icon Parking on Church Street. When I got there, they told me to park on Ann Street, at Little Man Parking. No big. I get there and they say I owe $56. I told them I paid already and gave them my reservation. He said that didn't work. I asked if people often stayed here from the hotel, he said yes. But continued not to help and told me to walk back to the hotel. Before walking back I tried to call with no answer after 5 minutes. Walked back and they validated. Lack of communication.

Overall, not a good experience

title: Cheating and uncoordinated front desk - Poor service
text: Horrible experience will Millennium Downtown. I was assured about no extra charges after checkout and a charge of USD 200 was placed on my card without letting me know. This amounts to nothing less than cheating. This experience has completely spoiled my experience with the hotel.

title: Will stay again!
text: We couldn’t have chosen a better hotel to stay at during our trip! We were conveniently located near the subway station, which takes you anywhere, and the views were a dream. Thank you to the staff that provided such great service!

title: BAD EXPERIENCE
text: Poor customer service. No refrigerator. No pool. No restaurant. Lack of staffing The people at the front desk ran and held $700 on my credit card for accidentals. I tried to get them to reimburse me because I needed the Money to spend that weekend and no help.

title: Amazing View
text:
I was worried after reading the recent negative reviews, but it was obvious that the unfortunate water leak was the main complaint, this was just one of those unfortunate incidents. Party of 3 including my 13 year old daughter checked in on Sat 18th Feb, we got checked in at 13:30, we were given room 8008 but asked to switch rooms as the beds were very small, we were moved to 2905, which offered as what I can only describe as the most amazing hotel room view I have ever experienced...... Sadly the previous occupants had been smoking in the room and the smell of cigarettes was unbearable. The house keeping team were fantastic and arranged via the manager and reception to move to 2906.... the view was equally as impressive.

We were on Bed & Breakfast, the restaurant was closed so we were required to call room service and order breakfast, this was delivered to the room within 20 minutes and was fantastic, they catered for Gluten Free and the quality and quantity of breakfast set us up perfectly for the day. we had everything we needed in the room, including coffee maker, we got also got a kettle from house keeping. 

My only negative was the residents tax that you pay per room, $40 per night, this includes access to the Business Centre (On holiday - why would i need this?) you get daily access to a Citibike but it is only for 1 person and you get $10 to spend at the bar, a pint was $10.89 so basically 1 free drink per day. The bar is closed on a Sunday and it was Presidents day when we were there, so the bar was closed again.

Location is fantastic, access to several subway stations, we also used the NYC Waterways from Brookfield Place (opposite the hotel - 5 mins away) 10 mins walk to Battery park for Statue of Liberty cruise, 10 mins from Statten Island ferry terminal.

Food - We didn't sit in anywhere for food, was always just food on the go, 5 mins to plenty of choices.... Joe's Pizza is a must, $4 a slice, also BROS Pizza, just further along the street, $5 for 2 Slices and a can of soda.

We really enjoyed our 5 nights, the staff are amazing and really helpful. if you can request a room on check in, go for 2906

title: Excelente vistas y ubicación
text: El hotel es viejo y está en reformas. Y te encuentras con algunas desventajas en la entrada. Las camas están geniales. Las vistas excepcionales. El jacuzzi no nos funcionó. Y el sofá cama ni estaba preparado y tuvimos que pedir que nos subieran las sábanas y hacerlos nosotros.

title: Not good
text: We were told there was a pool then got there and were told it was closed. Room was outdated and springs were popping through beds we couldn't sleep. We didn't get the rooms cleaned and had to ask. We didn't get a fridge for my son's medicine or microwave. Not a good stay.

title: Poor furniture quality and dirty rooms
text: Rooms needs complete refurbishing and service quality shoild be drastically upgraded i've been to 35 countries and feels like america has the poorest guest service and quality and cleanliness of rooms ever i had to change the hotel 3 times to find a proper one

title: Great bar scene and location
text: The place is in a great spot and I really liked the car scene. Nathan was an amazing bartender. He was friendly, accommodating and knowledgeable. Would definitely recommend popping in for a drink if you're in the area.

title: Excellent hotel, very good service and very good location
text:
We were staying for vacation in the Millennium Downtown Hotel New York for one week and really enjoyed our vacation there. The room was very clean upon arrival as well as during our stay. Also the service of the reception desk, the concierge as well as the housekeeping was very good. In particular we would like to say thank you to the service of Kofi.

We had a room in the 46th floor with an amazing view on the World Trade Center 1, the Hudson river and Downtown Manhattan and New Jersey. 

Each day we were served with American breakfast in our room, which we liked very much. 

We enjoyed our stay so much and will keep a very good memory of the hotel and will be happy to coming back again.

title: A Great Location for a Great Price
text: My stay at the Millennium Downtown New York was phenomenal.  Every aspect of the hotel was clean and tidy and the staff was so helpful.  The hotel was in a perfect location with sites to see, places to eat, and even a mall to explore.

title: The best housekeeper ever.!!!
text: The housekeeper very nice the sweetest person ever.!!! Very helpful and did an amazing job. SU Quiong Weng. That’s her name. She deserves a rise very professional  and dedicated to her job. In other hotels isn’t the same

title: Needs Full Upgrade
text: We've been coming to this location for 15 years and have witnessed it's deterioration. While there is a lot of construction in the lobby, it is not reflected in the rooms. The furniture in our room had tremendous wear and tear; the shower head is now so small and won't stay adjusted, the water temperature could not be maintained, bathroom vents caked in dust, linens clean, not sure about comforter. Also, the refrigerator has been removed. The location is fantastic with access to every train line and major highway. But, that is not enough for the cost.

title: Mid week business stay
text: Overall the visit was fine. Hotel meets all my basic business needs. There seemed to be some construction going on and staff seemed distracted by it. Asked to have my invoice emailed and never received it.

title: Valentines Day
text: The location and room was amazing. The check in staff made it quick and easy. Only issue was requesting something at night and having to call multiple times downstairs to still not receive the item. I also left something in the room when checking out and was told the cleaning staff did not see it.

title: Worst service
text: The worse experience for a hotel. Service was horrendous. Staff gave misinformation multiple times and never knew what was going on. Rooms were old and dirty. TVs were old and barely worked. Lights in the room were not working and staff never suggested for room change or to make any accommodations to make our stay pleasant. If it was not for the location I don’t think they would still be in business.

title: NYC trip 11-16 Feb 23
text: Hotel is in a great location. Rooms and hotel facilities could do with some updating. The room was particularly warm as the air con did not appear to have much effect. The decor and the furniture are quite dated.

title: Amazing Views
text: The rooms here have the best views of One World Trade Center and the river. I have yet to find a hotel with better views and location.  However, the rooms are needing some updates and repairs (to refrigerator and TV).  No microwave but that's OK since the fridge didn't work anyways.

title: Place should be shut down
text: Horrid place, entrance was leaking, rooms dirty, amenities old, carpets old, phones doesn't work.  All night another gues was screaming.  Avoid this hotel as much as u can.  I have stayed here under Hilton and the experience was amazing. Less than 5 years later..New management has let this go to a shelter home

title: Nice smile and hello from reception
text: I am happy to stay this millennium central hotel for my business trip. One very important things here in Kuwait is to have a good starting , encouraging myself with a help of hotel services. Ms.Smrity at reception gives me a big smile and hello every time , and helping me about laundry, left key in room etc,. I am having a comfortable stay, thanks to all staffs.

title: Amazing hotel at a great location and great price...service is a bit of a letdown though
text:
I would have given this 5 stars but the service at the hotel let me down a bit. Staying for 10 nights at the hotel, I experienced service delays and at times, no one even bothered to show up to tend to the query. There was some confusion about the responsibility sets and no one could provide a direct answer without reaching out to someone else.
I would definitely stay here again because the hotel is at a great location, next to all possible options for the subway and decently priced. Also, the rooms are very nice and spacious as compared to the other hotels in NYC.

title: Not a good feeling and immense hidden charges
text:
I didn’t like the welcome, out of 3 elevators only one worked at times we had to wait 5 minutes, rooms super old. However the worst thing, I made an upgrade of 40$ per night for 4 night total 160$. I got charged 347, when I asked why I got this email:

Good day,  
  
Thank you for contacting the Millennium Downtown NY.  
  
Kindly see the attached folio. We charge a mandatory Facility Fee of $34.43 per night.
This includes:
$10 credit each day towards the lobby bar or in room dining breakfast in the morning
24-hour access to the business center and fitness center
1 Citi bike pass each day
15% hop on and hop off bus tour
Local and Long-distance calling
WIFI

My room didn’t include breakfast, the phone was not working and the 10$ at the bar they described it as voucher not extra charge, also never aware about the citi bike and 15% hop on hop off bus (why would anyone charge for a discount they give in something I never used???)
I was not aware of any of that until I found the charge in my card.
I have appealed with TRIP.com where I made the booking and waiting.
Stay away from Millennium downtown NY. I love NY and that note nearly ruined my trip

title: Location is good
text: Location is almost perfect, but the level our room was located the hall was dirty and old, we went up a few more levels and those were renovated. It was my BD and I was charged to checking 2h earlier.

title: broken pipes and elevator
text: They had a pipe burst two weeks ago that they failed to mention when I booked an upon arriving the elevators were broken and there were huge holes in the ceiling. Was really dissapointed they failed to say anything or I would have never booked.

title: Don’t stay at this hotel.
text: Thermostat was broken. Vent for air A/C , heater was caked with dust. Room phone was broken. Refrigerator was unplugged. They do not provide rooms with that amenity any longer. They removed handle off the cabinet. Doesn’t look very good. Walls are dirty and dented. Sheetrock exposed.

title: Great location for NYC vacation
text: This was my third visit to NYC this year and I wish I had found this hotel prior to stay in it the first couple times. For the same price, this was 100 times better, room bigger and certainly staff was much nicer. Maybe because I am bias but I love my immigrants who are hard workers and were so nice, helpful with a smile. It is a treat for NYC, I know. The location was perfect and for the same price as other not so good hotels this will certainly be my choice for every future visit.

title: Excellent Guest Service
text: The Experience at Downtown Millennium is always excellent.  I visit NYC and this is where I love staying. ANYONIO at the Front Desk is a professional par excellence.  He remembers me as an often visiting guest by my name and this impressive. He makes  sure all your requests for your stay at this Hotel is followed out to a Tee. Thank you Antonio for making each visit memorable.  I'll be back soon

title: Where Was Management?
text:
We had the misfortune of being on a high floor on Saturday night, Feb 4, when the fire alarm went off around 12:30 am.  Foolishly or not, we decided not to walk downstairs.  The alarm ran for about 45 minutes.  Two hours later, there were people banging on the doors wanting to talk to us.  We of course didn’t open the door, but they identified themselves as hotel security and told us that a pipe had burst, and to ignore the alarms if they went off again.  Fine.  

Here’s an idea - slip a note under the door?  Or use the intercom to make some announcements?    At some point I think they did use the intercom - but suffice it to say, it wasn’t the GM or someone with authority on the intercom.  

When we went to leave in the morning at around 10 am, we discovered that the elevators weren’t working.  I called Guest Services.  When someone finally picked up after many rings, we were told the elevators to the top were out of service and we’d have to walk down to the 30th floor to get the other bank of elevators.  Uh — here again, how were we supposed to know this?  Maybe someone could have called people on these floors?  Or use the intercom?

This isn’t about a broken pipe or broken elevators.  Stuff happens.  And the staff were all working hard.  This is about what appeared to be a complete lack of leadership and management.

title: Business Travel
text: I recently stayed at the Millennium Hotel Downtown Manhattan and was very disappointed with the quality of the hotel. I stayed in a junior suite which was one of the better rooms in the hotel however the carpets and sofa were very stained and the wall paper was peeling off the walls. I would not recommend this hotel as there are much better options available just around the corner.

title: No Notice of Added Fees + Taxes + "Optional Donation"
text:
My colleagues and I stayed at the Millenium for a work trip. We were unable to spend the "Facilities" fee (and additional taxes) at the hotel because the restaurant and bar were closed. No one asked if we were interested in contributing to the “Optional Donation” and we were not aware of it until reviewing the bill. I am requesting that these fees, taxes, and "donation" amounts be removed from my bill. We all know hotel "fees and taxes" are often added, but those added for the Millenium hotel were just ridiculous.

On a good note, the front desk individual who checked us in was very kind and gave me and my colleague a room upgrade and the concierges were fantastic. All that said, the front desk never made mention of these "additional fees" whatsoever so, that needs to be taken into consideration...

title: Amazing Stay!
text: I’ll be honest before I left I checked the reviews and it was very split. Some good some bad. But I decided I would try it out. And I was not disappointed at all! I requested a specific room and it was ready for me as soon as I got there! Even though I was early by 1 hour I was able to go straight to my room at no extra early charge! My junior suite was perfect with an amazing view! I couldn’t find many vaults with my entire expierice. The only 2 things I would change would be to upgrade the TVs. It seemed outdated with very poor resolution so I just ended up using my iPad. The only other thing was I had originally made a reservation for the wrong dates. This was easily fixed by the staff. However, when I asked for some type of confirmation that the dates had been successfully changed they told me they do not provide receipts or confirmation emails. And me being out of state I was nervous that they would not have a room for me and if that happened I wouldn’t have had proof to say I booked for those dates. Luckily nothing happened like that and my room was ready 1 hour early! Definitely will stay they again in the future!

title: Excellent Views; Wonderful location
text: Celebrated my anniversary here. Fell in love with the views. The location is very convenient and lively. At first, we weren't given the rooms we paid for. We had to talk to the manager and pay more money to get a room at higher floor. Why advertise the wrong rooms? The air conditioner/heater in our room was loud. The hotel needs to upgrade the charger points; they were loose and hidden below a platform above their work desk.

title: The best location and place to stay
text:
A hotel that makes it easy - everything is with a smile and fast done. Even when the elevator broke down the staff took us by their employee elevator. 
We called the reception and 5 min later they were there to fix the issue, we asked for more coffee and done. Everything fixed and easy - also when leaving - easy checkout and good support and service all days - can only be recommended - The staff really works with effort and care.

title: Great
text: Location is great. Concierge team was fantastic. Views are incredible. I definitely would stay here again if and when I come back to NYC. Only thing is, don't show up too much earlier than check in. $100 early check in fee (Which is somewhat understandable. Just hard for some who had a plane delay and just want to rest or something like we did)

title: Thank you!
text: Wonderful staff, easy location to drive and park, very clean. Overall we had a terrific experience and I would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting NYC. We will absolutely stay again during our next trip to the city.

title: Just Ok
text:
Check in was rough.  Line was long and they swiped my card too many times.
Elavators were not working at check in or check out. We had to take service elvators at check out
Location/view is great - thanks for accomdoating our request
The room does not have a lot of outlets to plug in phones, etc

title: 1st Time in New York
text: Excellent views of New York. Conveniently located for walking to destinations. Hotel was extremely clean and entire staff was very friendly. only issue was elevator was down for a bit but staffing took care of accommodating everyone quickly. we will be back!

title: Solid 4 Star, looks directly at Ground Zero/ Freedom Tower
text: Stayed one night and got the job done. Used to be a Millennium Hilton, but they are now owned by either a British or Chinese chain and many of the employees I spoke to shared their disdain seeing the Hotel leave the Hilton family which they felt has downgraded the quality for guests (as well as their benefits and perks). The rooms are spacious with big views, however fairly outdatd. On a personal level- this Hotel (and many of the views in room) look directly at Ground Zero and the Freedom Tower (WTC rebuilt following 9/11). Being this close to the structure, especially if you or a loved one was present for or gravely impacted by, may not be the most comfortable.

title: Excellent séjour
text: Nous avons été très bien accueillis. Vue magnifique, emplacement parfait, personnel adorable merci mille fois. Juste le wifi qui se déconnectait fréquemment m, du coup difficile de travailler sereinement

title: Nice location but dirty
text: The room and location are very nice, but the room was very dirty. The bathroom floor was sticky. It seemed like they didn't wipe the floor in a while, and there were hairs everywhere. Also, it looks like they never replaced the vent..

title: What happened to the pool??
text:
This was our hotel of choice for years. Great location, accessible to family in Brooklyn, the views...but the highlight for our kid was fantastic INDOOR pool! Especially during cold winter visits, it was the highlight. 
Will it be reopening? 
Not that we now stay in other hotels with pools, but it would be so depressing to return to the Millennium Hilton with the memory of the pool that is now closed off. 
What a bummer.

title: まあまあ
text: チェックイン時対応してくれた方がすごく親切で、スーペリアルームを予約したにも関わらず50階のお部屋を用意してくださいました。ただアメニティはシャンプー、トリートメント、ボディソープしか用意がなく歯ブラシすらありません。ワールドトレードセンターの近くで最寄駅も複数あり立地はいいですが、ダウンタウンなのでタイムズスクエアやフィフスアベニューなどアップタウンに向かうには地下鉄で20-30分ほどかかりました。ホテルの近くにホールフーズやターゲットがあったので外食をせずにスーパーで食事を済ませたい方には繁華街のホテルよりも向いていると思いますが、部屋に冷蔵庫が無いので食品の保管に困りました。また電子レンジはフロントに言えば使えるが別途で料金がかかると言われたので暖かいものがあまり食べられませんでした。チェックイン後、ホテルの方にこのままLGAへ向かうので約$60でウーバーを呼んだと伝えたらタクシーでなら$35で行けると言われウーバーをキャンセルし、ホテルの方がわざわざタクシーを捕まえてくれたのですが、結局タクシーで一番低い14%のチップ込みで$80ほど請求されました。迎車料金などの説明は一歳されなかったので、旅の最後に少し嫌な気持ちをしたなと思いました。

title: Not that great except for the views
text:
We booked the junior suite and most amenities were either missing in the room or were not there at all. 
Only one bath towel, no iron, no robes, no mini fridge, some lights were not working in the room, one of the TVs didn’t work, the other TV only gave access to basic channels, no option to connect to streaming services. We requested late checkout at 12 and was received however the cleaning lady came banging on the door multiple times before the agreed checkout time. I had really high expectations and none were met except for the view however, one window was really dirty and nothing could be seen from there.

title: L’apparenza inganna.
text: Hotel in ottima posizione per visitare NY, ottimo per i mezzi pubblici (metro all’uscita dell’hotel. La reception da l’impressione di essere arrivati in un hotel stellato, ma poi quando sali nei corridoi delle camere inizi ad avere qualche dubbio sulle stelle. Le camere sono il pezzo dolente: moquette sporca, non un frigo bar non una ciabatta non un accappatoio, non hai la possibilità di cambiare (spegnere per i 24 gradi) l aria condizionata (camera 2107) , mobili ormai molto datati. Insomma mi aspettavo molto di piu

title: Recommendable
text: My Premier Kingsize room was very big, clean, on the 47th floor with a breathtaking view. Got cleaned everyday and was totally fine. Bathroom huge. Only a fridge was missing and the breakfast was okay, but too expensive for what you get. Staff very nice and always there to help. Location top. I would come back!

title: Staying in New York City in the Financial District
text: If you are trying to avoid mid town busy area, this hotel is the right choice. Just right across the Oculus building and 9/11 memorial. Access to subway is so convenient, only a short walking distance to Tin Building, Chinatown, Wall Street, etc

title: Amazing Views of WTC with great Subway access
text:
The hotel is situated at the WTC and Oculus shopping centre. 
We had the King Superior room with amazing views of the WTC and 9/11 Memorial.  
With great access to multiple subway lines making midtown Manhattan only 5-10min ride away.

title: Vorsicht !!!!
text:
Leider ist dieser eine Punkt schon zu viel. Das Hotel ist abgewohnt, die Schübe fallen fast auseinander und der Teppich ist mit Flecken übersät... 
Die größte Frechheit ist allerdings, dass man rückwirkend eine Steuer von ca.35USD/Tag !! erhoben hat... unglaublich... NIE WIEDER HIER HER
!!!!! BETRUG !!!!!

title: Perfect stay with an awesome view!
text:
Perfect location,  good price and big room with an incredible view!!!
Staff was really helpful and efficient with all request. Best hotel to visit south of manhattan and brooklyn side. Departure for liberty statue location 4 minutes away of the hotel !

title: Millenium Hilton
text:
Very good location, in front of the mall and near Subway.All you need in shopping matter can be found just across the street.
Pitty the restaurant was closed but anyway Eataly is just two hundred meter away.
Cleaning lady on the 22th floor was very proffessional.

title: Great stay
text: This was a perfect stay for our trip to NY. The location is so nice. Rooms were clean and the beds were very good. The staff was helpfull and so friendly, bartender Nathan was amazing. We had a great time. I really recomand this hotel. Thank you...

title: Very nice experiment with this hotel
text:
It was our first travel in NY and we aren’t disappointed of the room. The staff was very nice and friendly.

title: 호텔 벨보이 정말 별루다
text:
