title: DON’T DO IT!!!
text: When we arrived and got into our room, we immediately walked back out and requested a cancellation due to not being satisfied with the physical shape of the room.  The hotel should update their website so that the pictures reflect what the rooms actually look like.  The rooms need a serious upgrade.  The walls, carpet, floors, and toilet were dirty, stained, and peeling.  It did not feel like a home away from home ESPECIALLY for the amount of money that we would have had to pay if we had stayed.  The staff communication was poor, semi friendly, and conflicting.  Our experience was so bad that we asked for the number to contact the hotel’s corporate office.  We spent half a day walking around to other hotels asking to see their rooms before we booked b/c we were traumatized by the results we received from Millennium.

title: **BEWARE, DISHONEST AND MISMANAGED HOTEL!!
text:
They wrongfully charged my card an extra $667 after our stay and nobody returns our calls to correct this or explain this! They offered no receipt at checkout, they offered no customer service when we called frequently to retrieve a bill. 

Elevator sometimes would take 15+ minutes to get you to and from your room as its mismanaged, unattended, and needs to be serviced. Staff is not only unhelpful but downright unprofessional. A staff member attempted to come into our room with a key at 1am startling us because they thought there was smoke nearby (neither of us are smokers and no candles or fires were anywhere in or near room). When they learned they were wrong the barely apologized!!   The parking is off-site and expensive (an additional almost $200 for 2 nights). The bar is rarely opened, closed completely on Sundays and only open after 5pm - 10/11pm on all other days. The room was small although we did enjoy the view. This place is a mismanaged, out-dated, disaster.

No Fridge, No Microwave, No Restaurant.

 *AVOID THIS PLACE, THERE ARE PLENTY OF NICER OPTIONS IN MANHATTAN!*

title: No staff do the housekeeping
text: Firstly, I have to admit the location is perfect,  near to subway, malls, dining hall and 711. However, there was no one did the cleanliness after we went outside early in the morning even though we didn't put the sign "don't disrupt" on the door. When we call the customer service for the housekeeping, they said the staff get off work because it's too late. I feel so frustrating because it is really a mess. I expected and imaged the tidy room with spring water, coffee bean, new towel sets and empty trash can when I came back to the hotel. In fact, that is really spoil my mood. Please pay more attention to the housekeeping, the hotel was 4-star and you shouldn't have made the mistake.

title: Don't bother
text: I booked this hotel for work due to its proximity to our Manhattan office. I usually book others in the area but needed something closer that was more closely walkable. This place is not up to par for the price you pay. The room was rundown and not clean. I did not feel comfortable walking on the carpet without shoes and quite frankly was very close to booking elsewhere the second night. The Millenium would do well to invest some dollars upgrading this facility.

title: Bad  experience
text:
I booked a Junior Suite, I find myself in a basic room, I report the problem, I am offered to pay $100 more to have a superior room because the Junior Suite is no longer available, great! Of course I refuse and I'm just offered to withdraw the tourist taxes and I'm told that tomorrow the Junior Suite I've booked will be available in the afternoon, so I'm not emptying my suitcases tonight, I'm camping.

I go back to the basic room and there a lady was cleaning the bathroom, great!

45 minutes later it's a man who enters the room without knocking to change the shower curtain, great!!

After 9 hours of flight, thank you The Millennium Hotel for the welcome and seriousness 😡

title: Fell short of an okay experience
text: We booked this hotel for the view of the reflecting pool and memorial, which was great! It is walking distance to Bowling Green park and the bull. For the not so great, we booked with Chase Ultimate Rewards and called ahead to the hotel to check on early check in due to having 2 kids with us. I called the hotel operator who found our reservation and confirmed our dates and that our room was available in their system. They tried to transfer me to the front desk to verify that the room was truly ready and disconnected me. I called back and the front desk person said they could not find my reservation with the hotel confirmation number I gave them, which the previous person found just fine since they told me the room I booked and the date of check out. I spent 10 minutes talking to the front desk who told me I had to call Chase Rewards to verify the reservation. Chase Rewards spent over an hour talking to the hotel confirming my reservation, which existed somewhere since the previous person found it without issue. When we arrived to check in at 215 pm, we were told our room was ready but that it would cost $50 to check in at 215 because their check in time was 4pm. We just wanted to put our stuff in our rooms and go walk the city so we paid the $50. They charged my card $100, which may be for incidentals, but we checked out over 4 hours ago and no update to the charge yet. When we got to our room, a jr suite with king bed and pullout sofa for the kids, the sofa was missing. The bell hope immediately noticed it and requested it brought. A bit later spare sheets were delivered but no sofa. We also had to ask for a mini fridge since the one that appeared there was screwed shut. The gentleman that delivered the sheets said he would bring one cot for the kids and a mini fridge. We had to wait. He delivered the cot, then brought the fridge, then had to take the cot because the sofa was being brought. They asked us to wait but we told them we were going to see the city and to please put it in the room. We left the room at 245pm, taking 30 minutes to get the correct items requested. When we came back later in the evening, we saw the sofa bed had been brought, brand new sofa, and was folded out to a bed. Problem was, we booked a room for 4 of us and this sofa was a love seat. My very tiny 5&7 y/o barely fit on the love seat bed together. Rollaway bed pictured but not the love seat. There were 3 towels for 4 people booked, the fire alarm was hanging from the ceiling with the red wire not connected, and no trash can in the bathroom. King bed was not horrible but not superb either. I will say the TVs were nice and big though. But the guide didn’t show any shows, only channels. All in all, good location but not great experience. They did try to make some things right, but there shouldn’t have been that many items to have to make right in the first place. And unless a hotel is selling rooms by the hour, there should be no reason to charge an early check in fee. If the room is cleaned, let people go in it as long as it isn’t like a day early.

title: Staying at Columbus circle next time
text: Wanted 100.00 extra for double bed. Wanted 75.00 extra for early check in. Wet floors and counter top, smells bad in lobby batroom. 1 was working. Mom and son day out. Wait the was shampoo and conditioner was too long. Call back rang out. Went down to get myself was told non at front desk, the guy is vacuuming that why it took long.

title: Amazing experience
text:
A exception of an little issue with the elevators the last day of my stay
Everything was amazing 
The attention 
The room
The view
The location 
The staff 
Quick access to everything 
Super fast response to any request 
For my next trip I’m absolutely sure that I’m going to stay in here again !!

title: Fansastic NY getaway
text: Perfect stay in downtown Manhattan- amazing views! the room is spacious for NYC and very comfortable. The views of the WTC and Oculus were stunning. Location is incredible  - all subways lead to the Oculus.

title: Just bad.
text:
So i came for my 5 year anniversary on a 2 night Stay, king bed with a View, reversed thru expedia and paid my 1st night until i got there. 1st expedia showed they had Parking. Nope. Had to pay at a garage a block over. Anyways i walk in the front to pay for the rest go to our room with my Girl, a lady Named Reina  comes and tell they dont accept apple pay and that all of the funds has to be on only one card and that i had to pay and extra $200 dollar extra as a deposit. I asked if i can pay it with my other and she said no. Cool. I go upload $805 on a debit card after an hour of walking in the rain im all set. So Reina was taking care of another guest while and gentleman beside her says i can take care of you. When he starts to prepare my payment he said i can Apple pay and i could had paid with multiple cards. 🤦🏽‍♂️ i was so angry cause my Girl had to wait alone in the lobby with our luggage while i was running all over wasting time and money. 
She didnt say a word or even looked at me when i was bothered by her actions. So i go to my room, great view but man i could had gotten a nicer room. Only thing thats nice is the view and the overnight front desk Mike. He was the only person that treated me with such respect i had to mention him. But honestly im never coming back.

title: Great Stay
text: Excellentt, responsive staff.  Room met my needs except it lacked a refrigertor.  Bed, bathroom top notch. Magnificent view of from 49th floor of 9-11 Memorial and Hudson River.  Rate was reasonable using My Millennium account.

title: Great stay!
text: My view was stunning. Bed was beyond comfortable. Staff were nice & helpful. My only complaint was the sub par toiletries in bathroom. Will definitely stay there again!  I recommend this hotel to anyone interested in staying downtown.

title: Stunning view
text: We booked this hotel for the view and weren't disappointed at all ! The location is great as well, the mattress is really comfortable, however I would have liked other amenities and more options with the TV.

title: Great Location and Great Property
text: I would highly recommend this location and hotel, it was right across from World Trade Center building.    I will be staying here again, staff was great!  Rooms have great view of the city and World Trade Center building and mall.

title: Bad experience
text: After booking a two days in a superior king room. Front desk tells me we have no king rooms ready. She tells me I can upgrade to a king deluxe for more money. What sense is that. She tells me  I have a queen room. I walked in the room to find out it was a queen handicap room. No fridge , clogged tub, damaged smoke detector. Terrible experience. Hilton failed . Retrain your staff .

title: Location, location
text: We were amazed at the wonderful location of this hotel so close to subways and tourist attractions. Staff was very helpful, room views are amazing on any floor! Fitness center is great, hot water, nice towels, clean, fast elevators, beautiful lobby, and of course great location.

title: No hot water in winter
text: More like a 3 star hotel wibes than 4 stars. No hot water for my stay, and noisy ventilation system. Good location. Nice lobby. Good view of world trade center. Disappointed no one cared I didn’t have hot water in winter to shower.

title: Hotel wifi not fit for purpose
text: Could be a fantastic hotel but unfortunately hotel wifi does not reach all rooms effectively- this affected not just my ability to work from my room but also tv and room access. The signal constantly dropped and I frequently had to walk down the 40th floor corridor to reconnect to the wifi signal

title: Great location, enough space in room, but needs updating
text: The location and space was perfect. However, I believe the rooms could use some updating as there are stains on the carpet area and you can tell it is "older". I wouldn't say it wasn't clean though, it is just older.

title: Yikes
text:
Unfortunately, all the negative reviews are accurate. Currently laying on a bed that is so “firm” it feels like laying on a board. Everything is worn and dated which I wouldn’t care so much about if it wasn’t 74 degrees in here. In December. You read that right. 74 degrees in December. The window is open and has been since we arrived hours ago. It’s still 74 degrees in here. We called down to the front desk to ask about it and they said they turn off the A/C for the winter and it’s unseasonably warm right now. So what? Turn the A/C back on then! Instead, they sent up a maintenance person with a small table fan. He looked at it and said there was nothing they could do because the A/C is turned off and left. 

When we arrived, there was an employee trying to get into an elevator that had guests freaking out inside. He couldn’t figure out how to do it. The elevators took 8-10 minutes to arrive each time. If you don’t think that’s very long, try standing in front of a bank of 4 elevators for 10 minutes waiting for them. It’s a long time. So long, that there was a constant pile up of guests waiting to get on one. 

The toilet decides to loudly run about twice an hour which is why I am currently awake and writing this review. 

The TV was nearly unwatchable with a signal that cut out about every 15 seconds or so. The internet is painfully slow. And this is supposed to be a place for business people to stay? What a mess. I’m very  glad that we are only staying a couple more days and then moving to a hotel that wasn’t booked by my partner’s place of work. And she will be giving feedback about the place so that it won’t be booked again for any of the people flying in to work in the office. 

All of that said, the employees have ALL been extraordinarily kind and have tried to help. This looks to me like a lot of folks working their butts off, who actually do care about the guests stuck working for a management company that is cheap with the way they fund their hotels and unsupportive of the people who work for it. I absolutely hate to see this because I know I will never stay here again and it looks like many others are saying the same, and that means these awesome people could lose their jobs. 

And to the person replying to these reviews, get real. Every reply is the same canned response and y’all clearly don’t care about the guests or the crap accommodations here. Actually do something to fix this. Don’t say “we hope you’ll give us another opportunity” when you are doing nothing already about the avalanche of terrible reviews with all the same issues. It’s just proving how disingenuous your company is. 

My advice to anyone considering staying here is do not.

title: Arnaque
text:
ATTENTION ARNAQUE ! Séjour réservé et réglé entièrement sur agoda.com, qui indique que TOUS les frais et taxes sont inclus. Toutefois, SANS PRÉVENIR l’hôtel prélève arbitrairement 120$ sur les 300$ de caution laissés lors du check-in et nous indique lorsqu’on les appelle qu’il s’agit d’une « facility fee » dont l’existence ne nous a pourtant jamais été mentionnée. 
Il s’agit d’une pratique très malhonnête et je suis extrêmement déçu de cet hôtel. Je n’y retournerai certainement pas.

title: Nice place, but I wouldnt stay again
text: I've stayed twice and both times they had to move me at check-in. This time, they put me in the wrong room twice. Expensive hotel to not get what I paid for. Staff was friendly but next time I will go where I get the right room on first try

title: Expensive for the tired looking and damaged rooms.
text:
This is the 2nd time I have stayed in a millennium hotel in just over a year, and I will never stay in one again.
The room was very tired looking, the carpet was badly marked, the furniture was scratched and had the knobs taken off but then not finished off properly. 
The restaurant and bar was closed, which was not told to us when we booked or checked in. We only found out when we tried to go to that floor and the lift wouldn't stop on those floors. So we asked, and just got told yeah those floors are all shut. So no fitness area either! 
This really should be made clear at booking. I wouldn't have booked it otherwise. 
My bed had 2 metal things sticking out, which was dangerous. 
There is a small bar in reception, which was hardly ever open. But we ordered a glass of Pinot Grigio and it was the worst wine I've ever had, my friend and I couldn't drink it.
Luckily, we only needed the room to sleep in as it was nothing special for the price.

title: Good views
text:
Amazing views to see over NYC , rooms and hotel Need updating. No restaurant. 
One member of reception staff needs re training,  he wasn't friendly on our arrival No welcome from him at all. This was very off putting from the start. No fridge in room,

title: Spontaneous 1st date night done right. He is now officially my Buttercup.
text:
Spontaneous 1st date night. Gorgeous room, fantastic views. 

Great price.

Our room was beautiful. The views. Wow. I took so many pictures of the city lights from our windows at night and into the early morning sunrise. Breathtaking.

How do we sign up to become members?

title: Thanksgiving
text: Room was a big disappointment. Couldn’t get the room to cool. Suffered with upper 70’s temps for both days. Staff couldn’t resolve issues. Expensive room to be uncomfortable in. Several lights in the room were in disrepair as well.

title: Overall ok but not worth the price.
text: The hotel location is good in the downtown area. However, the price paid is not worth it. In addition, they charged me extra USD80.34 under my credit card and I’m not even know what is the charges for. Ridiculous and simply charged my credit card.

title: Worst hotel & customer service I've ever experienced!
text: Arrived at check in having arrived on a late flight to be offered an upgrade to a King Suite for $100, which we politely declined as we’d already booked a nice room, only to find they had actually sold our Superior King City View room. They then tried to fob us off with a basic twin room saying they had no King bedrooms left, and unfortunately it’s ’the luck of the draw’ when you book through a 3rd party. I explained that this was unacceptable, I’m away with my husband and had booked and paid upfront for our chosen room weeks in advance. They insisted they couldn’t do anything about it and offered to cancel the booking and we could find another hotel (at 11pm on a Friday night). Absolutely shocking service from both the check in staff and the hotel manager. After we refused the twin singles and refused to leave (after in excess of 40 minutes of trying to resolve the matter) they put us in a king room, which was all we had wanted in the first place. So much for customer service. Don’t expect to get the room you paid for at this hotel, and don’t expect the rooms to look like the photographs. The reception area was pleasant, but that’s where it ends. The room was dated and scruffy. As an Events Manager I book hotels every other day and travel with my job. I’m a Hotels.com Rewards Gold member and I’ve never experienced such poor service and behaviour from hotel staff. I’ll never use Millennium Hotels again.

title: Absolutely do not recommend
text: This was one of the worst hotel experiences I’ve had in a while. I could not understand why this hotel had a high rating until I realized that the rating factors in the location is the hotel. That is one of the only thing positive about our hotel experience. Unfortunately I’ve given the hotel countless opportunities to address our concerns and no one has. Per the hotel, they turn off the AC unit in the winter. This means that the rooms are extremely hot. We ran into our first issue when we arrived at our first room. It has been about an hour and I noticed the ac was blowing hot air. They had a technician come up and do a lot of hoopla when in reality they could have advised us that they turned off their AC during the winter. Instead we had to pack all our things and go to another room only to find out that this room also did not have AC. The beds were extremely uncomfortable and the hotel is dated. The lobby is nice and it is  in a wonderful location but this hotel is all around not worth it. There were stains on bathroom floor, unclean air vents and just all around old and dated furniture. The telephone had holes missing in them and the room just felt unclean. Super flimsy towels and marks on the walls.

title: Disappointing Stay
text: I stayed at this hotel for two weeks during the Thanksgiving holiday and the entire time, the restaurant was closed, leaving me to have to order food through UberEats - which they were not allowed to bring to my room. I had to retrieve my order in the lobby where there was no kind of system in place to keep my food from being taken by someone else. The bar was only open a few times, the TV in my room was atrociously setup, with no guide or any other capacity to heighten the TV watching experience. Internet access was frustrating to say the least. Access had to be reconnected almost daily - even sometimes more than once a day. Every time my room was cleaned, the staff failed to replace certain items like wash cloths, or coffee cup tops. Some of the front desk staff were certainly not helpful or courteous.

title: glosantos
text: It was a beautiful experience, the staff made me feel at home. Next time I travel to New York, I will stay at this Hotel. Anybody that ask about a Hotel in New York I will recommend Millenium Downtown for sure.

title: Location is perfect.
text:
Location is great. No complaints. Access to Metro/ shopping/ Coffee etc is awesome. Starbucks is located just around the corner of this building. The best you can get in this location. 
However this is a old property, everything is old it would be great if they upgrade the interior of the rooms.

title: Most Amazing Views of NYC
text: We were in Suite 5210 and had the most amazing views on all three sides with World Trade Center/ Hudson River / NJ on one side, Midmanhattan through Ceter windows and East River/ Manhattan/ Brooklyn Bridge on the east.

title: Best View of NYC!
text: This was the perfect quick getaway + night in the city. Customer service was kind and helpful. Room was clean and the view was to die for. Only things I’d like different is updated amenities (the tv program looks very old and there’s a $35 charge to use the lobby microwave) Other than that the stay was amazing and I got the incidental fee back the next day which was great!

title: Just average
text:
We got disturbed by cleaning ladies even though the “do not disturb “ sign was placed in front of our room door. 
They kept knocking the door and opening the door before we could respond. The do not disturb sign was on the door !!!!

title: What a Location !!
text:
Very good Hotel with friendly staff, clean rooms and beautiful views. Subway all around and 2 shoppings in front.
Early check in is difficult but late check out is easier with the help of the Concierge.
we will be back soon.

title: Horrible
text: Deadbolt did not work, phone did not work, squeaky bed, window not sealed, front desk rude and did not want to check me in although I had a reservation. Requested early in prior as well and they said nothing on file

title: Excellent View and Location, Mediocre Room
text:
Excellent views from the room and awesome location right across the Oculus and subway stations.

Staff seemed cold as the weather but at least they functioned somehow efficiently.
Room is basic, no microwave, no ref, but the bed is comfortable.  Room sound insulation is poor. I could  clearly hear the guest in the adjacent room having a phone conversation.

title: Don't bother until they remodel
text: Great location and a hotel that needs a complete remodel/refresh before I'll stay again.  Threadbare furniture, no room service, broken elevator over multiple days with seemingly no attempt at repair (garbage can blocking access - for safety?).  If there's nothing else available, you'll likely fall asleep in a room you can double-lock.  Don't expect much else.

title: Millennium Downtown NY - cleanliness and quality goes downhill
text: This hotel has a great location but the cleanliness and service are downhill. My room had food debris in the carpet and not a lot of time was spent in cleaning.  There was no garbage can in the main room too. Onsite restaurant never reopened after COVID but now there is a daily resort fee on top of the room rate. Front desk staff have little to no authority to fix things.  I have stayed here many times and watched a great hotel run down due to lack of maintenance. Hallway noise at night from partiers -- and limited security spread over two towers.  The reduction in quality is a real shame.  It used to be such a good hotel - consider alternatives for you stay if possible.  I am looking elsewhere for my next trip to NY.

title: EXTORTION - get your receipt at check-out for added fees of $40 per night
text: Get your receipt at checkout. Upon check-in, they hand you a buiness size card that shows what their "Facility Fee" includes. This is added to your already confirmed rate before you leave. THIS IS ILLEGAL. Upon leaving, they take your room key and say "You're Good". You won't know that you're not good until a month later when your credit card bill comes in. I fought with 3 people before the manager reluctantly took it  off. They kept saying they would remove it but did not.

title: Okay
text:
Expectations met except for shower head and no electrical outlets near bed. Clean room, bright lights in bathroom, good desk for work, bed comfortable. 

This survey is too long. Why make a customer type 200 characters. Get rid of bureaucracy. I want efficiency when I travel. 

Time matters. If you want to improve. Find a way to save customer time in all aspects… check in, check out, ease of access to electrical outlets. I don’t like hunting for stuff that wastes time. Keep it simple and clean.

title: Meh… the Millennium
text: If you’re looking for somewhere cheap that’s close to wallstreet/financial district this hotel is sufficient. If you’re coming to New York for business or pleasure but expect to stay in a nice room that’s pleasant to the eye or has amenities, I’d consider another hotel.

title: Returning to the Millennium
text: I have stayed at the Millennium 4-5 times, the location, price and staff are excellent. My concern is what appears to be a policy of later check-ins and earlier check outs or the application of a 100 dollar sliding downward fee for checking in earlier. A 4p.m. check in whether this is industry wide or not is too late. Check ins should be between 12 and 1 and check outs should be the same. With an 11 a.m. check out, I am positioned to pay up to 100 dollars to check in earlier. This fee for a 19 hour stay is not equitable. My stay should be as close to 24 hours as possible with check in between 12 and 1 and check outs between 12 and 1 based on availability. I understand the restaurant being closed due to covid. The staff was excellent as always, the bar was nice and the workout room, hotel room and the views remain wonderful.

title: Deceiving lobby!
text: Upon arrival its a bit deceiving as the lobby looks to be somewhat updated, warm and smells nice. Once you go beyond the lobby it is a very different story. Rooms and bathrooms are very outdated and warn which makes it hard to imagine the carpet in the bedrooms and overall facilities being very clean. The air in the room smells very musty and the AC unit doesn’t go below 70 (which despite it being cold outside I needed to use the AC because the heater in the rest of the hotel was making my room uncomfortably warm.

title: The worst
text: Wow - I've stayed at a lot of places while travelling for work and even lived in NYC for 12 years. This was by far the worst hotel I've stayed at. I feel bad for tourists, honestly. #800 for two nights on a work trip?!?!? I can't imagine if this was my own money. This hotel looks like its from the 1970s, the beds sink to the floor, and the pillows are so thin you better get at least 10 to equate to one pillow. Oh wait, it gets better. I had to do a late check out for work and they charged my company $50 dollars for a 1 hour late checkout. What a disaster. I hope tourists and business people look elsewhere. As I said, I lived here for 12 years and their a number of hotels that are better for the price. Only person to blame is myself here.

title: Poor guest room maintenance and attitude of staff
text: My review is stated earlier in this email.  The receptionist was rude.  The room was cold, and no one came to fix it despite my being assured someone would.  I had called about the coldness of the room three times.The bathroom was noisy.  I could hear in my bathroom the shower running in the guest room next door.  The room lacked sufficient amenities like soap and body lotion.

title: Had high hopes
text: I saw mixed reviews but took a chance. The reviews right! Great location, friendly staff, amazing views but the hotel needs to be remodeled. The furniture and carpet is really old and deeply stained. Glad I always bring slippers because the carpet was gross!

title: No longer a reliable place to stay
text: Sad, this used to be a nice hotel. I’ve stayed here many times over the past 15+ years for both work and pleasure. Looks like no one cares anymore.  Checked in around 9pm and headed to my room. Furniture is worn down and shabby. Carpets have stains in multiple places, phone next to bed doesn’t work, tv remote is missing battery compartment cover. As if this want bad enough, the heat isn’t working in the room (it’s 40 degrees out) and the room is freezing. Called the desk and they said they would send up engineering. No one showed. Called the desk and asked to change rooms. Changed rooms and this room also has stains all over carpet, lamps are crooked like the base is broken and room is still cold. Neither room had usb ports available be for charging. Had to move the bed to access socket to be able to charge my phone. 1am, I give up and hope I can sleep through the night without freezing. I won’t be staying here again.

title: Incredible Views!!
text:
I've travelled to New York from the West Coast annually for the past handful of years, and the Millennium Downtown will certainly be a hotel that I return to and recommend to my friends! 

The location is extremely convenient (not to mention when there are large events that take over the city, like the NY Marathon). I adored being within walking distance of Eataly and Nobu. The surrounding area was not too crowded. 

The views were absolutely breathtaking!! I stayed in a Junior Suite which was very spacious and had so much natural lighting. The windows of the bedroom were my favorite feature because it meant that I was able to wake up to a gorgeous view. Even at the elevator banks, the windows captured such a nice view. Even glimpses of the World Trade Center were so moving and unforgettable.

To top it off, the staff were so friendly and helpful. From check-in to check-out the staff had very welcoming smiles. Whenever I needed a taxi, the staff did not hesitate to extend their assistance with such patience & kindness.

This recent trip to New York was one for the books, and I thank the Millennium Downtown and the staff for contributing to that!

title: 10 years later and not as good as it used to be
text: Stayed at this hotel for our 10th anniversary. Overall experience was meh. Rooms are dated, phone/bedroom lights didn't work, TVs don't have guides or remotes that function well. Pancakes tasted like sour milk. Wouldn't be at the top of my list if we were to stay in lower Manhattan again. It's a shame because it used to be an exceptional hotel. From what I understand this is no longer a Hilton hotel.

title: Not again
text: Staff was not friendly. The restaurant and bars were not open. In my room there was splashing on one of the walls that could have been wine but who knows. The carpet was worn and the facilities overall look tired.

title: modernes Hotel, sensationelle Lage
text:
Wir waren im April 2022 in diesem Hotel und haben jede Minute genossen!
Die Zimmer sind sehr grosszügig, sauber und modern. 
Die Lage ist sensationell - direkt bei WorldTradeCenter und mit einer Subway-Station direkt vor dem Haus.

title: New York Family
text: We enjoyed our stay very much! It is beautiful and in a perfect location. Very close to subway access which was important for us. Everyone was very nice a d helpful. The room was very clean and had an amazing view.

title: Location is Key
text: Great location, housekeeping top notch and fixing a small issue was done with no fuss in a timely manner. The one area that the hotels survey doesn’t cover is that the decor, fixtures and fittings are looking very tired. I first visited in 2003 after the refurbishment due to 9/11. The decor, fixtures and fittings are the same 19 years on. They really could do with updating before the place just ends up looking shabby.

title: Most horrible hotel stay ever!
text: Everything from check-in to check-out was horrible.  Booking representatives are not knowledge about the hotel amenities (I was informed that the pool was open before I made the booking but it was permanently closed two years ago), we left two bags after the check-out and were asked for money if we wanted to leave them for a few extra hours and we were overcharged without any notification.  Very bad, will never go back!

title: Not owned by HILTON anymore...
text: Quality of service is diminished. Rooms are not as clean. No complimentary bottled water. No dining. Less accommodating to requests for early or late check-in. Views are great but overall quality of the accommodations is lacking.

title: A room with a view….
text: Brilliant helpful staff, efficiently organised hotel…nice friendly foyer bar..   easy access to places of interest and subway.   Lots of places to eat and drink..  close to Brooklyn bridge which is a wonderful walk..

title: Good but needs an upgrade
text:
Overall have a good stay at the millennium however I think it’s very overpriced for what it is we payed just over a Grand for 5 nights along with a $500 deposit that you get back but they do take money from that so you really only get £300 back, our rooms were clean and tidy but I think they could you an upgrade as they look way more modern on the website view was good too but was expecting a bit more.
Overall a good place to stay location is very central but they are overpricing way too much for what it is

title: Top Hotel
text:
-optimal Location, nearby attractions, good connections by public transport
-great room
-wonderfull view (55 on top)
-friendly stuff
the hotel is absolutely recommendable, 
we‘ll be back on our next trip to New York

title: Great place to stay for the weekend
text: I needed a hotel that was near a tranist hub so I could enjoy the Halloweekend. The Millennium came through not only with that, but also a great room. My only complaint is that the room needed more outlets/USB outlets for better ability to charge all my electronics.

title: Comfort, Luxury, Convenience
text: My stay at the Millennium Downtown was very gratifying.  Every moment was enjoyable. From the moment I opened the door and saw the breathtaking view of the WTC Memorial and the activities on the Hudson River, to the moment I checked out, I was pleased with my hotel choice. I was glad I had excellent access to public transportation, affordable food choices, and comfortable luxurious type accomodations.  The staff was courteous and the lobby ambassador was an added bonous who quickly facilitated questions to make sure I felt welcomed and could navigate in the community safely.  I look forward to staying at the Millennium Hotel Downtown in the future.

title: Beautiful views
text: Room on the 53rd floor was beautiful with views of the Hudson, Brooklyn, and Midtown. Room was clean. Bed and pillows were surprisingly comfy. Staff was helpful. Despite being on the higher floors, we were able to get to ground level on the elevators fairly quickly.

title: Millennium has lost its charm
text: The carpet in room 2511 was disgusting. The couch too was dirty and the furniture was scratched up and discolored. There were stains on the wall as well. Overall I’m disappointed in how rundown the hotel has become and is need of some major updates. Also it was disappointing to be told I needed to pay an extra $50 to check in to the room an hour early. It turns out when I came back later that night there were no more double occupancy queen bed rooms.

title: Perfect Location - TERIIBLE HOTEL - Avoid
text:
$400p/n and we were expected to eat breakfast in our bedroom with take away cutlery and cups and boxes = $134 breakfast !!!! No table and chairs. One sat on window sill on air con vents ! With coffee table, I was on the bed and son at the bureau!! Terrible start to the day.
Just trying to suss out how to order breakfast was a challenge ! No instructions in the room! No welcome pack.
Furniture was seriously worn.
Beds are not 4.6ft doubles they are either 4ft double or smaller !!! My tiny 10 year old filled it. However, the mattresses were comfy and linen nice
Bathroom: sticky substances on the worktop! Toilet flush didn't work properly when we arrived and broke during the night,
Shower was at best luke warm. The sink had better pressure.
Towels had holes in them
They need to spend more on the corridors and rooms not just on the lobby which is beautiful.
The location is amazing
Could be an amazing hotel but standards are not correct ! I stay in lotsof hotels and I wouldn't rate this hotel above 2 *

title: Resort fee 35 per nt, for nothing
text:
Charge 35 resort fee and it ain't any sort of resort, bit hype staff, no service, no amenities, no food and beverage availability on several days, not even room service, was told to go to 711 a few blocks away for bottled water... rude staff. 

Positive note, nice views from room, but be smart stay elsewhere ... many other nearby choices.

Clean rooms, friendly staff, perfect location! They provide anything you need or ask for. Only con is that their pool isn’t open & they only have room service for dining in the hotel. But BEST HOTEL VIEWS OF NY CITY POSSIBLE!! Great experience!

title: Blood stains on the counter
text: Don't do it New York has too many hotels much better  no soap to wash your hands when you tell the front desk they say to call your credit card to complain carpets are so dirty the whole place needs a major make over

title: Too many administrative problems
text:
The hotel has problems with their payment system, making it a very complicated experience for guests and also misplaces the deliveries, firnomatios or anything you migh need to send to a guest. 
As an hotel for a business trip, to be booked by a company or any organization, it is a nightmare.

title: Fantastic place to stay to be central to alot of tourist attractions
text: very central and good sized rooms with space and good facilities. Close to a lot of attractions and shopping while rooms were clean, quite and relaxing with great views. Would be good to have earlier check in eg 2p/m not 4p/m. But not a deal breaker. We will be back !

title: A NYC overnight for my 25th Birthday
text: The Millennium is a clean, welcoming, conveniently located hotel. I was in a great location to enjoy the sites and bars in downtown Manhattan. I had the option of adding VIP tickets to the One World Observatory to my reservation, and I highly recommend adding this to your trip if you can afford it! Staying at the Millennium contributed to making this birthday one of my best yet.

title: Filthy old room; good view
text: My roof had a stellar view of the WTC. The room and hotel is clearly dated, which would be okay if that didn’t also come with other guest’s hair, spit out toothpaste, and smudgy fingerprints on the mirror. Most hostels are cleaner than this hotel.  They also charge $50 for early checkin even if rooms are available. Seems cheap, even for New York.

title: Beautiful views!
text: Fabulous views of World Trade, walk across street to Occulus and museum, plus shopping. Convene conference center nearby for meetings. There is a small bar in lobby, hopefully a larger bar and restaurant will reopen in the future. Eataly is close too.

title: From Great to Bad
text: Millennium New York used to be amazing but now is a mere shadow of what it was years ago. Front desk people have a rude attitude and carpets need to be replaced, smelly and hurts to breathe. I had to buy a candle.

title: Good price for an excellent location.
text: We stayed at Millennium as we wanted a place in downtown Manhattan that will not blow up our credit cards and this is exactly what we got. I did not visit other hotels in the area but I can say the room looked somewhat tiny, although I liked the king bed. Coffee maker available but no fridge. Overall we liked it and, chances are, we will go there again.

title: cold shower every day
text: we usually book all our staff in the millennium hotel for work trips but will no longer do this as they last trip was terrible. cold showers, un clean room and when mentioned to the staff about switching rooms, nothing was done.

title: Almost
text: Hotel amenities such as a bar, restaurant not being avail is unacceptable at these room rates. The hotel said it is due to covid, but other surrounding hotels are offering these amenities with lower nightly rates.

title: Not what it used to be - with room service rip-off.
text: Hotel was generally acceptable but is showing real signs of wear and tear. I stay here a lot 15 years ago and it was first class, not now.  Case in point is the breakfast rip-off which was not acceptable and something you expect from the flea bag establishment, not a place with the Hilton brand. I understand the economics may have required the closure of the restaurant, but to advertise breakfast room service and then deliver low end take barely edible takeout in cardboard boxes at the cost of almost $100 for 2 people. That is beyond the pale. There are much better and cheaper options downtown.

title: Gr8 View and Pillows - That was it...
text: The view from the room was great, and the pillows was amazing. Unfortunately that is where the gr8 experience stopped. In room dining as the restaurant is closed, but they only cater for 1 person to sit and eat...

title: An average hotel with a good location.
text: This hotel was…fine. A bit rundown for the price, its main highlight is its proximity to the WTC and the Brooklyn Bridge, which makes for a wonderful run in the morning. Rooms vary considerably (mine was tiny; my coworker’s was huge - we paid the same price) - mine was also noisy at night. Staff was friendly and helpful.

title: Great hospitality
text: Kiti and Jiggs were so kind, they made my and my team’s stay here even better. The hospitality at this place was great! Definitely recommend staying here. The rooms were clean and the views are breath taking from this hotel. Also it’s at a central location to a lot of things.

title: Sehr empfehlenswertes Hotel
text:
Die Lage des Hotels ist prima,da die Metrostation direkt am Hotel ist.Auch die Aussicht unseres Zimmers zum WTC war hervorragend.Das Zimmer ist prima,nicht riesig groß,aber für Sightseeing perfekt,da man eh unterwegs ist den ganzen Tag.
Frühstück kann ich nicht beurteilen,da nicht gebucht.

title: Time for an overhaul
text: This hotel is just tired and rundown. Poorly staffed and nothing is working correctly. The poor staff know all too well the problems this place has but because of the location they are able to fill the place up regardless. The brand is ruined for me.

title: Hotel needs a renovation
text: Although a great location as soon as you step foot into your room you'll realise that this hotel is in serious need of an update. Its overall appearance is acceptable but its a decade and a half behind.

title: Work to be done
text: The hotel itself was nice enough. However there was no mini bar or even a fridge. The restaurant was also closed our whole stay and bar closes too early. Phone didn't work either. Nice location & view

title: Great hotel but something to note!
text: Very nice hotel, we were in town for a convention so really only used the room for sleeping and showering however upon walking into the room I noticed I couldn’t locate the fridge. I found to be what was a fridge but it was locked. I called down to the front desk Who told me that for an added fee of $35 a night you can have access to the fridge. This seems like a ludicrous extra fee. Also one that should have been told to me upon check in.

title: Perfect location for NYC trip with spectacular view
text: We had a nice welcome with an interesting offer to upgrade which we accepted. The room was very comfortable, clean and spacious. The view was spectacular. In walking distance to Battery parc, Chinatown, Tribeca and Soho. Many subway stations and food courts just around the corner.

title: Good location, great staff, rooms were ok
text: Good location, great views.  Rooms need updating. Beds were not very comfortable. Kept hearing elevator going up and down. Staff was very nice and willing to help. Check in was good. Overall a good experience just needs updating

title: Don't Stay here if you like AC or only Paying once for your Hotel Rooms
text: I was charged twice, after confirming that they were only taking my card for incidentals and told them i already paid through booking.com. The AC was not working and my room would not get cooler than 76 degrees, when i asked for a fan or someone to come fix it i was told i had to just deal with it and that they did not offer fans for guest.l was very disappointed with this service, room and charges that i am still trying to get back.

title: Awesome stay
text: I travel for business and chose this hotel for the location to work.  I was totally unaware when I booked that I was right across the street from the WTC memorial.  My view from the 23rd floor was breath-taking.  The rooms are well kept, the staff is friendly and attentive, and the bar has an upscale lounge feel.  There is no restaurant inside, which was no problem because there are so many dining options within close proximity. I travel to New York frequently and this was my favorite stay.  Great hotel.

title: New York
text: Absolutely will not visit again. A total rip off. They are superior hotels for the price. Also stayed at another hotel in Mid Town as I wanted an experience of the two areas. Paid a similar amount per night but this hotel the Lotte New York Palace was superior in every way. Updated rooms and 1st class service.

title: Não vale o que paga.
text: O hotel está em um lugar sensacional, em frente ao metrô e também ao memorial 9/11 mas não vale o valor da diária (~ $500). Quartos antigos e enfrentei problema com a limpeza do quarto quando eu cheguei. Se pudesse escolher, não voltaria para o hotel.

title: Experience
text:
My room was large and the view was great, but the room smelled. 
Service was at anytime on an above average level. unfortunately the furniture was also worn out, with the smell in the room I did not have a great experience

title: Overnight stop to visit 9/11 memorial
text: We stayed at the hotel based on a selection shown in the 9/11 memorial info page which was one of several reasons we chose the hotel. Unfortunately, the restaurant was closed so we had to hunt for a place to eat. Generally speaking, we were happy with the amenities but there were no facecloths, The alarm clock did not work, noone answered our wake-up call on the phone, so I had to go downstairs and have the front desk set that up.

title: SAd experience
text:
really dirty , just worry about money , you need to improve your service too , i was expecting better things but i only spent 2.500 dollrs for that, i rather go to another hotel next time .

title: Excellent staff and service
text: I found my stay at the millennium to be exceptionally comfortable. The staff was superb, primarily the Porter that handled our luggage was extraordinary in his kindness.  I would highly recommend this hotel that anyone who wants a comfortable place to stay with carrying staff.

title: No pool, No restaurant
text:
Three of your core advertised amenities were unavailable, Pool, Restaurant, and Bar
At the time of check in we asked if the pool was still open and we were informed that it had been closed since covid (understandable) but that's a 2 year closure, I would imagine tharts ample time to modify your site amenity list to at least inform people that its closed rather than advertise something you KNOW you don't have

title: Good hotel, wonderful location, staff could be more friendly not great service
text:
We had e great stay in this hotel. Hotel is looking wonderful and has an excellent location! Amazing room view we had at the 9-11 memorial. Subways everywhere around the hotel. Quickly with many lines to go to times square.
Looking at the price you pay to stay here, the rooms are a bit outdated with not fully being clean, sports on the carpets, dust. This is not worth the money to be honest. 
Also most of the people working at the reception could be way more friendly. This service was not great at all. 
Not sure if I would go back to this hotel.

title: The Millennium, but it's nearly 2023....
text:
In the 1980’s, or 1990’s when a bunch of people in suits sat down in a boardroom to brainstorm a name for their new chain of hotels, I’m sure they decided on “Millennium” because it sounded very modern and elite. When they were built, I’m sure they fit that description too. But now, nearly 23 years since the turn of the millennium, this particular property is extremely tired, run down and to be honest, gross. 
We had a run of bad experiences during our 8 night stay at Millennium Downtown. Firstly, when we checked in, we were slapped with an unexpected USD$40 per night “facility fee” (USD$320 total), additional to the USD$1600 we had pre-paid for the room and taxes. They also took a USD$500 bond/hold on our credit card – so before we have even started our holiday, we are down nearly USD$1000.
We get to our room on the 23rd floor, the room is very poorly cleaned. We found previous guests handwritten notes in drawers, price tags on the floor, remnants of food on the chair and floor. On top of this, we had no soap at all for the first 6 nights stay (we went out and bought some). The bottled water was replaced ONCE during our entire stay. The TV didn’t work – just static, no matter which channel. The air con didn’t stay cold. There was no fridge in the room. The phone in the room doesn’t work at all. We were also rudely awakened twice before 9am on the same day to housekeeping entering the room – not knocking, just walking straight in with no apology. But the worst part about our experience, is that the rooms are all vented internally, so one night we came back to our room and walked in to an extremely overpowering smell of weed as someone must have been smoking in an adjoining room. Despite letting the (less than pleasant) front desk staff know, it smelt like that for a couple of days. For people that don’t smoke, it was truly unbearable. 

Credit where credit is due – there were a couple of positives that I must mention and the saving grace for the 2nd star for this review. The location of the property is fabulous – a large interconnecting subway station directly across the road, the 9/11 memorial museum is right there too. 10 minutes walk to the Statue of Liberty ferry, 10 minutes walk to the Brooklyn Bridge, plenty of restaurants and shopping very close by.  One thing I can’t fault, is the view from the room which looks out over the 9/11 memorial and out to the Hudson River.  

I would also like to mention both Mike and Seth located at the concierge desk. They were the only two friendly staff we encountered during our stay. They were helpful and attentive and always had a welcoming smile on their faces. They are truly a credit to the hotel.

title: Great location! Not such a great experience...
text: I don't normally post negative reviews because I feel that a bad experience is usually an isolated one. But there were just too many issues on this stay.  Arrived on a Friday afternoon, met by the bell hop immediately and he was very nice and attentive!  Front desk staff was less than cordial.  Discussed an upgrade to a Jr. suite and decided that we would pass on the upgrade.  Later found out at check out that we were being charged for the up grade we had denied.  Got to our room, noted the temp was warm and the HVAC was turned off.  Turned it on and set at 68F, Left for the evening and returned to find our room at 74F.  Called the desk, was told nothing they could do that late at night.  Next morning stopped at the desk to advise of and request something be done about the HVAC.  Returned about 3pm to find the temp still at 74F.  Again stopped at the desk to request service and went out for the evening.  arrived back at about 10pm to find the room cool at 68F.  This was annoying to start but the worst thing is the noise from the elevator.  We were in room 1712.  The right wall backs to the elevator shaft.  The noise from the cables and the elevator cars going up and down was ridiculous!!  And unrelenting.  The 3rd and last night was to no fault of the staff in the hotel but, we were awakened by people pounding on the door of the room next to us as they attempted to wake the person inside.  This went on for 15-20 minutes.  later in the early morning, we were again awakened by the Fire Dept as they made entry to that room and had to take the person to the hospital.  NO SLEEP on the last night we were there.  Upon check out as I went to pay for the room with cash, I was told that the desk doesn't have any change.  It is my responsibility to have exact change if I want to pay cash.  I've stayed in THIS hotel before and that was a great stay.  This one left so many things to be desired.  Not sure I'll stay here again.

title: Great Location. Rooms Long in the Tooth
text: ALERT: NO POOL!  And the room phone doesn't work so be prepared to do a lot of running up and down from room to lobby to get anything you need. Great location but pretty long in the tooth - old, run down and a bit grimy.

title: too much extra charges, become double
text:
It is not recommendable to moderate traveller and economic planner
I didn't aware I have to pay far more than an initial amount contracted, after my leaving I got a charge notice through the credit card notice

title: Worst experience ever .. apart from the bedroom view
text:
Room was excellent and view was amazing but that was all. No restaurant and no guidance when asked as to where we could eat. We had to settle for a some takeaway pizza to eat in our room.
Guest services told us on the phone that we could have breakfast in the lobby. That proved to be wrong and we had to eat in the bedroom. And the breakfast was only fit for the bin. Appalling, yet 126 dollars was added to the bill despite us being on a bed and breakfast bassi.
Nobody seemed to have a clue how the run the hotel and when I mentioned this at the front desk on checking out they simply said "Short staffed". Not even an apology. 
When we checked in a 100 dollar deposit was added without informing us. It was only when I checked later at the desk that they informed me. We were then billed 126 dollars for breakfast which  was added to the bill despite us being on a room and breakfast basis, along with the 100 dollar deposit charge. It was only when I raised both charges with the desk that they were removed. I left feeling that there was the intention to overcharge me.
Certainly won't stay with Hilton ever again.

title: Worn out hotel
text:
Worn out hotel. Definitely in need of deep refurbishment and cleaning...

Location is great. But otherwise it's sub-par on every single level.

Not much else to say apart that it's well located 1 min from WTC

title: Great location, value, and quality of stay.
text: Night staff at the reception desk was a little rude and condescending, and could have a better service attitude.  Daytime staff and everything else at the hotel was great, and the location is unbeatable.  I would gladly, and most likely will, stay there again.

title: Make sure to call them and get the right room
text: When we got there they gave me the wrong rooms so we had to keep moving and waiting for other rooms for an hour. And there is only onsite working people, no online customer services or back up support. Make sure to complain directly on site if there is any.

title: Eh. It was nice but….
text:
This hotel is in a prime location! Which makes it accessible to alll trains. Outside of that, it was a lackluster hotel stay. I’m from New York and i stayed here with my partner to attend an event in the city. We decided to make it a weekend stay and we chose this hotel because of its location and price point. The view was fabulous!! We were on the 49th floor and I loved being able to be a fake tourist and see the 9/11 memorial. But the room was pretty outdated. It was large (compared to NYC hotel room standards for a king bed) but there was no mini fridge or loveseat. There was an odd space in the corner with an end table that made me feel as though a chair belonged there but it there wasn’t one. Strange. The bathroom was pretty good and i loved the water pressure. 

The only issue i have with this hotel is the severe lack of communication with the staff and management and with myself as the guest. I checked in with no issues Friday night and put my partner’s name on the room so he can get a key card (because i was going to run some errands). Somehow, he is prompted to check in and leave a card down (which didn’t make any sense because when i checked in, my card was charged). So the woman recognized her mistake, took his card off and told him to tell me to come back to the desk. Red flag number one. Because why didn’t anyone call me nor why didn’t you see in the computer that the room was under my name and paid for? I come back fro merrands and check in with another desk person and she assures me that everything is fine and my room is paid for and doesn’t see any strange issues. Saturday morning, I’m getting ready for my event and leave the room. I get a call from to my partner stating that he’s locked out and they charged his room. So when i come back to the receptionist and after speaking to a male manager on the phone prior, the male manager takes my card for the third time, manually “overrides” the issues and says it’s fine. Red  flag number two abs three. Fine. I check out Sunday morning and i get my itemized receipt and I’m soooo glad i read it. Because on it, they still charged my partner’s card and then charged me an additional $300 for the room. So at this point, I’m irritated by the lack of communication in this place and why this issue wasn’t handled Friday night. The woman apologizes (it’s the same woman that checked my partner in on Friday) and then it’s fixed. A simple phone call from them and a checks & balances system would suffice.

title: Avoid!!! Worst hotel ever!!!!
text: We booked the hotel months before and were hoping it would be ok even despite lots of terrible reviews that had started appearing. We used a well known booking site and selected the pay on arrival option. We drove 8 hours from Canada to the hotel only to receive an email saying that our room was now unavailable and had been cancelled. We were now an hour away from the hotel in a foreign country in the dark with nowhere to sleep that night. Tried ringing the hotel who's view was "tough luck" and simply said there was nothing they could do. Totally horrible uncaring staff.

title: Hotel parking is closed :-(
text: I stayed a few times at this hotel and loved the vallet parking option after driving many hours to arrive. Unfortunately this time my experience wasn't very good. There was a lot of construction nearby and it took almost 30 minutes to drive 3 blocks and reach to the hotel. Once I got to the hotel

title: DO NOT stay there!
text: I am sure most of the positive reviews are fake. I highly recommend to look at the photos people are attaching to the reviews. Here you go. Horrible ZERO star motel in NY. Please do not stay there. Upon arrival I was told that my king size room was not available because they "had a large group of government people arrived earlier". I am not kidding! Stained carpet. Stained linen. Mold on wall paper in bathroom. No curtains in bathroom. The hair dryer with melted plastic. Uncomfortable beds. Broken outlets. View to the windows of the office building across the street. Etc, etc.

title: Horrible, ZERO star motel
text: Absolutely horrible, dirty place with careless stuff. Booked king bed room, was told it was not available because they had "a big group of government people arrived earlier". I am not kidding! Got 2 twin beds instead, messy carpet, bloody spots on the linen, et, etc. PLEASE do not stay there.

title: A tremendous drop since leaving the Hilton brand
text:
Highly disappointed this trip after this being my go to.  Upon arrival after a bit of a long day, I was practically barked at by a staff member to stand in a queue to the left of the entry.  This queue was marked only by a small letterboard on a stand with simple white letters on a black background.  It was not clear guests needed to "funnel there" upon arrival.   There was also only one other guest at the front desk at the time, so there was no clear need for a queue at that time. 
 
There was also no clear reflection from the front desk of the facility's departure from Hilton.  This was my first stay since that change took place in January of this year.  Upon asking if I could have my Hilton Honors account linked to the stay, I was informed in a very matter of fact way that it would be a MyMillennium rewards program.  No simple apologetic comment that the property has left the Hilton brand and is now on it's own brand.  No attempt to pleasantly upsell joining the MyMillennium Rewards program, which I chose not to do.
 
The weird lighting set up in the bathroom wasn't clear either.  The panel has a vertical slider for the dimmer.  But the actual switch is a horizontal rocker made flush with the panel and VERY thin.  After attempts at the slider did nothing, and feeling around the plate for a bit I finally figured it out.  But in this case, form was given priority at a big expense of function.
 
The room itself was my pretty standard experience at the Millennium.  Bed and pillows were comfortable.  Desk was a decent size and easy to work at.  Shower worked well and water pressure and temps were good.  On business I rarely need amenities so I didn't use anything from restaurants to concierge service. Overall the room was clean and comfortable.  But there are definitely other properties in the Financial District that can make the same claim.
 
After over a decade of staying here, sadly I suspect this will be my last time at this property.  Given the cost of this location, I expect more in the way of guest treatment than what I received this time.

title: Everything was good. View is outstanding!
text: Convenient location.  Amazing view.  Daily cleaning, change of linen and drinks.  Comfortable clean bed. Very caring staff.  We are happy that we chose this hotel.  High recommendations.  We had a corner room on a high floor.

title: Overpriced for an unmaintained property.
text:
It has not been maintained. Stained and ripped carpet.  Stained desk chair. Wallpaper in bathroom peeling in several places. Bed frame bracket sticking out and dangerous. No refrigerator. Uncomfortable beds.

Location is great. Good shower water pressure.

title: Good location. Tired rooms
text: Same as everyone else. Good location and view. Tired rooms. But really—-no restaurant? Even a Super 8 motel has bfast. And here’s the thing: there’s not even a sign that says restaurant closed. You hit the elevator button for 3rd floor. It just doesn’t light up. When I went to the front desk and asked he says “it’s been closed for 3 yrs” like I was an idiot for not knowing. He’s clearly tired of answering the question. Spend $5 and at least put a sign up.

title: 2 weeks travelling around New york
text: This was our last stop after staying in times Square, niagra falls, belmar, new jersey and this final destination of Lower manhattan. Great location. Room average, needs updating. Restaurant still.closed due to covid!!! Lots of taxes on the bill although hotel doesn't offer any facilities accept a small bar, which wasn't open very often. View great.  We were disappointed about the restaurant and reception staff very abrupt and not helpful. Would we stay again, yes for location, no for anything else.

title: Brilliant
text: Loved this hotel, the location is brilliant. Yes it may be a bit tired but its a great hotel to stay in. The people are lovely and helpful, especially the concierge. We will definitely be back to NY and staying at Millenium Downtown:)

title: NYC getaway
text: I chose the hotel mainly for its location. It’s conveniently located near the subway lines, 9/11 memorial and other parts of lower Manhattan.   Rooms were extremely clean and housekeeping did a great.  Front desk staff across the board were impatient, rushed and rude and made me feel more like I was bothering them.

title: At least the view was great
text:
Pro’s: great views and good location
Con’s:
- feels dirty and run-down: stained / dirty carpets, dirty phones, etc
- no minibar, not even a fridge in the room or a hotel shop
- no restaurant, not even for breakfast
- poor in-room dining
- air con sounds like a jet engine
- laundry service didn’t work.  Despite two requests in the morning to pick up my laundry, the dirty laundry was still there when I returned at night. Meaning I was out of clean clothes for the next day
- main phone not working (so had to make my calls for poor service from the bathroom)
-  noisy rooms (very poor insulation from adjacent rooms, hallway and elevators)
- one day no housekeeping just because I was in my room during their morning shift. Housekeeping didn’t come back later in the day

For the money I paid, there is much better value and service from other hotels in NYC

title: Lovely hotel in a great location
text: Hotel was good value for money, well maintained, decent size rooms and very clean.  Location was perfect, number of subway stations within minutes and surrounding area was lovely, with plenty of facilities close by, yet quiet.  Staff were friendly and helpful.

title: Down on its ear
text: The hotel seems very understaffed, run-down and lacking amenities. I upgraded to a more expensive room so I could have early check-in. The view and room size are both great, but the carpet is terribly stained, the furniture is scratched and it appears very poorly maintained. Likewise, no one answers the phone, there is no in-room dining and there was only one staff available at check-in. I'm sure the hotel is facing staff challenges but it doesn't make a great impression. It's a fine place if you just want a functional place to stay but if I weren't here for business, I'd be annoyed to be paying personal money to stay here.

title: Perfect location
text: Just back and overall very happy with the hotel.  Yes the hotel is dated and some amenities need attention but the location is fabulous, we had views of the Hudson, WTC building and the 9/11 memorial.  The hotel is perfect for all the downtown attractions i.e. Battery Park, Wall St, Brooklyn Bridge etc and the subway is just across the road.  We loved Stage Door which is a deli just 2 mins walk from the hotel.  Hotel staff were helpful and I would definitely book Millenium Downtown again

title: Excellent séjour
text: Hotel super bien placé avec une vue splendide sur le WTC et juste au niveau du métro Cortland (ligne R). Personnel aimable. Déco américaine typique. C'est calme, c'est propre, de quoi passer un très bon séjour.

title: Great view but hotel stuck in the 90s
text: The view is unbeatable if you get a corner room on a high level. But the interior of the rooms hasn't been updated in a long time and could use some work. The bed is as old as the hotel if you like spring mattress then this is for you. Don't bother with the TV the cable system is just as old as the bed. Show is small and uncomfortable. no mini fridge which was annoying for a week long stay during summer. Internet is also only 5mbps and very slow so don't plan on working here if you stay. The elevators take at least 10 minutes to get to you and only 1 was operational during my stay. However the staff were very nice and accommodating. Overall a creepy and weird vibe to the place if they could fix the interior and basic services like room service then they would have a great hotel.

title: Stay at Millennium Downtown New York
text: It was my first time in Millennium and I really liked the location. It was really easy to get to the places of sightseeing. It was easy to find the hotel both of you come by taxi or by subway - as the station is so closed. But the room leaves much to be desired. I have chosen superior room - it was not so clean, the panoramic window had a lot of fingerprints so it was not good for taking photos and so on.. I saw some dust on the table, headboard and etc, maybe the room was really old..the table lamp was not working, some issues with shower. I hope that the guest relationships office will check everything and solve this problem. This hotel maybe on of the best in NYC If they solve these issues. Thank you

title: Lacking
text:
I stay at this property 2 - 3 times a year. Since my last stay I have noticed the property doesn't spend any money on refreshing the rooms along with my list of more current issue with my last stay (which will be my absolute last)
No Restaurant
No Valet 
Parking is 3 blocks away
Tired Looking Room

title: Nice hospitality
text: I’ve arrived quite earlier than the normal time, 4:00pm, but they arranged my room after 2:30pm as the room was ready. It might sound a general service, but I’m happy that how they explained and sorted out for me. Thank you!!

title: Good hotel, good locations, good price
text: We liked staying here. My husband especially liked the proximity to the 9/11 memorial, station, and One World Trade Center. The staff was nice. The only issue was that only one elevator ran for a good chunk of our stay, so it took a bit of waiting to travel between the lobby and our room. This was fixed toward the end of our stay though.

title: You stay here for the view & the location. That's really the only reason.
text:
The view is priceless. Right across the street from the WTC Oculus, you honestly can't get a better location anywhere. 

However: the furniture is very dated and worn on the edges, the toilet and countertop in the bathroom were clearly designed for small children because they're very low, the carpeting is stained, and the drinks in the lobby bar are overpriced and not great. On the plus side, the rooms are very quiet, and they have nice feather pillows. Bed is a little hard for my liking but I prefer a very soft bed so YMMV. They were able to check me in early, but only if I paid to upgrade to a junior suite. All in all, I would stay here again, but just be aware of what you're in for.

title: Hoping for a change back to the days of being Hilton-owned.
text:
I keep changing my rate from 3 to 4 stars so maybe after writing my full review, I’ll decide what to stick with. 
The first thing I wanted to mention is that this hotel is no longer own/run/managed by Hilton. I did not know that and honestly, I know it wouldn’t have given me pause if I did when booking my recent trip. I’ve stayed at this hotel three or four times when it was run by Hilton and each time, it was a top-notch and luxurious stay. During this most recent trip, I didn’t notice right away that there was a difference, but after one day, then two, and then three, I could definitely see the change. Let’s get this out of the way—the staff was wonderful. From the front desk, to the concierge, to housekeeping, everyone was really nice and professional. I wanted to say that right away b/c I’m sure when management and owners read reviews, they want to blame the frontline staff and that just shouldn’t happen. 

I am not a hotel-snob so my main issue was the room cost compared to the quality. The Millennium is still appearing like, and charging for, a premium hotel experience. The rooms are now dated and needing to be updated. The light sconces are crooked, the bedside reading lamps, and clock, were unplugged with no outlet (or extension cord) on one side of the bed. The TV is no where near as modern as it should be, and the bathroom needs to be caulked, and the faucets and shower hardware needs to be updated. The carpets are really what is the worst. My fellow guest and I wore our shoes the entire time we were in the room: the bathroom floor was sticky from something that spilled and we had to put a towel down on the carpet in front of the bathroom from this same spill. This mysterious substance was embedded into the carpet and very  sticky as well. It had no odor whatsoever, so it wasn’t worth changing rooms or making a complaint about. But having to put a towel down on top of carpet and put  a pair of flip flops on as soon as you step out of the shower is really unfortunate. I’m absolutely certain the floors were vacuumed by housekeeping but they really need either steam-cleaning or full replacement. 

The best thing about this hotel is the location. I’ve taken many trips to NYC and this is, by far, the best location: It is emotionally moving to be so close to Ground Zero, the various Metro lines are very close by, and the best thing about the Financial District is that you are not overrun with tourists (especially at night). I have a soft-spot in my heart for this hotel b/c I’ve spent so much time there and had so many great memories. However, I’ll be watching the reviews carefully and unless things improve, I won’t be returning. For the amount of money I paid….I expect a comparable  experience.

title: Horrible. Keep out !
text: Old and ran down hotel. Carpet unspeakably disgusting. Almost no furniture in the room. Absolutely zero service (can’t even get a spoon!!!). Absolutely terrible and most definitely not worth the price.  Keep out !

title: Nice location!
text:
Pros: great location, friendly staff, nice hotel, excellent views from every room
Cons: no onsite parking, only 2/4 elevators working, no restaurant (they claim to have one), bar didn’t stay open past 11:30

title: Most Elevators Broken
text: Plan to wait 20 mins to get out of hotel every time you want to get out and about. Only in-room breakfast service is available. Hotel and main bar are closed for renovation. Lobby bar also closes early.

title: Disappointing
text: The location of this hotel is great and provides breathtaking views - very walkable area to several restaurants, shopping, Battery Park, the walking trail. Unfortunately, the guest rooms need serious improvements.

title: great location  nice property riduculous extra charges for access to mini fridge etc, tv not working
text: great location near WTC memorial.  clean room and well appointed.   for the price (approx $500) it seems ludicrous to charge additional money for basics like access to the minifridge.  What feels like a greedy policy to extort every last dollar out of customers soiled what would have otherwise been an expensive but otherwise satisfactory visit

title: Muy bien ubicado pero necesita mejoras en el mobiliario y la moqueta.
text:
El hotel está perfectamente ubicado. Accesible a cualquier zona de la ciudad desde el metro.
Las habitaciones, con vistas excelentes, requieren modernizar el mobiliario y la moqueta. No son aceptables para el alto precio que se paga.

title: Below basic and not functional anymore
text: Stayed for a business trip, hotel seemed like it took a few steps back. Non functioning bathroom without very hot water and a slowly clearing bathtub as well as lack of water in the room contributed to an overall bad experience among all the rest of minor issues.

title: Unwelcoming Staff and dirty room
text:
Great location but spoiled but the front desk staff and they lack of friendly greeting.  A smile goes a long way. 
Unfortunately our room was dirty behind the bed and had previous guest clothing and dirty tissues. 
The room was cleaned when I complained but no customer recovery for this.

title: Great location, view, price, and cleanliness!
text: Location cannot be better - right across Oculus with subway stations inside. The hotel is not new, but well maintained. It is very clean, awesome view. One comment is just that the TV doesn't allow casting of netflix or other streaming media so we couldnt really use that.

title: my impressions
text: very inattentive staff,poor front desk service to phone calls.lack of empathy and concern for guests.please  improve your services so guests would like to come back.Location is great subway access and joes pizza great

title: Stunning
text: We were there to attend wedding.  The view from our room was stunning.  Staff was professional and friendly.  Location, was excellent.  Lots to do in surrounding area and good food available everywhere.  Would  stay here again.

title: Great Location! Very clean room!
text: Location is great! Restaurants, shops and subway stations are all around the corner. Walking distance to battery park and several other parks. Room is very clean and quiet.  Staff is very attentive and polite.

title: Worth it
text:
Your venue and amenities were exceptional. However, it was the lovely person I spent time here with that made it a noteworthy and wonderful experience. This should be her review.

She is distinctive in character. A true blend of whimsy and wisdom. A rare find and compassionate soul. If I'm lucky, I'll have the good fortune of 40+ years of hotel stays with her where we can talk about everything and nothing all at once, and I can hang on her insightful words. Her sharp wit will regularly whiz by me but I will appreciate the wry remarks that I do glean.

All this to say: I'd miss a Math Festival any day of the year if it meant I could spoon her all afternoon instead, and have breakfast for dinner when the night has only begun.

Your cleaning staff were diligent, too. Keep up the good work -- I'll be back and will gladly recommend a stay at the Millennium Downtown New York, even if the others don't have the good fortune of my friend's company.

title: Superbe vue
text:
Chambre au 43ème étage, réservée sur AirBNB.

Très bien situé, une entrée pour la station Cortlandt St pour les lignes R et W se trouve juste au pied de l’hôtel, et la station World Trade Center à quelques mètres pour d’autres lignes.
Plusieurs centres commerciaux se trouvent à proximité, avec quelques restaurants. Je recommande particulièrement le pub O’Hara’s qui se trouve à quelque rues de l’hôtel.

La chambre était propre, avec une superbe vue sur le One World Trade Center, mais qui comporte les points négatifs suivants :
• L’isolation sonore n’est pas au top, on entend pas mal les bruits du couloir, et la télé des voisins.
• La déco un peu vieillotte, mais pour nous ce n’était pas important.
• La climatisation est un peu bruyante et difficile à régler.

Le personnel est très sympathique, accueillant, et disponible en cas de pépin.
