Concernant le paiement, nous avons réservé sur AirBNB. Nous avons dû payer une caution de $500 pour 9 nuits. Le reste des frais étaient compris dans ce que nous avons payé initialement, nous n’avons rien eu d’autre à régler.

Pour résumer nous y avons passé un agréable séjour, ce sont les défauts de la chambre cités plus haut qui ont baissé la note.

title: Very beautiful view
text: The view from our room was gorgeous. We booked out room for a decent price based on the location and view. It would be nice if there was easier access to drinking water although they did have a fountain in the gym.

title: n/a
text:
not too happy, wit you charging money for a room that is already paid  ,
i had issues at check in with credicard and double payment !! had to wait until monday to solve a simple issue !! so that was was my review of my stay

title: Great hotel
text: Overall a great experience.  Great view of the city.  Very central to a lot of the venues we went to.  Staff were very friendly.  Easy access to the subway.  At night the area is nice, pleasant, and quiet.

title: Location vs Quality
text: I paid a pretty penny for my room and didn't receive the quality one would expect for the price. The location is awesome, so it seemed like a bit of "give and take". The carpet had stains and unfortunately the room smelled like mold.

title: Excellent location but room a bit outdated
text: An overall nice hotel, with comfortable bed, but the rooms are in need of renovation. It is a bit outdated, even if in my opinion, the views and the pros outweigh the cons. This hotel is still very decent and in a location which is hard to beat if you’re looking to stay in Downtown Manhattan.

title: HOTEL NO RECOMENDABLE
text: Lo que se muestra no es, las fotos no corresponden, se pagó por desayuno y llegaba un delivery con un box breakfast, el baño sin amenities, la cafetera no funcionaba (no estaba)  Hotel caro para lo que es

title: Fantastic
text: Fantastic hotel, staff really friendly and helpful, largest room I’ve seen in New York. Cleaning staff do a great job and they do it daily, views (from the upper floor at least) are unbeatable. Actively looking at dates to return and use this hotel as a base (subway) outside front door

title: Great location.  Not so great cleanliness.
text: Carpets in room needed to be cleaned.  No refrigerator in rooms.  Not enough outlets.  Concierge got us a ride to the airport but there were not enough seats so one of us has to sit on the floor.  Hotel said it was not their problem.

title: Great views, not a deluxe experience
text:
Stayed in early June during a heatwave in New York.

One major plus is that the room felt pretty cold, which was a paradise after coming in off the street from baking heat. The air conditioning is a definite plus. Never had a problem really getting our room cleaned. 

It is an older hotel, carpets are old, theres nothing special in the room however you do have to accept as far as the price and location/views go, I found it was worth it. If this was a five star room with these views, you'd probably be paying five times the price. 

Had a corner suite, had plenty of space and no major troubles during our time there. Bed was comfortable enough, wifi was adequate speeds about the 30mbps range I think. 

Whether you should stay depends on your personal views on location vs. room quality. We felt it was a great base in New York as far as the subway, walking over Brooklyn Bridge, getting coffee and walking towards midtown for shopping. Can't say I heard too much noise from the street.

title: Great location and tired rooms
text: Heart of lower Manhattan, across from Millennium tower and walking distance to tons.  My room had an amazing view of millennium tower, the 9/11 memorials, as well as a great view uptown.  Hotel has clearly underinvested in their rooms and infrastructure. Stains on carpets and couches, lack of plugs, broken ice makers and general disrepair.  Also there is limited food availability.  We paid a low price and it was a decent trade off, but if I paid more, I’d have been very displeased.

title: 5-star View, 2-star Quality
text:
My mom is 75 and called for a shower chair, which most hotels have. Well it took a long while before it was determined that the hotel had no shower chairs at all. She then asked for a conference room chair to sit in the bathroom and use outside of the shower. She covered it with towels during her use. 

The room (love seat/pull out bed) has stains and was dirty in many places aside from the surface cleaning done by housekeeping.  We had to direct a filthy ledge to be cleaned which the housekeeper obliged. The lighting was so poor at night that by the third of six nights we had to ask for additional lamp in the room. Also, I did not understand being charged extra fees for a fridge and microwave given our six night stay. That just seemed like an unnecessary fee to pay after the cost of the room. We don’t plan on staying here again. The view was gorgeous but it otherwise felt like a 2.5 star hotel with an awesome view.

title: Fantastic view of North Pool
text: Fabulous room on 26th floor with views of 9/11 Memorial site on one side and City Hall on the other. Amazing amount of space in a Downtown Hotel room! Only low mark is for the soft bed. No restaurant meant seeking breakfast elsewhere - Apple Gourmet met our needs well!

title: Great hotel!
text: Great staff, perfect location and a very nice hotel with amazing views. We would come back any time. The hotel was just taken over by the original owner and the management contract with Hilton discontinued. Some things still have to be worked out (restaurant not yet open again and hotel bar also not every evening open), but overall a great choice.

title: Very convenient Hotal for the trip.
text: It is quite clean and convenient place to stay for the trip.  We stayed five days and four nights in this hotel.  We have not been NY city over past ten years.  I like the location and view of this hotel.  We are very happy to find this hotel and will stay her in next trip.

title: Hotel perfectamente situado para una visita a New York
text: El hotel se encuentra muy bien situado, muy cerca del One World y la zona de Battery Park. Te permite que alguno de los días de tu viaje no tengas que coger ni metro, porque tienes bastantes sitios que visitar a menos de 300 m. El personal es muy amable y, en nuestro caso, la habitación de esquina en el piso 28 era maravillosa, bastante amplia, con un baño grande y vistas excelentes en las dos ventanas. La única pega es que las dos camas dobles son de 1,35 cm, por lo que para dos personas cada una son un poco justas.

title: Won’t stay there again
text:
The hotel floors are dirty. 

The bathroom lights automatically come on when you walk in at 2am to pee, causing 8 super bright lights to blind you.
 
The bathroom faucet handles are hard to turn on. 

The rooms provide no refrigerators, and the ice machine in the hallway didn’t work. 

There are literary NO available power outlets near the bed to plug in your phone. 

The elevator sounded like it could break any minute. 

The concierge services set is us with a ride back to the airport. The driver arrived 20 minutes late. We had 7 people in our party and the Suburban only had seats for 6. They expected my nephew to sit on the dirty floor with no seat belt. Due to the driver already arriving late, I ended up having to sit on the floor so my nephew could have a proper seat with a seatbelt, so we could get to the airport on time. (Even with a sign in the car saying “seatbelts must be available for your use”)

I called the hotel and advised them of the situation and they took no responsibility for their concierge services, said it wasn’t their fault. 

They don’t seem to care much about their guests once they have your money. We paid for 3 expensive rooms and they couldn’t even step up to refund us $80 for the unsafe transportation they provided. 

I won’t be returning here.

title: Happy customer
text: Uninspected incredible view from our room. The staffs was helpful and friendly and welcoming. I would definitely come and stay here again. This is our first time in Nee York and the welcoming of the staffs made us comfortable

title: Great Location Meh Service
text: The hotel is in a fantastic location - near 9/11 memorial, Oculus, Wall Street, Brookfield Place and more as well as easy access to subway lines to travel the city! The room was comfortable and clean but the service was less than desirable.  Registration staff was highly unfriendly, the staff next to me offered the other guest to be texted when room was ready.  Mine did no such thing and when I asked to have that done it was as if I was asking for a huge favour.  Needless to say I never got the text! Service never got any better either which was super disappointing as customer service matters!

title: Great location
text:
Great location and views. Beautiful rooms!
Very quiet.
Friendly staff but they can't fix all the defaults because the hotel is getting old.
Cleanliness could be better.
A pity that there is no restaurant in the hotel.

title: Poorly Managed Property
text: Does not live up to prior ownership standards that we are accustomed to in our past visits. Property upkeep in disarray. Falsely advertised amenities in booking online site and property overall condition under new ownership. We were very disappointed to find the failed conditions and the excuses given as to why we found the property in such a disappointing state of upkeep.

title: Lousy with a location
text: Great location and view.  Any positives stop there.  Probably fine for tourists but business clients who need functional internet and some quiet should avoid.    Dirty poorly maintained rooms, noisiest plumbing ever, constant long lines at front desk so service turnaround is poor (took three times to get TV in working order) you constantly have to sign up for internet instead of having it set up via your room for the stay.  The facility fee is BS, the bike codes don’t work, and there are no coffee or food onsite to use your credit.

title: Resort Fee
text:
Hotel is a good location, and used to be a Hilton, so its quite good. The Resort Fee is a con, and not all the services are provided.

The hotel is modern, but could do with a redecoration. The views are great!

title: Great Location but no service
text: The location of the downtown Millenium was great, so close to a lot of restaurants, as there was no restaurant in the hotel, and subway stops, and right across from the 9-11 Memorial.  We found out on our last night there that even the bar does not stay open later.  It closed at 11:30 on a Saturday night.  The housekeeping staff that we encountered tried to be helpful, but their hands were tied, as they did not have the capabilities to get us what we needed, an extra chair, hand lotion, and our phone fixed.  It never worked.

title: Business stay - Aug 2022
text:
Moderate for price and ROI.
Could do a lot better with minor improvements such as housekeeping, basic maintenance, cleanliness, urgency in check-in/check-out.
Location is great; can leverage to attract customers compared to other local hotels in similar price range that are much smaller and inconspicuous (Holiday Inn, Fairfield Inn, World Trade Hotel, Club Quarters, Residence Inn Marriott, others).
Somewhat rundown

title: Clean your rugs
text: I stay at hotels all over the world and I haven’t seen a rug this dirty in my room ever!  It’s a shame for what I paid a night that I would have a rug like this.  I got in very late so I didn’t wanna go down and complain and have to be moved.

title: fair
text:
room wre average at best but the view was phenomenal abd the area
was incredible great location i woul recommend the hoteldue to it's location 
the staff was very helpful in fixing my issue with room i was accomodated
to a different room and it made all the difference i would stay there again

title: Excellent location
text:
Millenium Hotel is located right across the street from WTC, & Occulus.
Excellent area for shopping 
Fantastic resaurants in the vicinity .
Starbucks around the corner .
Subway right outside the Hotel 
Path trains right across the street .

title: Poor Room
text: Our room was smelly and had stained carpet and the vents were very dusty. A fire alarm went off in the middle of the night and woke us up. It was announced as a false alarm. Quite ridiculous given the high price that we were charged to stay here. We paid for a comfortable stay, which we didn't receive.

title: Millenium downtown summer holiday
text: Very nice location, it is a good choice for à family holiday with a wonderful view but the rooms are a bit out dated and could use a good makeover. We envoyer skating there, it Washington also very convenient for transportation.

title: Hotel is in a terrible state. Needs a thorough deep cleaning.
text:
Good things: Great location perhaps why they still get business. Across from World Trade Center, close to subway, restaurants and great park. Most attractions are reachable by subway. Just make sure to follow the correct signs. 

Other than that the hotel is not clean, needs a serious upgrade. Dirty is an understatement. Front desk seemed surprised when I showed them the pictures. To summarize find a different hotel.

title: What an Amazing view.
text: The rooms have amazing views and the hotel location is second to none. The onlys problem were the office chair in my room seemed to have oil and dirt stains. The only other chair to sit on in the room, had a large white stain on it that seemed like bodily fluid.

title: New York
text: Wonderful place to stay it’s in front of the 9/11 memorial and staff are very attentive you wont regret your stay I recommend it to anybody that travels to New York for what ever reason you decided to travel there

title: Additional charges not advertised in the rate
text: Hotel charged additional $40/room (total $80) for service that you may not use like wifi, unlimited international calls or one day bike pass. Hotel should advertise those charges upfront and avoid surprised.

title: Poor Customer Service. Optional Donation Automatically Added. Not transparent about Facility Fee
text:
- Poor customer service. I asked for slippers and a new functioning locker. Left the room for two hours. When I got back, slippers was still not delivered. I had to call again.
- There was an optional donation automatically added to my bill. Only $2.50 so it's not about the money - it's about the fact that I was never asked by the staff and never provided my consent.
- There's a $35 a day facility fee on top on room charge. I did not appreciate the 'hidden fees'. It wasn't called out prominently enough even if it was visible. I booked through Egencia
- Bathroom was smelly
- The inner lid of coffee pot was dusty - cleaning was just not thorough
- Wall is thin. One night I could hear the guests in the next room. Celebrating some kind of occasion so volume may be higher than usual conversational volume, but definitely not full-fledge party noise level. I could hear everything. Disrupted my sleep.

title: Customer service
text: The front desk clerk was amazing. I wish I could remember her name. She was so friendly and kind, especially after I booked the hotel stay at the last minute due to unforeseen circumstances. I highly recommend this hotel. Customer service is amazing!

title: Great hotel. But one thing to note there is no refridgerator in the room.
text:
Great hotel. But one thing to note there is no refridgerator in the room. The amenities was not refilled. I have to use one small soap bar and one little bottle of shampoo for all 4 days in my stay. 
But other things was very great. The location is super great too.

title: Loved it
text: You can't beat the location and the view. The hotel staff was very attentive. The room was quiet even though we were close to elevators. The selection of places to eat was great and Starbucks on the side of building.

title: Disappointment coming your way
text:
Stayed here off and on starting about 20 years ago when it was modern, shiny, new, and managed by Hilton.

Stayed with family in a Junior suite past weekend. First the highs: great location if you’re viewing WTC Memorial. Great views with surrounding windows.

But that’s about it. How it has deteriorated and left unkempt without proper maintenance over the years. You can tell they don’t care anymore- perhaps milking the price paid by unsuspecting nostalgic ex-patrons until their reputation completely unveils. And the current pricing absolutely does not reflect its current state of its demised condition.

Let me name a few to paint the picture. Peeling paint, wall paper coming off at the edges, dirty dirty (did I mention dirty?) stained carpet, deep urine stains around the toilet seat, slow draining water with weak water pressure (still the old type of tub), old dusty and drabby curtains, varnish of wood peeling, no refridgerator (!!? why not? it did have a lock box though surprisingly), non working lamps, list goes on… And the inconvenience of no parking or valet on site and the logistics to drop off family or luggage, park 4 blacks or so away at their recommended parking site, and to walk back in the dark. Maybe this, though, is the New York experience you were seeking when it was still under the governance of Koch.

I’ve stayed at holiday inns in nicer conditions and more amenities at quarter of this price.

You will be disappointed in the condition of these rooms. The only other option seems to be to travel back in time 10-20 years and experience the rooms then. Otherwise, this millennium may have ended, new one to surely replace.

title: The worst hotel I’ve ever stayed at
text: Had to switch rooms because my original room was clearly not cleaned. Hair all over the bed, crumbs on the desk, the carpet was disgusting. They switched me rooms and the new room also had the exact same issues. I felt dirty and disgusting being there. Also the AC didn’t go below 74 even though it was almost 100 degrees out. Never, ever, ever stay there.

title: Amazing view! Comfy room!
text: I had the best time in this hotel. I got a junior suit and it had the best view ever. Both sides of the Hudson and all the way to Times Square and the freedom tower. The first room I got was pretty dusty, it was very old carpet so that is difficult to maintain. I have allergies and when I told the staff downstairs they were very helpful and gave me a different room that was perfect! Yes the hotel is 90s style and at some point will need some upgrading and modernizing but it has a certain charm as well. Especially the second room with new carpet and furniture was perfect. Great location, everything is nearby. Subway has all the stops you need for getting wherever you want. WiFi and tv worked perfectly.

title: NOT thrilled
text: When we arrived - there was blood on the sheets and comforter and considering the money i spent for the room, when i spoke to the front desk on my own cell phone because the phone in the room did not work either.   As well as the carpet was stained badly and torn,  they agreed to give me back my $50 fee , .. With the money that I spent, considering all the issue with the room, I should be comped another night, for the simple fact that with all the diseases in this world today , they came to change the sheets, but $50 does not make up for the lack of my safety and my partners health as well.   most money I have spent on 1 night for my partners birthday and I am not impressed .... at all

title: Not worth the money
text: The furniture was stained and outdated/damaged. In addition the walls were soiled and the phone did not work the entire time, so in order to contact room service I had to call the front desk from my cell phone and be transferred to room service. I alerted the front desk but a technician never arrived to fix the issue.  For over four hundred dollars a night including fees I would expect higher quality.

title: No hospitality
text: Only the concierges were very kind and helped us out. But the check-in, check-out and questions about our reservation including breakfast passed very quickly. No one at the reception was really interested. The swimmingpool was closed, we had breakfast at our room because of the closed restaurant but only two seats for three people, got coffee when we asked for tea. One of us got a little piece of glass in her foot that was left in the bathroom by earlier guests. And above all we were charged for 200 dollars more because they still didn’t noticed that we’d booked inclusive breakfast.

title: Things could of be better
text: Horrible beds, didn't not receive good night sleep. Fire alarm went off at midnight so didn't help are sleep. Did however like the location to ground zero. Advertise a restaurant and it is closed. Should have complementary breakfast

title: Need for Refurbishment
text: Great view but urgently requires refurbishment. We got a suite but it is no longer up to current standards, e.g. leaking airco, curtains no longer opening, wet carpet, table and other furniture was completely worn down.

title: Romantic Getaway!
text: The room gave a priceless view of the World Trade area! It's very convenient to the subway and an up-scale mall.  The staff were very courteous and in great spirits even when we arrived after 2am.  Yes, I would return!

title: location great, sleep quality will suffer
text: great location but be prepared to lose some sleep with the consistent banging on the hotel door from house keeping ever morning. Even if you put the sign on your door asking them to come back the following day! they will continue to bang on the door for upwards to 20 minutes . bang! not knock, bang!

title: Great location, clean, lack amenities
text: Hotel is located in a great spot if you want to be downtown. Views from 50th floor were outstanding. Room could use some updating but overall were clean and housekeeping does a great job. I wish there were fridges in the rooms.

title: Needs updating
text: Surprised by the cost for outdated room conditions. Air conditioner was loud and barely worked (couldn't lower the temperature past 74). The tub drain wouldn't seal for a bath, and the sink water pressure was very low. But the bed and pillows were very comfortable. I was also mocked by a front-desk agent when I requested replacement towels and sheets (which never came, by the way). But a very nice cleaning lady was happy to provide my requested towels the next day.

title: Rooms were/are filthy
text: Rooms were unclean/not sanitized.  Was charged for microwave and fridge that never came.  Tv didn't work, neither did phone in one rm.  Had to switch rms because of uncleanliness.  Staff changed rms quickly

title: Amazing views of WTC park
text: Convenient to many businesses/offices in the downtown/financial area of Manhattan. Easy to get to from LGA & JFK. Decent rates, excellent service, and quiet rooms with amazing views. Mine was a business trip with meetings near WTC3 and an event in Brooklyn. Convenient and lovely.

title: Trip advisor review
text: Trip advisor did not tell us that there would be additional daily FB charges. very misleading. I would not book with Trip advisor again because they do not give you the real cost of the room you are booking.

title: Very satisfied and great location
text:
We are very satisfied with the Millenium Hotel. Especially with the location.
The metro station is right next to the hotel and we could reach all the sights quickly.
Our city view from our suite on the 52nd floor was wonderful.

title: Awesome views
text: My check in on a busy Friday evening was quick and efficient. My room faced the Oculus, and New Jersey Skyline. The view was Gorgeous at night!! The bed and bedding was very comfortable. The air conditioner was freezing cold which was great doing heatwave!!!!

title: Super Hotel mit phantastischer Aussicht auf das One World Trade Center und das Sept 11 Memorial
text:
Wir haben drei Übernachtungen im Millennium Downtown New York gebucht und waren sehr zufrieden. Das Zimmer war geräumig, sauber und mit allem ausgestattet, was man erwarten kann. Auch das Badezimmer war ausreichend groß. Nicht zu toppen war die Aussicht aus dem 28. Stock auf das One World Trade Center und das Sept. 11 Memorial. Da lässt man die Vorhänge Tag und Nacht offen - einfach großartig. Insgesamt ist die Lage auch ausgesprochen gut um die Stadt zu erkunden, Das neue Drehkreuz, der U-Bahnhof WTC, ist direkt vor der Tür und von hier gibt es Verbindungen in jeden Winkel der Stadt. Das Hotel selbst hat auch seine Sept. 11 Geschichte, war stark beschädigt und wurde teilweise wieder aufgebaut. Die alte US-Flagge wurde gerettet und hängt heute im Foyer, mit einer kleinen Gedenktafel. Auch der nette Concierce hat das alles miterlebt und seine Geschichte erzählt - sehr bewegend.   Einziger Nachteil, ein Frühstück wurde nicht angeboten. Gleich um die Ecke gibt es zwar ein Strarbucks Cafe und weitere Möglichkeiten für Frühstück in der Umgebung, aber ein Angebot im Hotel wäre schon gut gewesen.  
Alles in Allem aber ein tolles Hotel für einen New York Besuch.

title: Fantastic all around
text: A wonderful hotel, with fabulous staff, in a great location, at a super price, with excellent standards for cleanliness. Not sure why they force me to make more words than I need, I think this is why I stopped using Trip Advisor, but this is a great hotel.

title: Hotel staff extremely rude
text: Beware the front desk is extremely rude. There was a glitch in my check in process that showed me my check in was earlier than 11. When I showed them this they eventually honored it (I didnt ask them to) but the entire time they were rude about it and basically acted like I was dumb. I finally said listen I dont care if you honor it I will pay for early check in but I am just trying to get to my room so I can make it on time to where I have to be today. It took me yelling at them to finally make them stop being rude to me

title: Great hotel - Great location
text:
Very friendly staff, great room and excellent location. The furniture (was from the 80/90s) really needed a change - like the carpet. Inspite of that the people/staff manage a great service. On the website there was displayed a swimmingpool - but it wasn´t there ?? 
All in all - we will come back.

title: Needs a refurb
text: Hotel is well place for the trip i was taking.  Bathroom in particular is dated, and showing its age.  Having said that, everything was clean, and the staff looked after me.  The main room was fine too, just the old bathroom, with fixtures and fittings looking like they needed attention

title: Great Location, Fair Price
text: The hotel offers an easy online booking process. This was a great location for our board meeting at the NYSE located just down the street, walking distance! The Financial District was a great experience. Rooms overlooking the Reflecting Pool at the World Trade Center. Everything you want in a NYC hotel stay.

title: Frequent Traveler Not Returning
text: Will never stay at this property again, and this is after 15+ years as a frequent traveler staying there. The staff was rude, the elevators were slow or all were not running, the garbage remained in the trash can by the elevator for days/overflowing, the bathroom was filthy with the shower head coming out of the holder, the carpet was stained and in numerous spots.  Our ice bucket bag was removed and never replaced.  Our tv controller was not in the room, and the AC wasn't working the first day until after maintenance came.

title: GOOD
text:
We reserve tow d/bed but you guys out and the higher floor,
and the most to my son he was looking your swimming pool, last year 
and this year still not opening, that was put him DOWN......... YOU NEED FIX THAT...

title: Fantastic location at a reasonable price
text: Booked for a weekend in NYC. Fantastic downtown location and reasonably priced for a last minute booking. They should have breakfast included in the default booking and not as an option. They offered a room upgrade but the room we got was great anyway. The higher floor rooms have great views

title: Very acceptable but nothing special
text: I chose this hotel for the price and closeness to my office. The rooms are clean, well kept, and the views are beautiful, but it here just isn’t anything special to call out if you’re looking for a memorable hotel experience.

title: Not too impressed
text: The staff and location was great, the rooms are DIRTY and old….prices are too high for the dirty room that you get. Will not stay there again due to uncleanliness!  There were also many homeless people strewn about in the front of the hotel. Due to the uncleanliness, it was not a very pleasant stay

title: Lo-lenium
text: Great location but in great need of a remodel to match the surrounding location. Rooms are a little on the dark/gloomy side. Ice machines not working. Restaurant/bar closed...no room amenities (fridge/microwave, etc)

title: Location is great but don't expect much
text:
Old property, Bathroom tiles are broken. 
Check-in is at 4 pm, check-out at 11 am. Looks like it was lean staffing in the hotel. Do not expect any amenities in the hotel, not even a tooth brush provided.
They give you 1 ltr water at check-in and that's all.
Location is main highlight of this Hotel as it's right in front of WTC station.

title: View and location--YES!  The ROOM--ABSOLUTELY NOT!!!!
text:
Hello traveler, I hope this helps!  If the cleanliness and comfort of your room is high on your priority list, this isn't the hotel for you.  

1. I was pleased with the outside and the lobby-- both were very clean.
2. The staff was nice.  They got me checked in quickly and answered my questions.
3. I was told there was a hold of $200 and I would get $120 back. The $80 ($40 per night) that they keep is for hotel fees (wifi, discount on bikes, discount at the bar, etc).  Hotwire said the fees were going to be $60. Someone needs to update Hotwire.
4. I was given room 3712 which has an amazing view. That's all I have good to say about the room.  It's OLD, OLD, OLD.  They are at least 5 years behind needing to upgrade and thoroughly clean the rooms. The carpet is disgusting and the room was smoky. Even the tv is old. I did ask maintenance to come up to check the a/c and he came up immediately. He changed the air filter which was filthy and the room got much cooler.
5. Concierge was great! They were very helpful and always smiling.
6. The location is good for a quick hop on the subway. As well, it's feet away from the shops at oculus and the 9/11 memorial.
7. If they upgrade the rooms, I would happily patronize this hotel. Until then, I am staying away!

title: Just okay
text: Not great service and surprise added fees. If you want to reach the front desk, don't even try. They do not answer the phone. In addition, if it rains, they will tell you they ran out of umbrellas so bring your own. The service isn't great. If you want good service, stay elsewhere.

title: fabulous view/great location
text: If you're looking for a hotel that's walking distance from virtually everything you want to see in downtown New York, and close to subways to get anywhere else this is a great choice. Additionally, upper floors have absolutely fantastic views.

title: Great location
text: If you want great views then ask for a high floor, we were on floor 44.. lots in the neighbourhood, restaurants, shopping and transport links. Restaurant is still closed so only room service breakfast available, if not included in your rate then best to go out as loads of places nearby. Overall hotel is due a refresh, great tvs and beds in the room, but furniture, carpets and bathrooms all looking a bit dated .. but as you spend much of your time looking out the windows, not really an issue..

title: nice hotel, good location
text: very clean and rather spacious rooms (for new york) - as usally in new york, the higher up the better the view. the hotel is just next to all the september 11th memorial buildings and has two subway stations within a few meters what is just perfect to get around in new york

title: First time staying in Manhattan
text: When booking a reservation they should tell you about the resort fee.  They should also tell you about the charity feed that they put on your bill. I was told  when I reserved the hotel  that pool and Restaurant was open. That was not true.  The walls of paper thing I heard every movement that the people next to me made very noisy people.

title: I’ll be back for another staycation
text: I decided to stay here for my birthday with a few of my friends, and it was well worth it. I’m from the city so I just wanted a staycation from home. The views are amazing. The room was spacious, but in need of a total upgrade as the carpets were very stained, the TV had only 10 channels and a lot of static, and there wasn’t a fridge but a mini bar that nobody wanted to use.

title: Don’t stay here
text: Poorly run property. I don’t recommend. Couldn’t get linens after asking twice. Housekeeping didn’t give us coffee in the room. Room was dirty and outdated with stains on carpet and couch. Falsely advertised bar and restaurant that has been closed for years. Very pricey for what you get. Only good thing is location.

title: When?
text:
Still unbeatable in views and locations, but also still waiting for a ground improvemnet of rooms and facilitities, which now give you a feeling of times long passed.
Staff is behaving business like, you don´t feel specially welcome.

title: It was a good deal for a family and business trip
text: The 'double' beds were very small. Each looked like a large twin bed, not even a full-size bed. The room furniture seems cheap, old and clumsy. There's only one very small nightstand in between the two beds. The beds didn't have covers, and the blankets didn't smell clean.

title: Great Hotel
text: Everything was great. The main entrance was very nice and eye pleasing.  The elevators were fast. The staff was nice and friendly and the room was nice size and clean. The reason I did not give them a 5 star rating is because every time we went to the bar it was closed.

title: They Gave My Reserved Room Away
text: I reserved my room 10 months prior to my trip. I confirmed my reservation multiple times prior to my trip. The hotel and the reservation department are not talking to each other. When I arrived, I learned my room had been given away. My family was forced to cram itself in a smaller room during my stay.

title: Could Be Better
text: This is a great hotel in need of some repairs/upgrades.  While our room was basically clean the rug had burn holes and stains which really took away from the experience.  Also, there was no refrigerator and if we wanted one we would have to pay $30.00.  Since when did refrigerators become an option?  Restaurant was closed and has been for some time.

title: Dated Room With a View.
text:
The Millennium is dated downtown Manhattan high rise hotel directly across the street from Oculus, the 911 Memorial and One World Trade Center. There are beautiful view of the memorial, the Hudson River, and Jersey City, NJ. I believe some rooms have uptown Manhattan views. 
The carpets are worn, and the service is a bit “unbothered” and inconsistent. The bed was very comfortable, there is no refrigerator or microwave. The safe may or may not work. My specific issues are as follows. 
After checking into room 2903, I discovered that the safe was not working and immediately called guest services. After 24 hrs no one had responded to repair it. I had to again call and request the MOD. It was very important that I had a working safe to secure important documents. Additionally, the ceiling had air pockets all over and cracks. There were various textures of hair in the bathroom and the carpet had all sorts of small debris. There was dust throughout the room. I was moved to another room (2910) though the safe worked that evening discovered by repeatedly being awakened that the toilet flushed itself every 23 minutes.  Additionally, this room’s window was badly scratched in one section. For me this was a very stressful stay.

title: Excellent Location
text: The location is awesome. Within a block radius, you have accessibility to easily 10 subway lines, if not more. There is so much to do around the area, and you can't beat waking up to the world trade center every day.

title: The views!
text:
The good: the views, location!

The bad: no fridge in suites, restaurant, gym and pool is still closed (there’s no more pandemic), the price (I understand it’s not cheap, but we were charged +$600 more than the agreed upon price for a 6 day stay, which can’t all be service fees), the carpets and couches were a bit old and dirty, the toilet was loud at night when other rooms would flush.

title: Millennium Downtown New York
text: Excellent location and decent room size though the hotel definitely needs improvement in terms of flooring and a good paint job. The lifts are also in bad shape and need to be changed. The view from the top floors is amazing

title: Run Down and Dirty
text:
For a top dollar price this hotel leaves a lot to be designate and not a good choice. Rooms are tired and dirty. Facilities very limited. Windoes dirty and generally a run down feel.  
There are much better options to choose locally. Give this one a miss   I understand that three are plans to refurbish the rooms next year.

title: Shady pricing
text: We were offered an upgrade for one of our nights, since we had two different rooms one per each night.  Upon leaving I noticed it was about $70 more.  When I asked about it, it was lowered but still more expensive thn when booked.  Thn I noticed a facility fee for $30 one night and $35 another.  Thn I noticed a optional donation charge for $2.50 & no one even mentioned it to me.  I'm really bummed that I was charged this, wasn't helped in taking it all off and was overcharged $29.16 after questioning the charge on my card.  Beware of this place, they are not doing things right.  I am glad I asked for a receipt but not happy that they overcharged me.  You should be ashamed of your practices.

title: Thank you for Hosting
text:
Très bon hôtel, bien situé, on peut faire pas mal d'activités à pied et le personnel est Sympa. Cependant, les meubles de la chambre semblent un peu vétuste mais rien d'alarmant.
Je recommande vivement 😍

title: Do not be fooled, definitely no 4-star
text: Hotel lacks basic amenities of a 4-star, such as a fridge, restaurant, bathrobe, slippers, cultery, safe, and sometimes even water. I was asked to go to front desk to get plastic cutlery, they could not even send it to my room. Front desk told me that as restaurant was closed, they could not provide salt as per my request and I'd have to buy my own. However, the hotel has the option of ordering breakfast, and therefore has a working kitchen, which therefore should have salt... there were many other bad experiences I've had during my stay here and I really would not recommend this place to anyone. Their saving grace is the location, view, doormen and housekeeping staff.

title: Great Expereince!
text: Paid $190 in New York...Absolutely Unheard of!!  Great location, everything we needed was within walking distance.  This was our second visit to the same hotel.  DO NOT like that they do not have fridge available, but other than that, perfect stay!

title: The investors for this hotel need to renovate!
text:
Biggest draw for staying at this hotel is the location and the proximity to the 9/11 memorial, Freedom tower and high end dining. Payed over $400 to stay in the junior suite with a view of the Hudson, freedom tower and uptown Manhattan which is truly amazing at night.

With that said, the onsite parking garage has been shut down for more than 2 years, the pool is not longer available, since the hotel is not longer affiliated with Hilton hotels/Hilton Honors. The junior suite had a couch with a seat cover on it and to have a fridge in your room is a $40 upcharge. Lastly, the windows in the junior suite were stained with bird poop which took away from the incredible view.

This is my second visit to this hotel reserving the junior suite both times and the only update it noticed between my first stay on 9/2020 and most recently on 7/2/2022 was a bed light with usb charge ports.

I will not return until the building owners modernize the rooms to match their competition.

title: Hotel Stay
text: Great location right across from the Oculus, and we had a nice view.  It's also close to public transportation.  However, our room was dated and our air conditioning did not work well..  We stayed 2 nights, and didn't try the restaurant or other facilitiies.

title: Great views, but badly in need of a reno
text:
We've stayed here on numerous occasions because of the great location and the views. Our most recent stay was our first visit since the pandemic and unfortunately it was a little disappointing. The rooms are not just tired, they're exhausted. 

They charge you $30/night + tax for a resort fee, yet the amenities are non-existent. Pool closed. Restaurant closed. Fitness centre was okay, but hardly worth the additional daily fee. And what's up with the boarded up mini-fridge? No bottled water our first night for the coffee machine. We were told we could order room service (breakfast only), but no menu or info in the room about how to do so until the second day of our stay. 

HVAC was exceptionally noisy; poor air circulation. 

This place used to be nice when it was a Hilton, but it's rapidly falling apart. Also why the misspelling of Millennium above the front desk? Weird.

Anyway the views and the location (right across the Oculus/PATH and easy access to subway) are great especially if you don't plan on spending a lot of time in your room. But if you're looking for a luxe hotel experience, this is not the place for you.

title: Great staff, but run down hotel
text: The staff here was fast and attentive but our room was in desperate need of repairs. The bathtub didn’t drain, the headboard lamps didn’t work, there was only ONE working plug we could access in the entire room, making charging phones difficult. The carpet was sticky and the refrigerator was boarded up. You can’t beat the location or views but the hotel really needs updating and repairs.

title: The rooms were horrible
text:
The room was Very dirty, we originally ordered a Junior Suite which was Filthy, then we upgraded to a full suite that was better.  This hotel needs a complete overhaul.  There front desk tried her best to satisfy us.
The bellman were also good and tried to help.  We travel a lot and would never recommend this hotel to a friend.

title: Great views, disappointing experience.
text: We’ve stayed in several NYC Hilton hotels, this one was very disappointing. The location is great for downtown sightseeing (WTC, Financial District) and a short walk to Tribeca, SoHo, etc. the rooms were very rundown (our group had 3). The linens smelled like wet dog or molded. The view from our room was breathtaking. Every other Hilton we’ve stayed in NYC was fresh and very clean.

title: Great location and Hotel.
text: Furniture and meubles are a little bit too old.  But bed was okay.  Pool was not open. Breakfast Buffet has changed to an in room Service, but with higher prices.  Rooms are very clean and good daily cleaning Service available.

title: Not great
text: Old rooms, out of date, stains on the floor. The rooms on the lower floors smelled and then had to pay more to upgrade to a room that didn’t have a smell. Totally out of date, had 1 body wash in the bathroom for 2 people. Scratchy towels. There are better hotels to stay at in a similar price range when you factor in the upgrade.

title: Only Good For the Views
text: This hotel does not deliver. The customer service was non-existent to the point of not have a way to contact housekeeping, room service, or the front desk from the phone in the room. The room was shabby and unkempt appearing with broken furniture, peeling wall paper, and low grade sheets/towels. In addition, there were too few towels and when we were able to get through to someone to ask for more after having to go through a call center to get through to the front desk, no towels were received. The view of Oculus and One WTC was amazing though. I really wish they delivered on the luxury experience the name suggests. I stayed here in the past year before the breakup with Hilton and while the rooms were still dated, the service was far superior so I stupidly chose to rebook thinking I would get something similar. I was wrong.

title: Masood
text: every thing good good experience in your staff Carole is the best and help full always take care i thanks for every think which Carole did in whole all experience id good since six years we rent your meeting room

title: Disappointing
text: While the staff was nice and helpful, I was mainly disappointed by the rooms. They felt dirty and very outdated. The carpet looked very dirty and the room just wasn’t very nice. For what was labeled as a four star hotel, I would say it definitely is not.

title: Prepare for extra cost beyond the room charges
text: We booked hotel for 2 rooms 2 nights at fairly high price due to last minute changes. After we checked out i saw $160.68 extra charge on my card for two rooms on top of the price i payed for booking. I called the hotel and they said it was housekeeping fee of $40 per night per room for cleaning the room. In other hotels i stayed this is always included in the room fee but they charged extra just for cleaning the room (making the bed and vacuum nothing else).

title: Amazing location, room and views! Worth every penny!
text:
The hotel is amazing. In the heart of the financial district and right in front of the WTC. Great connection with the local transport (WTC Cortlandt/Oculus). The room was amazing as well. We had a city view corner room on the 49th floor. The views were spectacular and jaw-dropping, day and night! Plus, the hotel lobby smells amazing!  Special shoutout to the staff that helped us move our whole stay a day later free of charge! We had some issues with our flights and they decided to move our stay from Sun-Fri to Mon-Sat!
I would like to have a clearer image of the charges.  The security deposit of USD 50 per night is not per room but per person, that's something that wasn't clear from the beginning.

title: Don't even bother
text: If you want to stay in a dirty hotel where they just want your money, this place is for you. Dirty rooms, stained carpet and furniture. Walls so think I could hear everything- just imagine. :( SO many other options you can choose in that location so pick them over this place. I wish I knew before I came. The only nice part was the bell man and the maintenance worker who came to fix the broken lights and phone. Such a sad place and easily fooled. The lobby and outside look nice but that's it.

title: Excellent place to stay
text: We stayed for 2 nights and overall our experience was excellent from the staff to the location.  Views were amazing. The only downfall would be that the hotel could use to update the rooms, but definitely would stay here again

In the heart of New York. Waking up to the WTC view every day was a dream come true. Well besides running into a celebrity while we were there. My 6 years old girls were FaceTiming with family members to show off the room.

You live everyday, you die once sp 
What are you waiting for book it!!

title: Amazing experience yet again
text: The millennium downtown is a wonderful hotel to stay in the room is comfortable with splendid views. The staff is very friendly and very helpful. The location was great overlooking the Oculus and Ground Zero.

title: Overall good
text: Co-ordination within the staff could have been better as there was some confusion in breakfast included in the deal and again getting charged. Overall experience was good. Staff could have been more polite, specifically the ones who are in pantries for taking breakfast requests.

title: Great View
text: The location, price and the view were amazing , however the room was very outdated , the carpeting was dirty , the shower vent had lint and dirt all over , there were stains on the shower curtain, also I wish I had known ahead of time the parking lot was under construction.

title: Go for location not the room
text: Location was great right across from Oculus. The room was gross. Needs new furniture, linens and severe cleaning. Definitely needs new carpet and new mattresses. Restaurant was closed. Everything is offsite.

title: Great location, but Not really Hilton quality.
text:
The room needs an update.  No mini fridge or restaurant or room service options.  Really you can stay at a budget boutique hotel nearby and have same experience.  They do have a lobby bar open until 10pm.
The room size was a bit larger than the budget rooms in neighborhood, but otherwise, the amenities did not warrant double price from four points

title: Motel 8 in Downtown Manhattan
text: This hotel was downright disgusting. The quality of the room felt like the motel 8. I will never ever ever stay here ever again. I do not recommend anyone stay here unless you enjoy nightmares and dreary rooms.

title: Stay literally anywhere else
text: Black mold in bathroom, cracks in cieling, wallpaper peeling up. The decor hasn't been changed since the 1980s and it smells like it too. Will take $265 to reserve room, then charge another $265 for the actual room reservation. You might see the initial $265 in a week after they reverse the payment when you check in but we will see... $12 for a bowl of cereal. Stiff box mattress to sleep on and chewed gum embedded in the carpet. Do yourself a favor and stay literally anywhere else.

title: Convenient location
text: Convenient location. Our early check in request was granted. Prompt checking and checkout. Turn over service everyday. Generally clean. However, the toilet makes loud noise and can hear people walking in the hallway.

title: Active black mold in the bathroom
text:
Sanitization of all areas of the room is imperative and it has not been done for a while. At that price, I expected better. I am very disappointed. 

The black mold activated my allergies thus impacting my sleep quality.

title: Less then expected
text: We had a different expectation when we booked this hotel. When we arrived things looked a lot different, rooms were outdated, minibar was hammered out and the restaurant was closed leaving only in room breakfast as an opportunity.

title: Never again
text: My Room was run down, dirty and smelled. Shame on the Millenium. Lack of security shocking. And charged a premium price. Clean and upgrade your rooms. Will not stay here again and would tell others not to.

title: Disappointed
text: Stayed here before when affiliated with Hilton.  Made reservations 11/21 through Hilton.  Rates charged at end of stay higher than originals quoted.  4 rooms.  Condoms and breadcrumbs when foldout bed opened to put the kids to sleep.  No safe or refrigerator in our room.  Dirty bathtub on arrival - we cleaned it ourselves and showered only.  Talked to the manager - never heard back.

title: June business trip
text: Hotel has a great location and a good reputation that is quickly going to fade. The entire facility is in sore need of a remodel. Elevator service was highly unreliable, room had burned out light bulbs and leaky faucets.

title: Needs to be renovated
text: Location is great but the rooms are sub-par. Plumbing is very loud (wake up when showers are on in adjacent rooms). Doors slam closed loudly. Sheets, mattress and towels are not great. No mini-fridge.

title: Great location and staff but outdated
text: Hotel is in a great location close to everything in lower Manhattan, but the rooms are completely outdated and furniture is dingy.  When it had been purchased by another company I would have assumed they would renovate as the décor is stuck in the 1990s.  The staff is friendly and the rooms are affordable so would stay here again, but need to update at a bare minimum the room furniture.

title: Excellence stay
text: The place is very clean and amazing! Location is at prime with train services nearby. Dine in food options are multiple to pick from. Staff is very friendly and active. YOU CAN NOT PASS ON THIS VIEWWW!

title: Excellent location and staff
text: That was really good experience in my life my room was really really good which is right ahead of freedom tower. And also writing 200 characters I felt too much right now.😀  I guess Parkin at this hotel under construction, I hope they open for customer park soon.

title: Needs improvement
text: Very average rooms with poor cleanliness and no amenities whatsoever. Unresponsive staff. Definitely needs to improve standards. The mirror was not clean, everything covered with a thin layer of dust. The phone did not have any labels so no way to contact any desk except maybe guessing.

title: Room needs maintenance
text: Great location and views. Room furnishings need to be completely updated and better cleaning protocols need to be instituted. Hair was left in bathroom, carpet was stained in multiple spots and the wallpaper (particularly the seams) were stained.

title: Lack of care and respect of time
text: I have Covid and they chose not to change or credit my reservation, instead they had me play the phone game where they’d say. Call the supervisor Matt, when you call Matt the next day and he’s all of a sudden not there. So much for being a gold member and so much for caring for their clients, I didn’t even want a refund all I wanted was to move the dates. I’m shorts, they don’t respect my time and send me on a journey with no end.

title: Fabulous Value, Luxury and Location
text: This hotel provides fabulous value for an NYC vacation. Their suites (especially on the higher floors) are strongly recommended for families. Fabulous views and ample space in a prime location are offered for tremendous $ value if you book ahead. You are in a prime location vis a vis ability to get around using the subway, close to beautiful parks and great walks along the Hudson, not to mention right across the street from the Freedom Tower and 9/11 museum. Good food all within walking distance and for the weary Delivero or other services are an excellent alternative.

title: Pleasant stay !
text: We booked for the suite with city view and that was great ! Good hotel, perfect location ! The staff is very helpful. Enough staff at the desk, no long lines. Quick check in / check out. Next time I’ll book this hotel again !

title: Great location, dirty rooms
text: I don’t usually leave reviews but I had high hopes for this hotel and was a bit disappointed. This was my first trip to NY and had no idea where to stay. I found this place online and it seemed like a great location; close to all the attractions I was interested in going to. I also wanted a hotel with great city views and many of the competitors lacked in that area so I decided to go with the Millennium.  The biggest pros for me were the location and friendly staff. However, a major con was the cleanliness of our room. We stayed on the 30th floor, which offers great city views, but our rooms cleanliness was extremely disappointing; especially since we’re in the midst of a global pandemic. Upon arrival, the first things I noticed were stains on our bath towels, the sheets, heavy/built up dust on the carpet alongside the baseboards, and mold in the sink. There were also some cosmetic issues like cracks in the ceiling and peeling wallpaper. Furthermore, the TV had very few channels available and the picture was unclear/snowy making it near impossible to watch the channels that were available.  I’m really not sure if I would recommend this location to anyone else simply due to the cleanliness which is unfortunate because the location is ideal.

title: Vecchio
text:
Sto scrivendo dall'Hotel,in genere non scrivo recensioni,ma in questo caso si perché mi sono sentito preso in giro.
La posizione dell'Hotel é l'unica cosa positiva,l'arredamento é vecchio e usurato,e per quello che costa trovi di molto meglio a Times Square!
Un'altra cosa negativa é la colazione,ho prenotato un pacchetto comprensivo di colazione,poi il primo giorno scopro che la colazione arriva dall'esterno e che puoi ordinarla solo al mattino.
Il primo giorno abbiamo ordinato la colazione alle 08.00 e alle 09.00 doveva ancora arrivare,abbiamo rinunciato anche negli altri giorni.
Sul sito questo servizio non viene spiegato adeguatamente.
State attenti,le foto di un noto sito per prenotazioni ingannano.

title: Avoid Find Somewhere Else, Disappointed and Let Down
text: Find another location. I checked in and immediately noticed that there was a stain on the couch. Whether if was blood, chocolate, or jelly, not sure, but I shouldn't have to speculate.  The room seemed like it had a party in it, and the cleaning had not been done. Reported, but not cleaned by hotel, so we cleaned it ourselves. There were stains, as if someone sprayed coffee or soda above the door to the bedroom, there were water stains on inner and outer curtains, and a broken light socket for the bathroom. All reported during our stay, and utter lack of responsiveness.  Called to front desk, no answer. Asked for hotel manager to come up to personally inspect. No hotel manager. Later, housekeeping manager came up and she said that she was appalled.

title: Pessimo
text:
Hotel molto datato, arredamento vecchio e rovinato, molto lontano dallo standard di un 4 stelle. Appena siamo arrivati ci hanno addebitato la camera due volte perché non si erano resi conto che era già stata pagata e dovremo aspettare due settimane per il rimborso, non si sono nemmeno scusati.  La persona alla quale chiedavamo la colazione la mattina é sempre stata estremamente scortese, solo per fare un esempio, gli abbiamo chiesto se era possibile avere un frutto e ci é stato risposto di no senza spiegazioni. 
L'unica cosa bella é la visuale e la posizione molto comoda.

title: Room with a view. Room 5302
text: 4th time in NY this has been our fave hotel. It did not disappoint at all. Everything we ever wanted. Sharlene Narvaez helped us out massively celebrating our 25th anniversary, went above and beyond. Thankyou for such a memorial stay. The views were incredible, perfect location. Highly recommend this stunning hotel. Staff all friendly and helpful, nothing was to much trouble. Very welcoming. Best hotel we’ve stayed in NY.

title: A great view hotel but not restaurant
text: Really if I tell you the truth, this hotel need a upgrade and open the restaurant but the staff are nice especially Oscar at the front desk, he was the best experience, sorry I didn’t lied , the hotel need to be updated

title: Dated and dirty. Not worth the money.
text: When we arrived to the room, the condition was horrible.  The carpet was filthy and had not been vacuumed, a layer of dust was on every surface, the sofa was missing and the sofa cushions were laying on the window seals (I have pictures if needed).  We immediately called the front desk but did not get an answer.  We then went downstairs and informed the front and asked them to come and look at the state of the room.  She declined and said that she will inform inform the housekeeping manager.  We were then switched to another room.  The new room left something to be desired. Definitely not worth the money or the 4-5 star rating.  It appeared overall dated and unkept.  There were stains and buckling throughout the carpet in the entire suite.  There were stains on the sofa; we would not sit on it.  The refrigerator in the room had mold on the inside.  As far as amenities, the bar was advertised but was only actually open one night.  There was no convenience of getting sodas or snacks from the hotel; had to walk to the nearest store.  We paid $1,600 for three nights and this was definitely a disappointment.  Not worth it with all the issues and dinginess.

title: Millennium Downdown NY
text: Super location and beautiful view, depending on which room you get. When you check in you get the feeling the hotel is top modern as the lobby has been nicely renovated. However, when you are in the corridors/rooms afterwards, you realize that the hotel is in need of renovation (old room furniture, carpets, bathrooms etc.). For me, the price/quality ratio is low. For someone who only wants a good location/view, it is certainly good. The check-in without extra charge only from 4pm is equally weak!

title: Hidden Service Fee
text:
Add 35 to room rate for a hidden service fee that I was charged from the credit card hold.  I had prepaid room and the fee was not listed on the bill that I paid.  I was not told about service fee at checkin or checkout and only received when hold against my card came back 120 light.  Beds are bad, walls are thin, and lobby smells funny. Restaurant is closed.  Pretty disappointing especially since i had to pay a mystery 35 dollar facility fee.

Also no hot water night of my arrival and false fire alarm at 2 AM.

Lots of choices around..I would not choose this one.

title: Not well maintained
text: Room was dirty and had not been dusted in months. Carpets are gross. Lighting in the room was horrible and made it feel even more dirty. Good location and the room was spacious compared to most city hotel rooms. All in all, find somewhere else

title: Room issues
text: Windows were cloudy from the outside. Glue or some adhesive streaks on the outside of the windows. Clock and phones weren’t working. Stains in the carpet. Air conditioning didn’t cool room During the day while shades were open. Very dissatisfied for a 2night/$1,200 stay

title: Do NOT stay here - old and tired - staff don’t care
text: Old and tired property. Room wasn’t cleaned on second day. Awful smell of cannabis on first two days penetrated right into our room. Fire alarm went off in the night. And squeaking pipework kept us awake and woke us up.

title: Great Hotel
text:
Very good location (directly in front of Occulus)
Subway very close
Clean rooms
My room had a great view
Reasonable price
Nice staff
Good Wifi
Comfortable beds
Nothing to complain about
Would book again

title: Fantastic
text: Everything was really great. Room was huge and comfortable. View was amazing. Just in front of Liberty Tower and close to many subway lines which allows you to reach easily every part of Manathan. Highly recommend

title: Too Many Problems in a Stay
text:
We checked in and problems started during arrival.
1 Bellman in the Check-in broke my luggage throwing the bag in the wheel cart. Hotel manager and diretor took long time sayimg it was not his fault even having the bag travelling overseas for 2 days and going through multiple airlines,  ubers, etc... without issues. Manager indicated it was not an issue with bellman even when cameras proof the bag broke on his hands throwing it. 
2 we requested two wine glasses and hotel was unable to provide it, they dont have but have a big bar close to help desk.
3 have to call front desk inumerous times for same request, they don't act.
4 at the end to complete bellman was unhappy and rude because after all, I was not going to give a tip. Stay was full of mistakes.
Services is ridiculous, hotel is good, location is awesome. Management team is low performing as all these issues would be resolved by a good leadership.
Ahh one last thing, rooms have no refrigerator, even the big ones, quite awkward.

title: Emplacement exceptionnel à bon prix
text:
Excellent emplacement pour la visite du Sud de Manhattan (A pied : 15 minutes de Battery Park, 5 minutes de Brooklyn Bridge et 2 minutes du Ground Zero et du métro).
Les chambres sont un peu vieillissantes et avec un mobilier classique et fonctionnel. Petit déjeuner bien garni – mais énorme gaspillage en sucre, crème à café, ketchup, etc - et livré en chambre sans supplément ni retard (pas de salle ouverte en avril 2022).
Lit double passablement en cuvette et matelas très mou.
Bon réseau Wifi et personnel serviable. 
PS : nous étions 6 et avions 2 chambres

title: Perfecta
text: La ubicaciones son Perfecto, las habitaciones son muy limpias el servicio al cuarto muy decente, ojo las habitaciones no contienen ni nevera y microondas para calentar comida pero todo lo demás perfecto

title: Location is great but dirty Hotel environment. Couldn't be in this position if it's still been managed by Hilton.
text: Hotel needs complete overhaul by a new management AND my observation is they are highly understaffed. Calls take a long time to be answered, call for bell boy, no-one will show up. Just one staff at front desk.

title: Great location, overall ok stay
text:
Great location. Turn off when we saw a old soap with hair on it!. Rooms was ok overall.
Forgot my haircurler in the room: no one report it and security wasn't able to help me to get it back!
Really disappointing

title: Place is ok
text: Hotel is ok I guess I got what I paid for almost $120 a night. Carpet was dirty couch looked old and worn out. View was nice. It was a junior suite. I hate the fact there was no microwave. I was told that I could rent a microwave for $30.. that should be included in the room

title: Great place
text: I would stay here again. Great location and ambiance and great service. The price was better than much other places I compared. The view from my room was outstanding I stayed on the 14th floor and friends of mine stayed on the 28th floor and I promise you my view was more extravagant.

title: Fantastic Hotel in an amazing location.
text:
This is the 3rd time I’ve visited NYC and this is the hotel I would choose again. Location is fantastic, steps away from multiple subways, not the hustle and bustle of Time Square. 

The room was great, we stayed in a King bed room, lovely big bed! Amazing views. The room was dated but not untidy, the bathroom was large. There was no fridge in the room but as someone from the U.K. this isn’t something I automatically expect anyway so it wasn’t an issue. 

We found the tv had lots of channels and easy to navigate using the + and - channel button instead of the guide button. 

The doormen and staff were lovely and the foyer smells amazing!

Although we were dubious at first due to negative reviews we had an amazing time and preferred this hotel to a more costly one we stayed in in Boston. 

You won’t be disappointed (unless you need a fridge)

title: Nice 25 years ago
text: The location of this hotel is great but the actual hotel and rooms are not. The rooms are antiquated and falling apart and dirty! The technology in the rooms is old and not properly working. No extensive TV options or modernization. The bathroom was dirty with chipped tile, stains, etc.

title: Gross!!
text: I wish I was able to post the video but the staff did not throughly clean the room prior to our stay. The refrigerator had leftover items from the previous person, it also did not work and was quite dirty. The bedding had stains and it feels like you are sleeping on a box. I had stayed at the Millennium in Bost quite a few times which was never disappointing so I thought the brand would live up to the expectations. Complete failure.

title: Great location and room
text: My son and I spent 4 days here and had a junior king suite on the 24th floor. Everything about the room was perfect, except for the sofa bed. It was worn down and not very comfortable. We would stay here again if the sofa bed was upgraded.

title: Dated, but still great
text: Booked this while it was still a Hilton, so I was a bit sceptical. Yes, the rooms are in need of a renovation. But everything was clean and in good working condition. And the location and views could not have been better - both make for a fantastic stay!

title: Outstanding experience.
text:
Great hotel with fabulous view and location . Daily cleaning service . All requests were resolved immediately . Lots of restaurants and shops around. Great public transport.
Hotel definitely needs a deep cleaning and renovation  but then could be easily 5star . 
We stay in suit and size is fantastic especially for family. 
Only minus I was a not nice conversation with a door man. He gave me a lecture how tipping works in this hotel … that I should tip everyone ( door man , concierge ) not only him as he needs to divide his tip to the rest if the crew . I think it was totally improper.

title: Has all the basics, but it’s dated
text:
Our room had an incredible view of the WTC. Service was prompt. Room was spacious and comfortable. The bed was comfortable though the pillows weren’t the best.

The only complaint I have is that everything was very very old. You could smell the dust and mustiness everywhere and my allergies kicked up. They haven’t upgraded the rooms in a long time.

title: New York
text: Very a nice location, the view of the room was amazing directly front of the WTC. Disappointed with the room, because too old, and the bathroom too, and the cleanliness to be review. Disappointed with no possibiliy to access of the swimming pool, and the breakfast on room….( restriction for Covid…..) It’s strange, because we stay in Boston for 6 days before New York, and the pool was open and the breakfast was not on room. We are Disappointed because the price should have been, not the same as we pay, because of this 2 points. If we had the opportunity to know that before, we arrived in New York, we would have chosen an other hotel with the swimming pool.

title: College Graduation Trip
text: There was about 20 of us that stayed at the hotel for my son's college graduation week of activities.  Frances and the entire team there did a fantastic job ensuring that the rooms were well cleaned and the experience was great.  We had a wonderful room and views to die for.  Would have loved for the amenities like the bar and eating areas to be a bit more open and useable, but there is plenty around the hotel to make up for that.

title: Good location but hotel is definitely showing its age, and not aging well
text: The junior suite (3002) could have been nice but was so worn, and the furniture and carpet stained, the windows were filthy. The lights were not all working, the tv reception was sketchy, the water pressure was low. The AC wasn’t cooling properly. The wifi was good though!

title: Excellent vibes
text: This is definitely a location I would visit again. The room was amazing and the view was crazy. The staff was very tentative towards every guest. The biggest thing is if you arrive early, the hotel will store your bags

title: amazing hotel, views were spectacular
text: we got.upgraded to a beautiful room with amazing views amd staff were great to deal with, if we come back to manhatten we will defo be staying here again, the location was perfect and very accessible to most subway lines

title: Millennium downtown NYC
text: Average hotel with average amenities. No complaints, but nothing exceptional. 10 min walk to Brooklyn Bridge and directly across the street from The Oculus and 911 Memorial.  A bit out of the way from other NYC tourist attractions

title: Outdated, Understaffed, Only Location Matters
text:
Booked 10 days for my parents to visit & celebrate my graduation. Hotel is in great location and that is truly all you get (and if you’re high enough, a good view).

However, if you want your room to be anything but mediocre, stay somewhere else. Furniture, rugs, finishes are all outdated and damaged.

On my graduation day, housekeeping did NOT show up until after 3pm — called Concierge and Lobby twice to get someone to clean up prior to getting ready. No one showed up.

Things to note:
- No mini fridge (if you want one, it’s $35/stay and based on availability)
- Arriving prior to your check in? Early check in costs $75
- Housekeeping was never consistent with coffee/tea replenishment (sometimes you got cups, sometimes you didn’t)

If you want to pay $300+ for nothing else than a view and access to subway, then this is the place for you. Otherwise seek elsewhere.

title: Time for a refresh
text:
We have stayed at the Millennium a number of times and admittedly when it was a Hilton property.  This recent transaction from Hilton to Downtown appears to be problematic.  Our check in was chaotic at best and took over 30 minutes.  The rooms need a refresh and maid service was non-existent.  The TV remote did not even work and the refrigerators were sealed and unusable.  We were not given enough toiletries for 1 night let alone the 4 nights we stay and we were only provided 1 set of glasses for use in the bathroom and to drink etc.

We were disappointed as there were several problems with our stay and we very likely will not stay here again in the future - unless the service greatly improves and basic amenities (tv remote, toiletries, glassware) are provided in the room without asking for.

title: Location, location , location
text:
Possibly the best location in Manhattan, subways on every corner and the WTC directly opposite. A welcome relief from the madness of Times Square.

Positives -

Easily accessible for all of NYC
WTC opposite 
Nice laid back area with plenty of shops 
Mgt reacted quickly when i complained about other rooms smoking weed

Negatives - 

Very dated hotel
Beds uncomfortable 

Overall rating 8.2

title: Vista hermosa
text: Excelente ubicación, estación del tren muy cerca, habitación cómoda y limpia. Las almohadas no eran muy cómodas. Muchas opciones de comida cerca. La habitación no tenía nevera. La habitación tiene una vista hermosa.

title: Stay ANYWHERE else
text:
Where do I begin? Might as well start at check in... We arrived a little under an hour early, so technically our check in wasn't delayed, but it still took 30-40 minutes. Somehow the hotel had zero record of our reservation despite my confirmation email and a reminder email from early that same day. In an arrogant tone I was told multiple times that sometimes when people book "third party" reservations get lost. I did not book third party... And even if someone does, how does that matter!? Anyway, they asked to show my phone to the manager who couldn't be bothered to come out from behind the door like they were some kind of weird Deal or No Deal banker. I got my phone back and found they clearly thought I was full of it because new windows had been opened and they had gone through other emails. From there I was asked to forward my confirmation email to them which didn't work, so I was asked to send it to another email. Finally, though they never found my reservation (I'll come back to this at the end) they created a new reservation for me for the same room type. 

When we got upstairs the room was not at all what I had expected. I stayed here with my wife in 2015 and it was in much better condition. The carpets were tattered, there were used q-tips and floss on the floor outside our door, the windows were filthy, and what used to be a refrigerator cabinet was nailed shut. This was a "junior suite," which I would think we have a mini-fridge, though to be honest a fridge is pretty standard in most hotels today regardless of room type and was when I stayed here before when it was a Hilton. Pretty sure this place hasn't been updated since it got pelted with debris on 9/11. 

We didn't spend much time here for the remainder of our stay thankfully. Though I might as well throw this in, the TV barely worked, and the coffee maker had no cups, not that I'd have used it anyway. On check out day I dropped my room cards off and was met with a bill that was nearly double what my initial reservation was. Come to find it was the total of the room plus an additional "hold" that would change now that we had checked out. Weird. Regardless, the total room amount, excluding the hold was still wrong. I brought this up to the front desk host who was the only nice person I encountered here. She couldn't figure out why and quickly grabbed the wizard of Oz, er, sorry, manager whom actually came out from behind door. The manager of course tried the third party booking excuse with me and was admittedly surprised to hear I had booked through his hotels website. From here he tried to explain that the reason my total was so much more was because I still had to be local fees. He actually said to me "if I show you that on our website will you believe me then?" No. No I won't, and he didn't. The issue is that said fees were already included in my initial booking. Hence the part at booking that says total + taxes/fees. When I asked him what those initial taxes and fees at booking were he could not answer me. If you don't know what those taxes/fees are then HOW can you know that I need to pay additional ones and what they are? Eventually he did "waive" those fees. The next day I went through the booking process without submitting just to see what was included  at booking and you wouldn't believe it, but the fees he claimed I still had to pay were INCLUDED already. Weird. Anyone else hear of a hotel that charges more than you agreed to at booking as standard operation? No? Me neither. This place is a joke. So much so that the lobby and exterior of the hotel have their OWN NAME SPELLED INCORRECTLY. Hysterical. 

Anyway, long story long, go somewhere else. Anywhere else.

title: Ok
text: Clean, nice views, staff was good- extra charges not identified when you make reservation.  Charged a $30/day facility fee which I do t u derstand what it was even for.  And a $100/day security fee which is redeemed upon check out.

title: Dirty, outdated hotel overlooking ground zero
text: Great location and views of the river and west side, hotel is old and badly kept, security is non existent. Amenities are very limited. Reception had 1 person at check in. Room phone was disconnected. Water leaks all over walls and curtains, warn out furniture and filthy carpets. Water pressure was good though no shower head. Towels were clean. Pillows and bedding was clean, no extra blanket in room. Windows were not cleaned for ages and dust is all over surfaces.

title: Highly recommend
text: My wife and me visited for the first time New York. Millennium downtown was a perfect place to stay in the heart of the financial district. Very clean and confortable room , very attentive Staff  , unfortunately the restaurant was still closed because COVID restrictions but  the bar was available in the lobby and breakfast available for the room service. Definitely we will be back

title: The Best place in downtown NYC
text:
The front desk staff is Amazing & make it a wonderful experiance.
Millenium location is Fanastic, with great eateries in the area. 
Right acroos the street from the Occulus. 
WTC Memorial , & Wall street in walking distance .

title: Good hotel great location
text: good hotel  at a great location. The hore good use a renovation.  Many things effective by the Covid situation including the breakfast on the room that was oke.  the hotel is not perfect but I would still recommend it.

title: Dated and dirty
text: Don’t be fooled by the photos. This hotel hasn’t been updated in 30 years. Dirty place. Restaraunt and bar still closed down. Great location for WTC office buildings. Rooms have zero amenities. Will not stay here again unless the building is gutted and remodeled.

title: Great Location, Awful Rooms
