text: I've stayed at this hotel multiple times and never had a bad experience before. So we figure the hotel is in a great location with a great view of the Twin Tower memorial. So I booked it again for my wife's birthday weekend getaway. It was a big mistake! There were holes on curtains, the TV didn't work, the bathroom was leaking water and smelled bad. I had been traveling all day so I didn't want to make a complaint about it, I just needed to laydown for after traveling 8 hours to get there.

title: Very Nice! Great View!
text:
Very pleasant stay! Room was larger than most NYC rooms - very clean, comfortable & an amazing view!

The service was excellent - Front Desk staff was so helpful and extra towels were delivered promptly.

Location was perfect!

Would most definitely return!

title: La mejor ubicación. Sin dudas volvería
text:
La ubicación es inmejorable, a los pies del Oculus/One World y tenés casi todas las líneas de subte a pasitos. Muy práctico. 
La habitación con vista al One World, increíble. Tiene cafetera, aire acondicionado, muy amplia y cómoda. No tiene heladera, microondas, ni secador de pelo. 
La atención es muy buena. 
Ofrecen agua embotellada gratuita, llegamos antes del horario y pudimos ingresar sin cobro extra.

title: Mr&Mrs Trip
text: Facilities due renovation and leaving the name Hilton not available. They gave us free breakfast for the week👍👌Staff was attentive in assisting needs etc. Location great and enough restaurants around

title: May 2022 Business Stay
text: I enjoyed my stay for the most part; but I unfortunately would not equate this to a 4-star hotel and likely will not return. A couple areas of opportunity: Towels are VERY rough, in-room AC unit very dirty, TV screen/picture was very low quality/"blurry", housekeeping did not remove the trash from IRD breakfast, room did not have any coffee cups and poor quality iron ruined one of clothing.

title: Don't believe the pictures you see online, look elsewhere!
text: I got a rash from the pillows and the sheets. For 24 hours the bedding wasnt changed and then at midnight I finally got a new room. It was really frustrating and beyond what you expect from a 4 star hotel. The room also didnt have a phone. We werent told that we would have to pay extra for basic amenities like a mini fridge. Both rooms we were in also had a strong cigarette smell and the ventilation wasnt helpful. I will not be coming back here and for a 4 star hotel it was the worst one I've seen in terms of cleanliness, maintenance, decor, amenities, and staff availability.

title: Great Visit
text:
I’ve wanted to visit this hotel for a very long time, 
We have just got home from our first Trip to New York which we got Married during our Trip, We  stayed at The Millennium Downtown.
On arrival on the 11th May we got checked in quickly by the reception staff who were really friendly and welcoming. We made our way up to the 49th floor Room 4912 and entered our Room....... we were not ready for the amazing views, we could see So much, the room was clean and tidy.
We met one of the cleaners a couple of times and was nice to see her smiling And was very polite.
Room cleaned everyday and beds made which was nice at the end of a busy day.

Subway station at the front of the hotel with easy connections to go uptown and Brooklyn
 Staten Island ferry near by 
NYC Ferry 5 minute all away 
Plenty of shops and food places available 

We also found the financial District and around the hotel to feel really safe At night, and very quiet during the night unlike Times Square which is constantly busy and car horns beeping.

My only Negative Feed back would be that the pool And the restaurant Are closed which Im  hoping is just down To Covid and will re open soon. 

The hotel corridors and rooms are very dated and really need a refurbishment Especially the carpets and wallpaper, with New buildings and other competitive hotels Opening in the same area the hotel needs to upgrade Really soon.

For me though the views and the comfortable beds made up for this.

You will need to put down a $100 dollar security deposit for per night which is a bit much, we used our credit card and stayed 4 nights, we are waiting for our deposit to be returned. Hopefully it won’t take to long.

title: Great Stay
text: Perfekt Location, amazing view, furniture are old but that was known for a 22 year old Hotel, they can be replaced, cleaned daily, staff polite and helpful- Great stay for us at a Junior Suite :-) book this Hotel anytime again

title: Amazing hotel/ great view
text: We stayed on the 40th floor and the view to our room was amazing! The hotel was very clean and the staff were very nice. I’m definitely coming back within a few weeks!! I would recommend this hotel to anyone

title: Not at all what I expected from a 4 star property…
text:
My partner and I stayed at the Millenium downtown for a short trip, just the two of us. We’d checked out a lot of hotels before choosing this one, and upon arrival we’re dismayed by what awaited us. The lobby of the property is nice and welcoming, however, the check in process was the first of many issues during our stay. Staff was rude and uninformed, didn’t explain any of the closures throughout the hotel, any amenities, or offer any help. 

Once we got to the room, the power was defective, so our AC didn’t work. A utility person came to the room and tried to resolve the problem by telling to use the power button. What?? We had obviously attempted that and it wasn’t until he tried the buttons that he realized the entire power to the unit was nonoperational and we would have to change rooms. In our new room, the unit would only cool to 70F, which left my partner and I very hot and uncomfortable for the duration of our stay. 

There was no fridge or safe in the room and the TV was quite literally from 2004. We looked up the model online and we’re astonished by that fact and the quality of the cable provided. The TV also buzzed loudly the entire time it was on. Whenever we wanted to call the front desk, we had to use our cell phones since our first room didn't contain a phone at all and the second had no buttons that worked!

Many services were offline, (restaurant and bar), or unavailable, (vending machine), that seem like very basic hotel amenities. The floors of the room were very dirty, and all the furniture and fixtures appeared as old as the television. The handle of the bathroom door had fallen off and constantly rattled. And finally, a very large group of young adults, (thirty or more), were staying on our floor, smoking marijuana so much that our room stank for two days after. One night, they loitered near to elevators, yelling, laughing, and playing music past 1am in the hallways. We had to call down to security twice before anything was done about it. Overall, VERY unhappy with the stay, do not stay here if you’re looking to relax!

title: Only the view it worth the price
text: I truly expected better quality of room for the price I paid per night, the TV, coffee maker, and locks on door didn’t work. I’m guessing I would have needed to pay more just to be able to have a microwave and mini fridge

title: Perfect Situation
text: This property is in the perfect place!  Direct access to the subway station.  The views are astonishing. The only issue was that due to some circumstance, the bar and parking garage were closed. There are no microwaves in the rooms...they cost extra.  There is no refrigerator in the room so make sure you have no left overs or no need for refrigeration. The tv stations are fuzzy except a few channels. Our bed broke.  The rooms need to be upgraded.  There were lights and switches in the room that didn't work! Overall,  the hotel was beautiful and served it's purpose!  I felt safe, saw no bugs or wild animals! I would stay again!!

title: Awesome Location - Old and Dirty hotel
text: First, this hotel is in an awesome location. Our room looked over Oculus and One World. The views were breathtaking. However, the room is disgusting. Do not let the pictures deceive you. This hotel is very old and in need of a deep clean. The carpets look original. There are stains on the carpet and sofa. Dust everywhere. My daughter got pink eye while we were in New York so I stripped the beds so we could get new sheets and they put the same dirty sheets back on our bed. The Air Conditioner did not work. When we called they told us to open a window. The fridge was broken and we were told none of them in any room work.

title: Top Location. Needs renovations.
text: The Hotel is located in the Financial District of Manhattan and has perfect access to the public transport. The rooms are very outdated and it feels like a 1990s experience. The staff is very nice but without renovations, I cannot recommend the hotel.

title: A relatively good value
text: NYC hotels are pricey, but when staying downtown I would select this hotel again. The restaurant was temporarily closed, which is inconvenient for a business traveler. But overall the location and facility makes it worth the cost.

title: Great location, good room layout, tired furnishings
text: My wife and I stay in this hotel several times a year due to its location near family.  We always rent the Jr. Suite as we're usually here for a week or more.  We love the layout of the room and the views of the Hudson and One World Trade are fantastic. The two areas that are lacking is in the quality of the room's furnishings (excepting the bed which is always good) and the impossibly long checkin/checkout process (there is almost always a long line and issues at the counter).

title: Wonderful staff shame about the rest
text:
Left alot to be desired. Description does not tally with actual room. Dirty curtains stained floors,broken safe
There is no restaurant so all food has to be either eaten out or brought back. Fridges taken away ,unable to use for drinks etc. Bed repaired but dangerous metal bar sticking out.
Staff were lovely

title: Good location but zero amenities
text:
This hotel is ideally located near the 911 Memorial and Eataly.  
Hotel security at night was excellent, and the concierge staff was very helpful.
King room was basic:  we had no chair in our room.
Hotel does not have a bar, no restaurant, no shop to buy any snacks or drinks, and it has no vending machines.

title: Neal D. Frishberg
text: My stay was disappointing.  The room was either too cold because the window was open and the heat would not work.  I needed a pen, and the room did not have a pen.  Parking is a big issue.  The hotel should partner with the lot around the corner or other nearby lots. There is no hot tub or pool which was a big draw for me.

title: No room maintanence
text: Great location, things won't work or be fixed in your hotel room.We reported broken mini refrigerator, phone and safe not working on our arrival and never saw anyone to fix them the week we stayed. They do not appear to have a maintenance department.

title: disgusting/deaf ears
text: stains on the floor; peeling wall paper; door lock broken; remote control broken. Three complaints and not one of them addressed. Called the first two nights. Upon checking out, told desk mgr, he had no notes of my complaint.

title: Luxury hotel building budget hotel amenities
text: Great views and comfortable beds but hotel is a little tired around the edges.  Scratchy towels (only 2 per room) and bathroom was a little worn.  Bigger surprise was the lack of any restaurant or onsite food service. Room service was served in takeout containers.  Just lost the Hilton brand, hopefully this is a transitional problem as they rebrand.  Great location - I’d stay here again on business trip but not on vacation.

title: Comfortable bed, might be OK when they get round to opening properly
text:
The hotel seems to have opened in haste, or perhaps bought in poor condition and not refurbished.
Our room had a refrigerator that was still in out-of-the-box condition - ie not fully assembled and never plugged in. One armchair and one 'office chair', ie height-adjustable. Either pre-loved or broken, set at desk-use height it gracefully lowers as one sits. For a modern hotel, far too few electrical supply sockets.
Signage suggests a restaurant and bar on the 3rd floor. There is a room with tables and chairs but no sign of life, not notices suggesting any opening hours. In the room a sheet offering 'in-room breakfast', but "orders will be delivered in To-Go packaging", so it seems no food other than a takeaway breakfast. The reception area has just two individual toilets - not well planned for a hotel that expects arrivals of groups who have perhaps sat in a bus for a couple of hours. Another two are hidden on the 3rd floor but reception doesn't point this out.
Good location, but not recommended.

title: Great Location. Rooms Long in the Tooth
text:
Fantastic location. Only double beds - NOT AT ALL FIT FOR FAMILIES.

Rooms were dirty, grimy with coffee stains all around - even up on the walls! NO beverages on site at all so plan ahead unless you feel like taking a bucket of ice from the machine and melting it with a hair dryer for a drink of water.

title: One of my favorites
text: Lovely hotel but pricey then others. Incidental fees  are a hundred dollars a night, which is more than it was when this hotel was part of the Hilton brand,  But I love it , and it’s location so I’ll be back.

title: Sticking with Marriott
text:
Hotel parking garage was closed and had to circle the block looking for a parking garage while no one answered repeated calls to the hotel to assist. 
Rooms are tired and feel like a college dormitory
Bar and restaurant are closed. Not sure what the story is there.
Unlike major chain hotels, did not receive itemized bill via email until had to call multiple times.

title: De Excelencia
text:
Calidad en el servicio, cuarto limpio, estética excelente, vigilancia las 24 horas, los 7 días a la semana. Vista espectacular. Trato de alto nivel, de parte de los trabajadores. 
Se repite la estadía como lugar fijo para quedarme.

title: Never again , but nice view
text: Took this trip for my birthday had stayed here several times& really loved this hotel until now. Room was small , no mini bar or refrigerator that worked , no microwave , no alarm clock , towels & shower curtain unclean & someone’s hair in bathtub , when complained was told we are in process of updating , but why on my dime. Hotel changed hands is now owned by Hyatt so your Hilton membership doesn’t work here anymore . The only thing nice about the room was the view & location , I do not recommend staying here you may get a nice room or you may not crap shoot , For a lot of money ☹️

title: Great location and views!
text: Location was perfect - close to everything. Great accessibility to subway and nearby restaurants. Rooms could use some updating but we were comfortable and slept well, and didn’t come to NY to stay in our rooms all day anyway. Front desk staff was friendly and helpful. Would choose this hotel again.

title: An old hotel with obvious cleaning problems
text:
Hotel room is not state of the art anymore. Super old carpet. But more important: long and short dark hair in the shower, bathroom, and livingroom. And I have blonde hair. 
Window bench wasn’t clean at all. It looked like there were coke poured over

title: No ofrece lo que se ve en las fotos
text: La habitación es pequeña para lo solicitado (3 adultos, 1 menor), sofa cama incómodo, el colchón ya esta curvo! El uso de refrigerador (frigo-bar) y del estacionamiento tiene costo extra. Nuestra habitación no tenía ninguna de las vistas que promocionan en las fotos, y eso que se solicitó un Up grade de la habitación. La ubicación del hotel es buena y el personal amable.

title: Clean room but a bit tired
text: Hotel is in a great location. Had a suite with fantastic views of 9/11 memorial and city.  Very clean rooms, but the decor is a bit tired.  There are no refrigerators in room, and the restaurant/bar on the premises is currently closed, but there are certainly great restaurants within walking distance. Easy access to subway.

title: Great location and view- OK service
text: Great location and view was phenomenal! Service was ok; Junior City Suite Room booked for 4 people but no beddings supplied for the Pull-Out Sofa. Had to call twice to ask for the items (first the front desk then housekeeping) but only got sheet covers. We were tired after a long day of sightseeing our teens ended up using cushions as pillows so they can sleep which ended up to be uncomfortable. For the price we paid for the room and the number of guests listed on the reservation, hotel service should have provided the beddings to accommodate the maximum number of guests listed for that room.

title: Nice hotel, great location, HIDDEN FEES!!
text:
Have stayed at this hotel before.  This time WiFi service was so slow as to be almost non-existent. Never received our bill either at or after check out.  When charge hit credit card,  noticed rate charged was higher than anticipated.  it seems there is a $30 per night 'Facility Fee'  tacked on, not listed in the per room price.  What is that for?  Believe it or not it is for:  the very slow WiFi, for having a phone in your room  (we have cell phones), a single Citi bike pass (??!!) and access to the fitness center (was it even open??).
I abhor hidden fees.
We will not stay at another Millennium property.
PS - they are no longer part of Hilton.  I knew that at time of booking but enjoyed staying there before.  We won't be back.

title: Very pleasantly surprised
text: We just spent 5 night in the Millenium hotel. I had read lots of reviews about the hotel on tripadvisor before travelling and was apprehensive. As soon as we arrived we were welcomed by the attentive door men and although we were too early to check in the receptionist took all our details so when we came back at 4 we just had to grab the keys. The room on 19th floor had an unbelievable view. The room was very spacious, bed was huge. The bathroom had a bath and shower and was clean. We arrived back everyday to a clean, tidy room with fresh water and coffee facilities. We could not fault the cleanliness and staff of this hotel as we had read on other reviews. Location is also amazing with shops, restaurants and subway easily accessible. We would 100% stay here again.

title: Very good location for south manhattan
text: This hotel offers a good location and an amazing view on the World Trade Center. Quiet and clean rooms. But no access to the restaurant or to the pool, since it has re open. You have to take breakfast in your room. I don't understand why...

title: Disappointed
text: Very disappointed with broken/construction and no disclousare upfront. Closed pool, closed parking lot which made me go around looking crazy for parking that accepted my truck and also restaurant was closed which made me get up extra early to go for a nice place to eat

title: MONTANT PRÉLEVER 2 FOIS
text:
Chambres superbes 
Mais à prélever 2 fois le montant de la chambre (1 fois payer sur internet, et une deuxième fois à l’arrivée a l’hôtel on nous a demandé notre carte en nous disant que rien ne sera prélever car nous avions vérifié et bien précise avec le personnel que nous avions déjà payé ) et nous l’hôtel ne nous rembourse toujours pas après plusieurs appel

title: Great locazione, potrebbe maintenance
text: The Millennium is one of those NY hotel which lure you for the lobby look, shiny and fascinating, while rooms are shabbily furnished and lack of maintenance. The sofa bed, which we did not use, was so dirty that it could well stay in an underground station. Everything was outdated, from the bathroom to the lights. Great views of the skyline outside, anyway, notwithstanding the dirty windows

title: WILL SURELY COME BACK
text:
The position is perfect (close to many attractions and to Fulton St Subway) the view from the 48th floor amazing, Petra at the desk extremely nice helping us out when we encountered a little problem.
Will surely come back

title: Perfect stay
text:
thanks for your service 
nice room condition, nice staff, nice view with reasonable price
location was also good and convenience
especially, the night view was perfect 
hope to visit again if I travel nyc

title: Great view only
text: The front desk was understaffed at check-in, only one clerk working. The bathroom had a musty smell that permeated the room. The chair was soiled and torn, which was unfortunate because it would have been a good place to sit. The bed sheet was ripped. Other than that, the view was great.

title: Spring break 2022
text: Love the smell of the hotel lobby! Location very convenient close to everything and accessible for transportation and not too noisy. I feel safe in the area.. Bellman is so helpful! Save us for taking Uber and suggested to take Yellow taxi. The staff is kind and nice!

title: The far side of the expected
text: We booked a De Luxe Double bedroom including breakfast - We got 2 tiny beds with double pillows and after some discussion an additional sofa bed. The advertised swimming pool was not existing, at all. The breakfast option was denied upon arrival. More disapointments then good stories to tell

title: Great hotel and staff
text: The Millennium Hotel in downtown is amazing. The staff is nice and pleasant. They made sure I had an comfortable stay and they answered all of my questions. The view from my was great, the hotel is close to everything. There are tons of restaurants nearby and we’ll connected with public transportation. The room was clean and the bed was comfortable.

title: What a view!
text:
Great location, amazing staff, great attitude and service. Hotel needs a bit a love in the bedrooms, update on rugs, lighting and to cool the rooms. 
The view and location are worth the stay! They were flexible!

title: Great stay at the Millennium Downtown NYC
text: Very nice hotel, great location. I got there 5 hours earlier than check in and they gave me a room right away. The staff was very nice, everything was easy and smooth. The room was old but spacious and clean. Amazing view of the city. SO nice.  King comfy bed, nice washroom. The only thing that wasn't working was the mini fridge which I wasn't gonna use anyway.  If you are planning on hanging out in the lower manhattan area it's a very good option.

title: Great option for a family needing extra space
text:
Stayed her for a springtime trip to the city with our two children. The Junior Suite was perfect for us with a king bed and sleeper sofa in a separate area. Bedroom area was on a corner, and offered a beautiful view of the WTC site and river (we were on the 33rd floor). Room was very quiet. Hotel was conveniently located near WTC, subway, Eataly, and Battery Park.

Some reviewers have indicated the hotel is dated. Our room was pleasant enough and clean, overall though the carpets are in desperate need of replacement. Pack your slippers.

Downside was the restaurant is not open, and the breakfast dining credit that came with our reservation was a joke. $25 won't get you anything to eat by the time the taxes and fees are stacked on. I'd skip that package in the future, as there are plenty of great, affordable breakfast spots in the area.

title: Worst hotel I’ve ever stayed at in Manhattan
text:
I just stayed at this hotel for one night. My experience was already tainted when I went to check in and the only had one person at the front desk. 

The room was lack luster at best.  There were stains on the carpet, a leaky shower faucet, a tissue box that had two tissues and a bathroom sink area with rust spots all over it. 

I’d say the best part of it was the location and the view, which is great, but takes no effort on the hotel’s part for upkeep. It’s no wonder that Hilton ditched it. 

I still don’t understand how you only have one staff member checking people in at check-in time, with no other staff that can even assist customers in sight.

Maybe it was worth $150-200 a night, but definitely not $300.  The Hampton Inn down the street would have been a much better choice.

Good luck.

title: Not as good as it used to be.
text: I have stayed here in the past (pre-covid) when it was a Hilton property. You can clearly see a difference now. No bar/lounge. No restaurant. Towels are rock hard and like sandpaper, and overall the place is starting to feel dated. However the location is great. The view is great. The staff were friendly and helpful.

title: Très bien situé mais un peu vieillissant ... et problème niveau remboursement !
text: Le séjour s'est très bien passé, l'hôtel est très bien situé avec pas mal de métro à côté qui permet de se rendre partout dans Manhattan, Brooklyn et même vers Statten Island (Ferry pas très loin). La chambre bénéficiait d'une vue magnifique (bien demander une chambre dans les étages élevés si possible ..) mais elle demandait à être rafraichit (moquette pas très propre, salle de bain un peu vielle avec rideau de douche un peu sale en bas ...), la télé, pour le peu qu'elle a été utilisé, ne fonctionnait pas correctement ... pour un prix comme on le paye on s'attend quand même à un meilleur standing ... Jusqu'ici tout va bien, le vrai problème était au retour : l'hôtel, qui nous avait gardé une caution de plus de 300 € par chambre pour 3 nuits, devait nous les restituer dans les 30 jours après départ ... nous sommes partit du 18 au 21 février , à ce jour (6 avril) toujours rien ! Nous essayons de contacter l'hôtel par le biais de notre agence et nous n'avons pas de réponses ! C'est inacceptable ... Nous attendons maintenant une réponse de la part de l'hôtel et bien entendu la rétribution de notre argent...

title: Run, don't walk from this hotel!!
text: Where do I start?   No restaurant, lobby, or in-room service.  None.   Teas, coffee, even toilet paper, are doled out in the room like war time rationing,   However, their bellman was all to eager to grab my bags while I was in my cab, paying the fare, and scurry into the hotel, without checking with me if I wanted him to grab my bags and, if I did, whether he got everything of mine.   My backpack was full of passports, computer, etc. so I made a dash to catch him.   When I realized he didn't have my expensive coat, I turned to find the taxi gone, my coat in tow.   Of course, the hotel did nothing for me.   Do yourself a favor, STAY AWAY!!!

title: Awful
text: Check in went relatively smooth as we checked in at 2am.  But the lobby smelled of marijuana.  Upon opening our room the door was filthy on the outside and the smell was terrible inside.   The carpet had way too many stains and just looked gross. The sofa bed was disgusting and I hated that my children had to sleep on it!  There were no pillows or blankets for them either.  The phone did not work to call the front and the lock on the door did not work.  We had to use the deadbolt only.  The whole night we smelled the marijuana smell and our kids asthma was flared up.  I would not recommend this hotel to anyone with kids or with asthma or anyone who cares about cleanliness.  I was incredibly disappointed in what we got for the price we had to pay! Thank goodness we were only there one night!

title: Top Notch All the Way!
text: If you are looking for the best place to house your team and leadership in the NY financial district and hold meetings, then look no further: the Millennium Downtown New York Hotel is your place. Specifically, their sales, special services, catering, and AV/IT teams are ready to serve, and at a moment's notice, too! They are professional, responsive, and know their areas of expertise. The property is posh and I can't say enough positive things about it! Because of our positive experience, I will be booking with the Millennium team again.

title: No longer a Hilton and it shows
text:
I used to stay at this location quite frequently, due to its proximity to my office.  However, my office moved to mid-town years back and I have not stayed at the Millennium recently, until the other week.

The hotel has gone down-hill since being sold off by Hilton.  I witnessed rude staff behavior towards guests upon check-in, the rooms are severely outdated, the lobby bar is closed (may be covid related), no air conditioning in the room, and to top it off, I was woken up multiple times during my 3-night stay to the smells of weed coming through from the next room over.

Additionally, its taken me three calls to the hotel to receive my invoice via email, which was requested at the time of check out.

I do not suggest staying here.....once upon time, yes...but this hotel no longer meets Hilton standards.

title: NYC downtown hotel
text:
Super view! 
Extra location to visit NYC 

Recommended 55 floor of hotel

Poor breakfast and not so good coffee
 We are waiting over 1h to check in  from booking reservation.

 Crew very helpful all other's  ok .
!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

title: Poor standards, spare yourself any disappointment
text:
This review pertains to the junior suite I stayed in.  I booked for 4 nights but upon arrival realised I had made a huge mistake.  The pictures on their website were not the true reflection of the junior suite I stayed in.  The carpets had stains and were buckling up.  The furniture was very scratched up not something you would expect in a hotel of this caliber.  The sofa bed was very worn especially on the arm rest. The carpets in the hotel entrance were just as shabby.  The curtains were falling of the tracks.  They are not transparent about their hotel rates and when you get there, they tell you about facility charges etc which was never mentioned when I  booked on their website.  I was confused what facilities there were referring to.  They collect all this, and cannot put decent furniture in there?
They really do need to renovate the rooms in this hotel.  I  could not stay another night in this down trodden junior suite.  I had to cut my stay short.

title: Buena ubicación, pésima experiencia.
text:
Aunque el hotel está bien ubicado (al frente del 9/11 Memorial, el hotel está LEJOS de ser lo que ofrecen:

1. A pesar que en algunos vuscadores diga que es HILTON, ya no lo es y está lejos de serlo.

Las habitaciones están viejas y hay un olor constante a humedad y a tabaco. 

2. La atención del personal es PÉSIMA. No están dispuestas a ayudar a los huéspedes. Contestan de mala gana a las preguntas. No saben dar respuestas a preguntas básicas (i.e. dónde está el baño del lobby o por qué no arreglaron mi habitación). Pareciera que no quisieran trabajar o que no les pagarán.

3. Hacen cargos a la tarjeta de crédito que se da como garantía sin preguntar. 

4. Durante una de las 4 noches que estuve NO arreglaron mi habitación, a pesar que salí desde las 9am y volví hasta las 8pm. Cuando pregunté, literalmente me dijeron: "qué quiere que hagamos si ya el house keeping se fue". Tuve que llamar dos veces más y bajar a hablar con la manager del hotel para que al menos recogieran la basura y me cambiaran las toallas.

5. Con la excusa del Covid no hay restaurantes abiertos ni siquiera para desayunar. Ofrecen un room service de desayuno carisimo.

6. La tarifa que yo contraté a través de una agencia incluía desayuno. Cuando hice check in me dijeron que no incluía y me tocó quejarme con mi agencia para que aceptaran incluirlo. Al check out pretendieron cobrarmelo otra vez y tuve que quejarme para que lo eliminaran.

En resumen, una pésima experiencia que no recomiendo a nadie que quiera pasar un rato tranquilo y agradable en NY.

title: You get what you pay for  (so how desperate are you?)
text:
Check-in was fine, staff was friendly. 

Overheard another couple in the elevator complaining that the air conditioning in their room wasn't working (it's March but it was humid and 70 degrees today). Get to my room and, sure enough, my AC doesn't work either. 

Went to take a shower and the bathroom was not clean. Shower curtain smells mildewy, and worst of all there is a big clump of hair (like from a hair clog in the drain) on the tile wall of the shower. Gross.

Oh and when I went to have a drink at the bar, it was closed. At 7:00 p.m.

Would not stay here again.

title: Hotel review
text:
We booked hotel through Virgin. We arrived on 5 th March late evening, to discover Virgin had not paid accommodation due to hotel changing name from millennium Hilton to millennium. Virgin office was closed and despite evidence of our booking, we were told very abruptly we could not be checked in until Virgin pay hotel. The option given was too pay for stay upfront. We were then left in lobby watching another couple have same experience!!
After a hour we paid for one night stay in the hope Virgin would resolve issue following day.
We were charged 200 dollars before being checked in. We were told when virgin paid hotel, our money would be refunded. 5 days later we are still waiting refund!! ..
Virgin paid bill and requested room upgrade. Upon entering new room, we discovered TV did not work and waited 24 hrs for new part to be ordered.
The only member of staff to speak to us was the cleaner, who was extremely friendly!!
We at to ask for room to be made up, for basics, such as teabags, coffee, cups. 
I’ve never met such unwelcoming front of house staff!! ….
The hotel was clean, though in need of new carpets and decorating in corridors. 
We won’t be staying again!!

title: Double check your deposit will be refunded before you leave
text: The deposit was taken, not refunded to the card so we had to ring the hotel from the UK costing £200. We are still waiting for a reply for the hotel to reimburse the phone bill cost for their mistake!

title: Worst stay- fraud charges
text: I stayed here for fashion week and we had to change rooms bc the one we were in looked like someone died in… everything else was ok until 2 weeks after chew out where I got 5 charges for no reason and no deposit returned. Racheal the manager was super rude and hung up when I expressed my concerns and how I have to cancel my CC now and the only way to get my money back is to do a fraud investigation. DO NOT STAY HERE. the hotel was great until Hilton but it’s not a Hilton anymore and they are shady people looking to get all the money in anyway.

title: Needs a lot of work
text:
Booked this hotel because my brother in law worked for Hilton. We arrived on Feb 10th to be informed that our reservation that we made back in October had been canceled because Hilton sold the hotel. We were told that all customers had been emailed. We never received one. Thankfully the very unfriendly woman at the counter was able to get us two rooms that were needed.

The positive:

You can't beat the location! Great view and steps away from the WTC and the Oculus.
The view from our room was amazing!
The price

The Negative:

The lobby smelled like weed everyday we were there.
No door man. At some point a woman walked into the lobby, pulled down her pants, sat on a table and peed all over the place.
The rooms are extremely dated. We were supposed to have a chair in the room but it was missing, handles off of doors, stains all over the carpets. To be fair, I felt the room was somewhat clean. The cleaning staff were the nicest people working in the hotel.

Most likely won't stay here again but we come here a lot to visit family and my husband always wanted to try it. One and done for us.

title: Fantastic place
text:
We visited December for 4 nights. It was the second time we stayed in this hotel. We stayed on the 45th floor and the views of the Twin towers memorial were breath taking, not to mention everything else you can see. Friendly and efficient receptionists. Fewer services available this time round due to covid but that cant be helped. Room was clean and bed was comfy. Bathroom big with all amenities you could need. Easy access to subways outside to take you into midtown. Taxis outside. Ice cream van outside 😋
The only reason i wont be returning anytime soon is there isnt room for my children to have the same room as me.

title: The worst hotel for cleanliness and service I have ever stayed in!
text: My husband and I recently stayed at the above hotel for a 4 night stay 26/01/22 - 30/01/22 and I can only say how disgusted I was at my treatment and cleanliness of the hotel. On arrival at the hotel I advised the receptionist the rate she was charging me was incorrect and was assured it would be sorted. When we entered the room we were pleasantly surprised with the size and although a bit dated appeared clean on the surface. I woke up during the night and could smell vomit, but could not put my finger on from where, we went out and got on with our day, I had forgotten about this when we got back, however again when I woke up during the night it was awful, I switched the light on and noticed splashing on the headboard and the smell was overpowering!! We went to reception and advised the receptionist who advised us the room would be cleaned whilst we were out. On return the smell hit us as we walked through the bedroom door, out from the bedroom I to the sitting room area, in disgust I went to reception and asked the chap behind the desk for someone to come up to the room, to smell it, he advised me the housekeeper would be up, 1 hour later no one had been up so I went back down and asked a different chap why no one had been up, he just advised us we could change room, I explained I wanted the room to be checked, he was more than rude and advised me the room would have to go of for deep cleaning and handed me the keys to a new room, my question to him was why wasn't it deep cleaned before our arrival, he shrugged his shoulders! We moved to the new room exactly the same room only at a different side of the hotel, as I placed something on the window shelf I noticed there was hard icing like product dried into the shelf, I went back to the reception and asked for a different person to speak with, the same rude chap came out with another chap at his side, I informed them about the icing sugar and asked why this room hadn't been deep cleaned either, the chap said they would have to look into it, however as the room had no smell and it was 8.30pm by this time I didn't want to move again, so stayed put,. When I woke up in the morning and went for a bath I noticed something hanging on a pipe under the sink vanity unit, on deeper inspection I realised it was a dirty pair of ladies knickers!! I duly put them into a sanitary bag and went back to reception, where I was met with by a very pleasant chap who agreed the whole Cary on was not acceptable by any standards and he would look into it and make sure the room was deep cleaned whilst we were out!! We came back at 7pm that evening and although the room had been serviced it had certainly not been deep cleaned as the icing sugar was still on the window shelf!! As this was our last evening we could not be bothered chasing this up. On check out the next morning we were not met with any resolution/apologies/recompense to our issues in fact there was no mention of any of our issues, we were presented with our bill, again we were still being charged the incorrect price for which I had to send my copy email to prove my rate!! I can only say how deeply disappointing the service and cleanliness of this hotel was from start to finish, the cleanliness advisory re covid and cross contamination statement for COVID was absolutely not followed, no apology or recompense was offered, disgusting, as a reservation/reception manager for 20 years in a small group of hotels in Scotland, this would never have been acceptable standards in normal times let alone covid times!! Since our return I have emailed both the hotel and Hilton head office and neither have had the good grace to reply! Disgusting!!

title: Both rooms and reservations system Needs a good facelift
text:
Rooms need to be updated
Light fixtures over the bed have wires exposed and lamps don’t work.  Bedding is old

Reservations system does  not accept reservations made before the sale of this hotel from Hilton 
The front desk clerk was able to get me a room but was very apologetic

title: Would never stay there
text:
Hotel change the brand from hilton to millienium Hotels, so i want to cancel my reservation. Contact the Hotel twice for my reservation, but i got no answer. 

 Very bad for a Hotel. Would never stay there

title: Mystery Stains and Condom
text: Checked into this hotel around 7pm day of arrival and the front desk had a long line of folks complaining about various issues and there was no door man around to help us get our luggage that we dropped off earlier in the day.  Eventually we get into the room which appeared to be fine, just not updated in awhile.   The next morning when we get light into the room we find stains all over the floor and bed, hair in the bed, and a condom in the room provided.   Luckily we were able to quickly find a very nice hotel at a similar rate (the Marlton Hotel, very nice) and we checked to call our travel agency when we got back to get a refund.  Turns out the attendant at the front desk didn't check us out as requested and charged us for the full stay. Attached is a photo of the most prominent stain and "the condom".

title: Dirty, smelly, unfriendly.
text: Room had a whole wall coming off with black mold. Second room had a horrible cigarette smell that even penetrated all of the clothes in our luggage. Reported our troubles with the staff but literally everyone that we encountered was Very unfriendly and rude. Do Not stay here!!

title: Spooked
text: Room was very filthy. You could feel the springs through the mattress. Located in a non desired area, across the street from a cemetery. Pictures on website very deceiving. Did not stay. Moved to another hotel in midtown.

title: Nice stay but this hotel will soon no longer be a Hilton
text: I had a great check in experience today and was given a nice corner suite by the friendly woman at reception for being a Hilton Honors gold member.  Unfortunately this hotel is outdated and not up to Hilton standards but it is still a good hotel. Remember 10 years ago this hotel probably had never ending streams of international businessmen paying $300+ per night. Different times. The views are amazing and the room is nice but dated. When returning this evening I greeted a man at reception presumably the manager who seemed to be in deep thoughts he returned the greeting. I would recommend staying here if you are not a Hilton honors member.

title: Exceptional view, terrible breakfast benefit
text: The rooms are dated, exceptional view from high floors is reason enough to staying at this hotel.  Rooms are generously spacious for New York hotels.   The huge disappointment is the availability of using food credit.   Food credit can only be used toward room service which incurs room service delivery fee.  Then add the high food prices and you’d be ending up $20-$40 poorer per person.  Classic price gauging as they have every intent to discourage and paying out any benefit.  Management should be shameful.

title: Definitely not going back
text:
I'm gonna start with the only 2 things that like: the view and the location (easily accessible by transport) 

Besides that, the downward spiral begins... 
When we arrived they made us pay for both rooms separately even though it was the same reservation. The first receptionist wasn't helpful at all.

The pictures of the rooms were embellishing the reality. By the looks of our rooms, I don't think the hotel had been renovated in a long time (I'll say late 90's and early 2000's and I'm being generous. There was no phone in the room I was in, nor fridge, slippers, even the electrical outlets were hard to find.
The beds were too small for 2 adults. Under one of them, we found a dental protector and dust while looking for an electric socket. 

Since we arrived we notified them on multiple occasions that the breakfast was included in the reservation for the 5 of us (meaning we already paid for it). When we were leaving, I noticed on the invoice that they charged us for all them - every breakfast everyday per person (and wasn't event that good). 
The icing on the cake: now, she's telling me only 2 breakfasts per room are allowed... even though you can book a room with 3 people in it.
Long story short, there was no manager onsite (supposedly arriving at 2PM and never did, because yes we stayed that long until we couldn't), they charged us for the breakfast for 1 person.

This hotel do not deserve the price we paid for it nor the 4 stars. I guess it's all in the name of the brand.

title: Great views, average amenities
text:
This hotel has amazing views of the Hudson River and the 9/11 memorial and Oculus. The staff are warm and welcoming. 

However, the rooms had some small problems with light fixtures by the bed being slightly broken, and the temperature of the water in the shower was constantly fluctuating. The hotel also didn’t offer many additional amenities due to Covid. 

Would recommend upgrading to have parking included in reservation, it was off site and was a $40 increase per night but saved us money overall.

title: Excellent location but staff was not courteous
text: Location was great, staff not courteous at all. Room was OK but old rug and dated bathroom. Overall good stay but for such a brand and name, It didn’t meet was expectation. Customer service leave a lot to be desired.

title: We’ll overdue for an overhaul
text: Everything in the room  is outdated, very dirty carpets, poor water pressure in the shower, bathroom is from the last century , room not properly cleaned. Hilton promoted digital check in and key didn’t work.  An extra star for great views

title: Dated and smelly room, no amenities.
text: I used to love this hotel. Hadn’t stayed there in about 5 years.  Room smelled like mildew. We couldn’t get the temperature of the room below 72, so we actually opens a window on Dec 30.  Understand some restaurants are still not open, but only place to purchase a soda or juice is 3 blocks away at a CVS.

title: Top Lage, aber sonst…..
text:
Ich habe an der Ankunft eine Kaution von 450$ hinterlegt. Man versicherte mir, ich würde es ein paar Tage nach der Abreise zurück auf mein Konto bekommen. Leider ist bis am 5-6 Tag noch nicht das Geld zugesendet worden. Emails werden ignoriert. 
Das Personal war meistens bis auf ein paar Ausnahmen äußerst freundlich. 
Die Aussicht und die Lage war hervorragend! Die Zimmer etwas vom alten Stil, etwas in die Jahre gekommen und nicht modern.

title: Detta forna ganska fina hotell har förvandlats till ett hostel med otrevlig personal utan ambitioner.
text: Så tragiskt att se ett förfall av detta på ytan fina hotell som en gång i tiden var bra. Ingen frukost ingen mat otrevlig och ovillig personal. Vi hade bäddsoffa för en ungdom, som 1)trasig säng. 2) när vi frågar om bäddning från soffa-Det får ni göra själva.

title: Horrible hotel
text: The rooms are nasty, horrible customer service. They did not even have a bottled water in the hotel. Not even a vending machine to get water. Had to melt ice to drink as all stores around were closed. I’m sturdy bed with carpet stains. Just felt filthy staying there paying around $300 a night. The only thing they can brag about is the location. Please do not stay here

title: Très beau mais vieillissant
text:
Nous étions logé au 46 eme étage de la tour avec une vue sur le pont de Brooklyn, sur le world Trade center et le Trump Building ! Super beau de jour comme de nuit. Le lit est confortable et la chambre spacieuse et fonctionnelle. 
Le petit hic est que la chambre est un peu vieillissante, la décoration est un peu vieillotte.
Et le gros point positif est sa proximité immédiate avec quasiment toute les lignes de métro à 15 mètre en sortant de l’hôtel !

title: Bad Experience
text: Hotel room was a totally, and I mean totally. Different version from the advertisement online. Wasn’t anything sweet about my suite. Bed spread was not clean, furniture, carpet n blinds in the room are old. What a way too spend my first Christmas away from home 😞😢😫

title: Stay here only if you need its great location
text:
If location and convenient is your top priority, this is a good option as it's right across street from the Oculus and 911 Memorial in downtown NYC and within 10 minutes walking distance to Wall Street.

If not, I would recommend staying elsewhere. The room is old from 1980's.  The bell desk service was great.  The front desk service standard, neither exceptionally good or impressive nor terribly bad.  

The lobby makes you feel like a 4.0-star hotel, but the room felt like a 2.5 star. The hotel probably would still get away from making the rooms better because of its attractive location.

We appreciate the location convenience but feel hesitant recommending it to anyone unless you absolutely need its location.

title: Yes but hurry
text: As bucket list to see New York at Christmas the trip and stay at the Millennium were great . Beautiful room, great view as typical for Hilton . However an early arrival before the room was ready we asked to use restroom. The reply was yes it’s on the 4th floor but you need to hurry.  That’s NYC !

title: Great views, tired and worn hotel
text:
Great location, large rooms and decent service bit the hotel is badly in need of an update.   Restaurant and bar are both closed and pool is also closed due to covid.  Views are exceptional and the hotel was clean.
Carpets, lighting and room furnishings are all very dated, chipped, worn and in need of replacement.  Hoping this property will be updated soon as it has been a great place to stay in the past.

title: Close to One World Trade
text: Good hotel. Safe and clean! Would suggest if you are doing 9/11 memorial visit. Great shopping mall right across the street. Super close to subway and a quick shot straight to or from Grand Central. It won’t be in the Hilton family much longer. That’s the only bummer.
